reviews.review: Fantastic would highly recommend even for oldies. This was really well organised and excellent value. Wedit intend to buy photos but couldn't resist. This is a must yo do on your trip to Mexico

Swimming with the dolphins. My husband and I swam, played, and interacted with the dolphins at Delphinus Xcaret while we were on our honeymoon in Mexico. The transportation at our resort was slightly delayed, however Delphinus reimbursed us and we were very pleased. The experience with the dolphins is something we will never forget! The trainers were very knowledgeable and made the experience fun and memorable. We loved Delphinus!

Rip off. To start with a positive, the actual experience of swimming with a dolphin was incredible. It's obvious the dolphins are well cared for and happy; their enclosure area is quite big and is clean, they are always being fed plenty of fish by the trainers.The basic dolphin swimming package at Xcaret is $99 per person, but we managed to negotiate this down to $70 per person without any trouble. Our experience lasted for 30 minutes.We got to do a few tricks with our dolphin, Luara(?), and she was very friendly and calm. Her trainer was professional and was good at keeping everybody in our group (8 people) involved.Amateur photographers with expensive cameras take photos and videos of you whilst swimming with the dolphin, which brings me on to the point that ruined our experience...When we had finished our 30 minute experience which cost a total of $140, we were invited to visit the office to see the photographs and have the option to buy them. To be honest, for $140 I expected at least a few photographs to be included in that price, but unfortunately none were included. We were told that we could buy 1 photo for $40 or buy a CD with all 46 photos on for $129! It's outrageous you think it's fair to charge these prices when everyone who swims with the dolphins here has already spent almost $200 at Xcaret per person.After speaking to several staff in the Delphinus office / photography studio and expressed my disgust at these prices, I managed to negotiate buying the CD with all 46 photos, two 6" x 4" prints and two wooden photo frames for $70. Even at this price I was begrudged to pay for them as I know how much it would have cost them to provide these things (about $5 - $10). One of the staff actually told me they knew we could only get those photos from them so they like to take advantage of that fact! One of the staff also told me not to tell anybody else about the "deal" I got for our photos because it was too cheap (really?) and they didn't want other people asking for the same price - so I have told as many people as I can because even at $70 it is the same price I paid to actually swim with the dolphin!

Disappointing . I have to say that with regret I left feeling incredibly let down and utterly shocked. I bought the package for my friend and I to have a "once in a life time" experience swimming with dolphins. As much as when we actually had a chance to swim with the dolphins as enjoyable as it was, I feel the rest of the experience was, at best a huge let down. The package I was sold was $139 per person. For this we received a silver package where we would be picked up from our hotel and then swim with dolphins in a group of 4 therefore maximising the time and experience for us. This in actual fact was 3 groups of 4 people sharing 3 dolphins. Now where I understand this may sound a bit pig headed, I may as well have paid for the experience of swimming with 8 other people at a lot less of a cost as everything in the experience was dependant on what the other small group had done so most of our time was spent bobbing around whilst a dolphins swam amount us. Where all the instructors around the water were nice I have to be honest and say as a customer I felt more as though I was on a conveyor-belt. They were more interested in seeing if the other groups had finished so they could swap the dolphins around. I understand that dolphins are alive and they need to be rested and what have you, however I was lead to believe we would be treated to a 1 to 1 experience that wouldn't be forgotten. To top this when we were lead to see the photographs we were told the price which I have to say was disgusting. And still now feel rather amazed and shocked that you ask for as much as you do. You as a company I understand have to make a profit so you're able to run a business. However paying $139 for the experience alone was I feel extremely expensive for what we actually had, to then be told we would have to pay $40 for 1 picture or $129 for 12 pictures ruined my and my friends entire experience. To which at this point I walked out outraged that you charge this much money. To make matters worse we were told under no circumstance could we take picture ourselves although the other people in the other groups had their family members in spectating areas taking pictures who because they were children were bumped up to the best package for free for safety concerns as no adult was with them. This to me added insult to the whole experience. I probably will never swim with dolphins ever again. I wanted to have a memory of something special for my friend and to take home and remember but all I and my friend are taking now is a memory of feeling cheated, and to be blunt utterly ripped off.  Such a shame to end on this note. Kind regards AJ

Honeymoon swim. Unbelievable. Our two dolphins, Miranda and Maqual, were only youngsters in training but behaved impeccably and things couldn't have gone smoother. Our trainer, Andrea, was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable, and the two dolphins obviously had a connection with her because they never misbehaved once. Andrea even made provision for my wife's slight disability in that she can only lift one of her arms above shoulder height and she never missed out on any of the activities.Fantastic.

Honeymoon swim with the dolphins!. Finally got a chance to swim with dolphins and it was simply incredible. Our amazing dolphin trainer Harry from Scotland to his perfectly trained partner "Cab", we truly enjoyed the experience. Thanks
Amazing experience!. Unbelievable interactive experience! Petting, foot push, swim, tricks, teeth brushing... Would go again and again.Purchase tickets at the park and save a $30. broker fee.

Fun and dolphin friendly. This was a fun activity, and they treat their dolphins much better than in other places in Cancun, they have a much bigger living and playing area, and the staff has a more animal friendly attitute.

Once in a lifetime....but expensive. This is the only reason we went to Xcaret. We had a memorable experience and it's clear that the staff and trainers care very much for the dolphins. Our experience (max 4 people, 45 mins) was worth the money as I got an online deal. What does let it down is the rip-off prices for photos and a video. £70 for a short video or £30 for a SINGLE photo is robbery! There's no discount on the photos: whether it's 1 or 10, they want £30 a go. As a result we bought a single photo for my daughter when really we'd have liked more...but not at that price.In my view, this Dolphins are about all that Xcaret has going for it...the rest of the park just doesn't justify the price.

Fun, but terribly expensive!. My daughter and I participated in the dolphin encounter at Xcaret a few days ago. We did the longer, more expensive encounter where you are in the water with them for 45 min and you get the foot push experience as well. Once we were in the water, it was pretty chaotic. There were several other groups of people doing dolphin encounters also in the same pool, and I felt crowded and rushed. We only had half the pool area to use since there were 2 other groups in the same pool. The trainers were all very nice and bilingual since the group had half English and half Spanish speakers. Petting and swimming with the dolphins & the foot push were all cool experiences, but not worth $150 per person. But...the real kicker is, after you get out, they herd you into a room and show you the pictures they took of you and your family. Of course most people will want to buy pics because you are not allowed to bring a camera or anything into the water with you. After you paid $150 to swim with dolphins you want a memory of it in picture or video form. However, the prices are RIDICULOUS! They only come in packages and range from $150-300!!!!!! For some pictures! It's a money trap that's for sure. Your standing there, soaking wet, want to go dry off, and the guy is hovering over you asking you which package you want to buy. You can't buy single pictures, at least that's what I was told, you have to buy a package, which start at $150. I reluctantly chose the $250 package since it had the video included, and he immediately took $50 off the price because I said wow, this is too expensive. I ended up with 2 big 8x10's of my choice, 2 nice wooden frames for the pics, the video, and the memory card with all the pics for $200. I know that is too much and that I was taken advantage of, but what are you gonna do? Your on vacation, you just swam with the dolphins, you want pics of your experience and they know it, and they got you. I would recommend looking elsewhere to swim with the dolphins while in Mexico, as this place was crazy expensive and overcrowded.

Dolphin adventure . We had a quick ride from Hardrock Riviera Maya. It was a beautiful day. The Dolphin adventure was perfect. We did the upgrade where we were in a group of 4. We got to do many activities with the Dolphins. Lots of video and pictures were taken. Activities like these are all about making memories. We had lots of memories made that day

2nd Visit Super Bad Customer Service In The Store. We have visited this place two times- in January 2015 and in August 2016. We have purchased the most expensive package for my husband, me and our 5 year old (including video and photos).Show is well done and dynamic. We all loved it. On our wayback, in 2015 we have picked up our video and photo materials just to discover at home that there was no video. I have to mention that this was almost $300.In 2016 we also visited the place and have spent $200 in the store + video. They charged us for the bag!!! Management should learn how to hire people with knowledge of at least basic English and to provide basic supplies for free (given the rest of the prices).On a top, if you wish your friends to take photos, keep in mind they will "enjoy" convinient far away location in the bushes.Management should also invest in better photo/ video equipment for expensive materials they sell.In summary- great swiming expirience with super bad management/ customer service.

Amazing experience. We visited as a family of 4, our children are 6yrs and 7yrs. We did the 'Boogie Surf' package and our dolphin handler was Juan Jose and he was great. We were with Luana the dolphin and she was really lovely. The place is laid out well with toilets, showers and lockers available. We wore long sleeve rashies and were glad we did. The sun was strong and we were out in direct sun for at least half an hour, more than enough for us to burn. Especially because they ask you not to wear sunscreen to avoid polluting the water for the dolphins. Afterwards we bought the photo package with all our photos (82 in total) on a USB stick plus the video of us there plus a code for the Delphinus app to get all our pics on a mobile device. We also got a tote bag and two wooden photo frames for $233 USD. It was expensive but expected at this type of attraction, this is where they make there money. We were happy to pay it having seen the pictures and video in the photo centre and knowing there were lots of great shots of the 4 of us. The place is well run, clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Fantastic!

Couples Dolphin Swim was excellent. We decided to pay a little more for the couples only swim due to it being our honeymoon. The swim was amazing and the trainer (Maria), was fantastic. The experience was great and due to us having the full 45mins on our own we were able to have more interaction with the dolphin. Can't fault the swim at all. However...the photo packages are ridiculous. It's a case of all or nothing as you don't want to leave without any photos (you're not allowed to take pictures inside yourself). They should have more photo packages as you already pay quite a bit to swim with the Dolphins and some people may not be able to afford it. We purchased all photos on a USB stick which also had a 10min video on. This was the most popular package. When you purchase this, you get a username and password to download smaller sized photos so you can upload to Facebook. Their App is a little temperamental so be patient with it. All in all...amazing experience but photos cost a bomb (which is a bit out of order).

RIP OFF. It cost us more to remember the experience than it did to actually swim with the Dolphins which isthmian reason I would give this one star. Swimming with the actual dolphin was a dream come true for me, although it's sad to know they are in captivity but I mean being so close to such a beautiful love animal was remarkable. Each person cost $129 US and we went with another couple. The picture package for all of use was almost $300 US which was just absolutely absurd. So sad because we couldn't use cameras or our phones so we have no memory except for what's in our minds.

Perfection. Can't say anything other than one of the best times ever with my family. I can only give it a 4 out of 5 rating because of the price for the pictures, however, it was still worth it. My family and I had one of the best times ever. Would definitely do it again in a heart beat.

PHOTO PACKAGES START AT $180 FOR 12 PHOTOS ON A CD?. The experience of swimming with dolphins was good but be prepared to have the smile wiped off your face when you see the price of the photo packages. Packages range between $180 and $300. The cheapest package contains 12 photos on a CD which is ridiculous. Don't waste your money.

Rude Staff, Horrid Treatment of the Dolphins. I went with a corporate group and am so mad at myself that we supported this place. The staff was so incredibly rude it was stunning; there was such an overwhelming atmosphere of negativity and rudeness that I wanted to leave. Then I saw the "tank" where the dolphins are kept; dirty, stagnant water and not very big. I noticed right away that the dolphins all have raw open sores on their noses; I later figured out it was due to the famous "push" that all guests do at the end. This is where you lay in the water and two dolphins push on your feet through the water. Sure, it seems exhilarating and fun and of course makes for a good (and very expensive) photo op; but I would never would have done it if I knew at the time that the "push" is the cause of the raw sores on the noses. Our guide showed absolutely no love toward the dolphins; they clearly just rotate these poor animals through, forcing them to do stupid tricks, all day long every day. Then, at the end you have the option of supporting this abusive place even further by buying the most overpriced photos I've ever seen at any group activity (I've been a corporate group planner for twenty years). One photo is around $50, to buy other photos or the video, plan on spending around $300 for a group of 4-5. I am sick to my stomach that I helped support this place, and although I am sure other dolphin experiences don't treat their animals so poorly, I will never take part in something like this again. If you must do a dolphin experience, please don't go here!

Swimming with the Dolphins. The Dolphins were amazing......so beautiful and gentle. It was fun being able to interact with them in the water rather than just watching..........not just for kids, great for adults too!!!!!!!

Good experience - bad after taste. excellent experience for us and a little 4 year old girl who loved every minute. We asked at the ticket desk how much the photos will be once we have finished our swim with the dolphins and on two occasions we were told not to worry and that everything will be explained when we go in. The swim itself was great but the only reason for the poor rating is the cost of the photos afterwards. $180 was just not right (more than entry for two+1) and not to be informed before you go is out of order.
Hellish day out!! . Would totally recommend to do this.. We paid with travel agent back at home and done the bronze package which was only me and my husband with 2 dolphins.. Was absoutley fab xx

Unforgettable! Once in a life time. The trainers were awesome. Dolphins were extremely well trained and wonderful creatures. I cannot swim, but the experience was still awesome. You have life vests so it all works out fine for non swimmers. The pictures are very pricey though! NEGOTIATE PEOPLE!! Get in a group and split the costs of one flash drive of pictures, then negotiate the price. We went on their site and got a coupon for 50% off, so look out for coupons before booking.

Experience not as special as we'd hoped. My boyfriend & I booked this excursion, via a small stall with a man named David Gomez in the Playacar resort - we got a fantastic deal, 4000 peso (roughly £150) for both of us to do the dolphin swim package with the small group of 4 people (the Thompson package was $219 American dollars PER PERSON!) - I'd highly recommend anyone book through David if staying in the Playacar area as prices on the door for this package were 3000 peso per person so we made a saving of over £100! We had booked a 4pm slot, a mini bus came & picked us up at 2:30pm & was a short distance from our hotel. When we arrived we got given lockers & sat in a benched area with a TV screen which showed videos of the dolphins, how they're taken care of, animals they've rescued etc. We sat there for around half an hour then a trainer spoke to the group about do's & don'ts etc then we were given life jackets & ushered to the water to begin our experience. Our trainer was called Maria & we had a gorgeous pregnant dolphin named Melissa. Our trainer really understood & cared about the Dolphins & you knew you were in safe hands. Melissa did various tricks with us - our favourite was the foot push where two dolphins pushed your feet so you glided across the water, you only got to do this once which was a shame! You only got 45 minutes in the water with the Dolphins too which flew really fast & the trainer kept on trying to sell us other packages which got tiring. There was a high anti climax at the end when we were faced with the prices of the photographs. You were not allowed to take any cameras with you & so the only option was to buy there's. It was $40 USD for ONE photograph!! The cheapest package was $170 USD for 12 photos on a disk. We didn't even have enough cash with us!! This was so disappointing as a lot of the dolphin swim was based around posing for the camera with the Dolphins, we realised that they were just trying to rip tourists off & so we did not purchase any photographs - the gift shop overall was ridiculously overpriced. The reason I gave this experience 3 stars was simply because at every corner they try to rip you off for something, we were lucky to get a good deal but at the end of the day 4000 peso is still a lot of money for 45 minutes in the water.

Unforgettable experience. The interaction with the dolphins where great. My child and niece will remember this for life. The trainers masters the dolphins awesomely, we were pushed around the pool as we were surfing with a boogie board. Great experience for every one but very expensive photos and videos at the end of the activity was offered.

Dolphins were great ,but weren't offered the full experience as advertised!. My boy friend and I were put together in a group with another couple which I thought was fine to do the group related dolphin activities ,but I later felt it was unfair we had to wait until they were done playing with the dolphin while our clock was ticking away. When it was our turn, they didn't give us as much undivided attention because by the time they got to us, our 30mins were close to finished. So, all we got to do was pet the dolphin, kiss it, and have it dance with us which probably was like at max a 5 min activity, but didn't get to ride the dolphin nor got to do a few other moves like the whirlpool which the other couple clearly got to do when they took us to the photo and video room. Regardless, we still bought the package anyways because we really wanted our pictures. However, as I was looking over our photos when I got home, which didn't have much diversity in them because we were limited to only a few activities with the dolphins, I could not help to feel upset and write this review after realizing how much we paid for a mediocre experience. It made our experience at Xcaret a downfall. It's such a let down.

A Perfect Experience!. We had a perfect experience at Delphinus Riviera Maya. The swimming with the dolphins was amazing. We got the private experience and interacted with a female dolphin in more than 7 behaviors, including being pushed by two dolphins. The trainer was so great and demonstrated domain about his job. I highly recommend this attraction, it was an unforgettable experience. The only thing is that the photos are too expensive.

A Money Maker: A lovely experience, but very poor, unhelpful customer service. . Me and my partner have just got back from Mexico and we paid for the single person swim with dolphins. We used our resort credit to pay for this trip, therefore we didn't pay as much as some. Always check at your hotel to see if you have resort credit as you only need to pay 20% tax to use it. So it should be cost $500 but only cost us $100. When we arrived there was a lot of standing about and waiting in an uncovered heated area. It seemed it was ok to push in if you were a Spanish speaker. After seeing my frustrations at waiting we received a 'free' T-shirt! When we headed down to the area, there was a lot of sitting and watching videos whilst putting on the life jackets. I was told that I would be able to watch my partner, but from the spectators area it was incredibly difficult. Whilst he was in the water with the Dolphins he had his own team of people around him, which was great, although they too kept on obscuring my view. This was because they were filming and photographing the entire experience. The actual swimming with these animals was amazing. Lots of activities were done and it was great to see them in a natural surrounding, opposed to an aquarium. I've been to dolphin places in other countries, but the Dolphins here were really calm and happy. We paid for 45 minutes in the water, but only received 35 minutes. When we cane out, the team ushered us to a suit of Mac computers where we could privately watch the video or purchase photographs. The costs were ridiculous! $30 for one photo or $240 for the entire package with the video on USB. As it was our final day we just didn't have that sort of money. I can't help but feel this place aims its market at upper class and high end tourism. I only had $27 on me and they wouldn't shift on the price. This angered me, as they were laughing and acting like $240 was pocket money for some. They wouldn't deliver to the hotel later either, unless we purchased the $240 dollar package. The photo man laughing at me was the final straw. I complained. Funnily enough they wouldn't let me speak to a manager so I went to the sign in desk and spoke to one there. They offered my partner the chance to swim again, but we'd both had enough. I told them that it was poor service and they agreed to give me the $240 photo package for free. A lovely experience, but very poor, unhelpful customer service.

Great to actually play with a dolphin. My husband and I visited June 2016 and had a blast. We did the boogie board package. Pablo and the others I am bad with names were great there was a little boy in our group that was scared and they worked well with him while still taking care of the rest of us. I would recommend this for anyone and everyone.

amazing. My husband and I had a private swim with the dolphins. First we were in a larger ares with one other couple where the dolphins jumped over us and did the foot push. Then we were taken to a more private area where we got to play with a dolphin one on one. It was such a great experience.
Mexico 2016. This was such an amazing experience and the excellent staff made it even more special. This is a must do during your stay in Mexico.

Amazing!!. The experience was well worth it a dream come true !!! If I have to put a negative it would be the price of the photo package, come on guys cut the price you will sell a lot more..... Would I do it again - Oh yes

Must see. Great place for the family to do everything. Include your goggles and lockers when purchasing tix. Bring towels and a change of clothes you will def get wet. Fun, fun, more fun. Also, make sure u do the evening show, it will make u feel like the patrons of over 1000 years.

Lies and overpricing. When I booked the trip they told me that for $111 USD per person, we had 4 members in our family we could have 2 dolphins to ourselves, I checked with them several times with that before I booked, they confirmed that I would have to dolphins with us. When I got there, we only had one dolphin but we were sharing a small pool other lady who is doing a private class with my dolphin. I asked him where our second often was, the man told me that only sometimes they have two dolphins with four people. I told him that we were promised to and then he told me with a foot push you to get to dolphins. I didn't want to argue with him and just enjoyed The time of the water with the dolphin that we had. My husband could not get in the water as he was having balance issues, the people that were there laughed at him and talked in their language and the whole time. They mocked him and made fun of him, it was very obvious and quite embarrassing. Once we are done they shuffled us to a room so we can look at videos and buy their pictures. They hijacked us for money. They make you feel guilty and in the end we bought a picture package for $281 USD. It's such a rip off buyers please be aware. There's nothing they can tell me once they respond this that would make it better. I got back to the hotel and we made a complaint on what they sold us and what they gave us, when they called them and told them about the complaint, they knowledged that we only had one dolphin and told us that if we came back the next day they would do everything over for free. Of course we were leaving the next day and couldn't do it. We asked for a refund or partial refund, and the flatly refused. I would never recommend this company, they are liars, the staff are very disrespectful, and the pictures are priced over inflated.

Great staff!. The experience was awesome. we went with 6 people and they were very inclusive for all ages. My 80 year old grandfather loved the experience. We also went with my brother who is visually impaired and the staff was very helpful with getting him involved. The activities didn't take much time only an hour and was fairly priced except for the photos they were way overpriced but worth it. we got to do tons with the dolphins in that hour. Overall i would rate it 10 out of 10 because of how amazing the staff was with our party!

Dolphins. Great experience, informative and friendly staff. They will tell you to wash off any sunscreen used as it is hazardous to the waters and dolphins. I would recommend close toes shoes for men and woman as there is a slight hill when the activities are over and you may slide out of your flip-flops. Water shoes are best!

A great experience!. It was my first experience near dolphins. It was a lot of fun! They seemed to be very well taken care of, and the entire place was very nice, employees were friendly.The duration seemed a bit short... and it was VERY expensive....and once you are there you want to get pictures... and that costs so much! But you still get them because other than your mind, it's the only visual reminder that you actually saw dolphins.It was worth spending the money, but just know that for 2 people it's almost 300dls between tickets and pictures...not counting the entrance to Xcaret. Still, i played with dolphins! I will never forget the experience :)

Fantastic time!!!. This was our second time swimming with dolphins at Xcaret. The first time was amazing and the second time even better. There were plenty of free time swimming with dolphins in our small group of 4. There was time to pose for fotos, play and find out about these beautiful creatures. There were 5 dolphins in our section and ours were Luana and Yakun. They were beautiful. When you come out of the water you are handed towels and taken to the foto room to view pictures and video. As we purchased a medium package last time we wasnt going to buy again but we did as these are amazing memories. We couldnt decide on package to have and as were undecided they gave us some discount. The fotos are a rip off but we knew this even before our first visit and were prepared. It all goes toward the care and breeding of dolphins and other animals od the park. We had a fantastic time and without a doubt would do it again.

Fantastic!. We have done a Dolphin experience previously but this was the better one. Well worth the money. The dolphins were well cared for and seemed really happy. The staff were excellent and answered all our questions. They went over and above to make sure the experience was enjoyable.

An experience we'll never forget!. Our girls ages 12 and 8, asked to go swimming with the dolphins. What an amazing experience. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Clean, well maintained area. Can't wait to do it again!

Dolphin fun. We pre-booked our tickets from home so we got a discounted price on the them. For the value, the show was great. We were in the water petting, kissing and holding flippers with them. The absolute best part was the foot push where a dolphin on each foot propels about 50' to 60' down the pen. It is exhilarating and incredibly awesome experience. I would do that part over and over again. We had Beatrice as our guide and she was great.Our one and only complaint with this show is the cost of the photo's. The fees were exorbitant and if you bought one photo, you get a cheap ugly frame to put the picture in. Unless you really want the photo's and videos, walk away from buying the pictures otherwise be prepared to shell out over $300 usd for them.

Not to be missed.. Experience of a lifetime!. Unlike in the U.S., when you do the dolphin encounter at Xcaret, you are actually allowed to swim in the large saltwater tank with them and not just stand on a platform or 2 feet of water! You do interact with them on a platform to begin with but quickly tread water in the tank as they swim around you eating treats thrown to them by the trainer so that you can pet them as they pass by. Incredibly, at Xcaret, I held onto its fin as it took me for the ride of a lifetime! Although expensive, four of us shared the price of the dolphin video and pics provided on a flash drive. Cheaper if purchased online. Lots of interactions allowed with dolphins... Four dolphins in tank with us. We got a kiss on the cheek, danced with one as we held its flippers... Too incredible!

Fantastic - Would love to visit again!. We went on this trip during our honeymoon. Staff were really friendly and the experience was amazing! We did a package where there was just 4 of us. We got to spend a lot of time in the water with the dolphins. It was fun as well as educational. We ended up purchasing all of the photos and the film - which was a bit pricey, but well worth it! Out of all the trips we did in Mexico, this was by far the best!

fantastic experience couple swim. well worth the money brilliant couple experience would recommend to everybody well organised safe lockers with key to get changed/unchanged, quick and easy to get your photos at the end of the excursion.

The most incredible thing we've ever done . What a fantastic experience, definately an experience of a lifetime. Would highly recommend to everyone visiting cancun or Riviera maya! Staff are amazing and friendly, dolphins are incredible

Fantastic experience . This is a must for all dolphin lovers! It is the better than some of the other places offering this experience. You are placed in smaller groups, and get longer in the water with them. The dolphins are happy to interact with you and the staff are helpful and pleasant. The dolphins are all well cared for as well and all money goes to the rescue and care of the dolphins!

Too expensive but .... Very well organized,lockers , documentary film, clean. My husband and I were lucky to be in a "group" only with one person. You can do 5-6 tricks with a dolphin.Professional staff and kind. Photos too expensive but it is once in a lifetime.

Amazing Experience!. My husband and 2 tween had an opportunity to interact with 2 lady dolphins for over 45 minutes. It was a very cool experience and one that they will remove for a lifetime. The facility itself looked well taken care of and the Dolphins appeared happy and healthy. The trainer was patient, funny and helpful while my family was being entertained by the Dolphins. I viewed a young girl around 3 with her family in another area...looked very safe too! I was allowed to take as many pictures as I wanted and I sure did-over 700! The facility offers pictures at an absurd price, but we did purchase 2 of the 8x10's for about $80. Overall, it was a great experience.

Amazing Experience . This was more than what we expected. We spent extra for the package where you were only grouped with 4 people and it was worth it. Our guide / trainer "Maria" was awesome. I was not expecting the amount of interaction that we had with the dolphins. This is great for all ages. The grounds were very clean with friendly staff. If you have the opportunity to do this, I highly recommend it. Great job Delphinus!!!
Great experience. Swam and played with dolphins. A truly magical experience to swim with these graceful, powerful and incredibly intelligent creatures.

Amazing experience with a purpose. I enjoyed a dolphin swim at this facility, and the staff did an amazing job making it an incredible experience. What I truly loved was the time and care the staff took with the animals, and explaining to everyone in our group how we can help make the world a better place. A terrific experience and a must do when visiting Xcaret.

Amazing but expensive . We had a great day at xcaret Mexico and the bonus was swimming with the Dolphins We had amazing instructors and we were in a small group and had great interactions with up to four Dolphins!For two of us it just over 200£Even more expensive were the photos and video which i was really upset about not purchasing but couldn't afford!I think they should rethink the pricing of the extras as more people would purchase them Great day out anyways

Excellent experience but do research before purchasing!. Swimming with the dolphins was a bucket list item of mine, that I can now check off! It was an absolute amazing experience, and I am grateful to have had the opportunity to try it at Xcaret. This thrilling adventure was one of the highlights of my trip to Playa and I would still recommend it to anyone going. However, I do just recommend doing some research before you book this excursion. *There are THREE different dolphin areas in Xcaret, and I was in the wrong spot, twice, before figuring out where I had to be. So make sure you find out for sure where you should go, so you don't run late for your swim time. All names sound the same.*They will try to up-sell you up until the last minute. So stand firm on what you want. *BEWARE OF THE COST OF THE PHOTOS! Of course, for such a killer experience, you're going to want top-notch quality photos. In the section I was in, my friend was able to take photos of me, but no where near the quality of what their team takes - and they purposely face all 'actions' away from the visitor zone, so the dolphin 'kiss' or 'ride', your friends/family will get the side angle or back of you, so of course you'll want to purchase the photos from them! And shockingly, they told me that each photo was $40 USD, which is actually about $55 Canadian, so I paid $110 for two photos (which I'm delighted to have) but just would have liked the head's up that this was the cost. Then I could have prepared myself.*Also, I found the training team to be a bit rude and harsh with us in the water. The one we had was obviously frustrated that some of the tourists weren't understanding her, but they didn't speak English OR Spanish, so I felt she could have done more to make them understand the rules, without being obviously annoyed and grumpy. She rolled her eyes, shook her head, whispered to her team mates, which was very unprofessional. I think if she realized we were paying over $300 for this experience alone, plus the almost $200 to get into Xcaret, maybe she'd have been nicer. So that was a bit unfortunate. The male trainer had to take over for her at one point, and as soon as he did, everyone understood him easily and the rest of the swim went smoothly.*They never checked our life jackets either - so once I was in the water, mine kept rising and I wasn't able to make it tighter so I had to hold onto it most of the swim. That's one simple thing they could do to make the excursion better.*Also, the younger kids didn't seem to have as much fun, as honestly, they were cold, and should probably just stick to the basic 'kiss' instead of the 'ride' or 'foot push' as they don't understand and couldn't follow the rules.*The photographers were every nice! Much nicer than the trainers. *The rest of the staff at the sign-in and lockers, etc were great too.All in all, a fabulous experience of a lifetime. Highly recommend it, and just be patient with them, book the best pool for YOU, and know the cost going into it! It is worth it though... :-)

Amazing experience that ended disappointingly. What an amazing experience this is. We are a family of 6. (including a 17, 12 and 9 year old) We were all allowed to stay together as a small group to interact with the dolphins. We had the lagoon and dolphin all to ourselves. The facility is large, and private. (hidden from the rest of the Xcaret park) The trainers were great, knowledgeable and obviously cared for the animals very much. The interaction you have with these amazing animals is a once in a lifetime experience. Everyone in my family felt the same way. The best part is that everyone in your group gets to "swim" or get "pushed" by the dolphins! (2 dolphins one on each foot. They push you through the water with their noses) AMAZING!! They do not allow you to bring in you personal cameras or go-pros. They have someone that takes pictures and videos of your group. Unfortunately this is where the magic of the experience faded. The amount of money that they want for these pictures and videos are a disgrace. For my family of 6's package, (132 total and the video) they wanted an additional $575. The smallest package 10 photos (none of which had our entire group together in one picture) was $270. I was prepared to spend some money on pictures of our experience but certainly not that much! What a shame it is to ruin the natural, peaceful and beautiful experience you have with the dolphins for greed and the desire to make a $$. If part of the money is truly going back to the dolphins like the photo salesperson said...I would have been willing to pay more per person for the experience in the beginning then to pay that amount for pictures.
The holidays. I founded amazing the dolphin experience will come again I greatly recommend it to everyone Playa del Carmen it self it's unbelievable had the best time unforgettable

Dolphin Interax with a Little Kid. It was an entertaining opportunity for my son (5 yrs old). Initially, my plan was to take my daughter (3 yrs old), but she got scared after putting the life jacket on and started screaming to get out. At the last moment (5 min before the scheduled start time), they allowed us to switch the kids. My son had plenty of opportunity to touch the dolphin, had some fun activities with that. Only negative is the cost of photos and videos. I also wish there is an online option to download the videos.

Fab swim with dolphins . Amazing! Doesn't need any other words really!I love the fact that there is a clear ecological and conservationists programme here too.Transport staff and staff onsite were brilliant!

TRULY MAGICAL EMOTIONAL EXPERIENCE. went here on the 15th August 2015 my 50th birthday actually on that day :) and i can say it was better than i could of imagined it would be.i went in the water with 2 of my brothers and my niece aged 12 ,mum sister and sister in law were up on the hill watching.the place is not very good for people with mobility problems as we found out.there are alot of steep slopes and steps here and in the heat was somewhat worrying but we managed slowly.but spectators should take plenty to drink and some wet flannels as being in amongst secluded surroundings of trees and hills there was no breeze. the trainer was fantastic i can not for the life of me remember her name but she was so friendly and her wok with the 2 dolphins was beautiful.we booked a private session for 4 and had 45 mins in the water.the experience made me a bubbling mess of tears from the sheer emotions i felt when i touched the beautiful dolphins a truly magical moment and what a way to spend my 50th .worth every penny .the only problem i found was my swimming costume was silky and so was the life jacket so it kept sliding up and forcing my head forward which made me panic and not be able to stay of the ledge in the water but although i couldnt join in with all the activities i.e foot push and such i enjoyed my time immensely and did manage to get in the water long enough for a birthday kiss from 2 dolphins on my cheek and the jump over .the dolphins swam by so gently around all of us for us to be able to smooth but dont touch the blow hole ,they did foot pushes ,jumped over us sang happy birthday and did the hokey cokey ,they waved and splashed us and wer just mesmorising i would say dont wear sun tan lotion when going here as it stings the dolphins eyes but apart from that just book and go it truly is a once in a life time experience and i hope to repeat it in september 2016 thank you delphinus for making my 50th birthday the very best x

Great Experience. After having one disappointing out at a different dolphin park we talked to the staff here and we are very glad we did. It was great experience having the dolphins actually swim with us and to be able to touch them when we wanted, not when a trainer gave permission.

Never again - false advertisement. It felt like paparazzi. Constantly posing for the camera and less about the experience. The worst part of it, we decided to give into the tourist picture trap and purchase the photo package that was advertised to include ALL photos from the experience. Our package was missing half of our photos, even though we were assured they would all be there. We reported the concern to Delphinus hoping to get our other photos. Delphinus never provided us the missing photos, claiming that one of the photos we identified was merely a "test photo" and was deleted after the swim. Complete BS and HORRIBLE customer service. A waste of money.

AWESOMENESS!. My wife and I enjoyed a belated honeymoon, staying at the Hard Rock Riviera Maya (It rocks!) and our vacation planning expert Luis set us up with an awesome couples swim with the dolphins. It was the highlight of our trip. We could not get the smiles off of our faces. Of course we had to buy the video and pics of our 45 minute swim afterward. This was the 2015 Trip Advisor's Number ONE Attraction in the Cancun area! Now we know why! If you have a family, the kids would also love it. If you are on a budget, you can go for less money...just in a larger group. When in doubt, just GO!!! You won't regret it.
Truely Amazing!. The best experience we ever had! Two dolphins just for us! Very intimate and breathtaking! Definitely worth the money!

Incredible life experience. INCREDIBLE, FANTASTIC and any other positive word you can think of! On our family holiday (myself, mom and dad, all adults) visited this venue for a swimming with dolphins experience. I honestly can not say how fantastic and amazing this experience was. I am on crutches and I was helped with all of my needs and they were taken into consideration with all of the activities. To swim with the dolphins was expensive and the photos were more expensive, but I will say that it was worth every penny. This is something none of us had done before and we had the most incredible time ever. IF you get the opportunity to visit and swim with the dolphins, then DO IT!!!! You will be missing out on an incredible life experience.We were given and introduction to what we were going to be doing, everything including safety was included. We had a lot of time in the water and the entire time that we were in there we were interacting with the dolphins while our photos and a video were being taken by a member of staff. We were shown how the dolphin do tricks and the incredible things that they are able to do, we were able to stroke the dolphins over and over and got to do a number of tricks with them as well. We were in a group of 4, so some things we did were s a group, and some were individually.I can not stress how fantastic this was!!!!!

Great experience. We did the Primax swim which was a great experience. We were in a small group of 6 and got lots of interaction with the Dolphin over a 50 minute period. The trainer Bernice was very friendly and excellent with the dolphin. The Primax is worth doing for the few quid extra as the dolphin foot push at the end is really good.Overall I'd recommend this but one slight annoyance was that the photos were massively overpriced. I hadn't expected them to be cheap but the initial price of approximately £100 for a CD of photos seemed extreme considering this wasn't even for any prints. We managed to negotiate these for £60 so try and do it that if you want to buy them.

The most amazing experience of your life. Our expectations were really high because we had heard so much about it. It was even better than what we expected. You see the dolphins up close, you touch them, swim with them, kiss them, hug them, dance with them, play with them. You learn so much about them, they are the most amazing creatures. And they seem really happy there. There are many instructors, people who take really good care of them and who enjoy what they do and will make your time there unforgettable. Special thanks to Angela and Cristina for helping us and teaching us many things. Kelly-Salvador (or Sebastian :-P )

Delphinus family fun!. Great experience! We purchased the 4 person pkg from Amstar at our resort Dreams Riviera. Plenty of time in the water, dolphins in your arms and pushing you through the water, kids were thrilled, trainer was experienced and explained everything. They do hit you up for pictures after.. We purchased the middle pkg. I would give it a 5.. but the ride took awhile longer than expected. I wouldn't do it again but it's something you need to experience once, especially with the kids!!
My kid loved it. Swimming with the Dolphins at Delphinus is a truly wonderful experience! Kids enjoyed the swim with dolphins, its expensive but its worth the money.
Great Experience. Swimming with the dolphins is a once in a lifetime experience. The trainers were knowledgeable and the entire staff was helpful and welcoming. Dolphins were friendly and gentle

Experience of a lifetime!. Swimming with the Dolphins at Delphinus is a truly wonderful experience! The trainers are amazing, and the Dolphins are really amazing animals. We did the Silver experience, and spent an hour in the water with the Dolphins, in a group of 4 adults with 2 Dolphins. The whole service is amazing, from the hotel pickup to the return. The photos are pricey (hence only 4 stars), but you need a memory of this! Tip - If you bring spectators, they can take the photos for you! I can't recommend this highly enough, and will never forget it!

The best experience . The best experience. Originally we booked swimming with Delphinus for 4 people, but when we arrived we upgraded to for two people only. Maria the trainer was amazing. Would definitely recommend it.
absolutely wonderful. Incredibly talented instructors, and wonderful atmosphere.It was among the best I've had, wonderful dolphins to swim with.

TOURIST TRAP bring your own photo equipment or hire someone for the day !. My family and I visited Xcaret Delphinus Thanksgiving day 2015. We also purchased a day pass for everyone at XPLOR SO FOR THE DAY I am already spending about $1000.00 US Dollars. We have always wanted to go and enjoy swimming with the dolphins so I wanted to splurge since this was the only full day we had on our trip.The experience was great until the very end when you get out of the water and they escort you to dry off. Once dry you get escorted into the gift shop were they try to sell you the photo packages. 1st package for 12 ...that's right 12 photos of the 100 they took is $180 US Dollars !! 2nd package is a thumb drive with all pictures and the video they took for $260 US dollars ! 3rd is so expensive and they ship you a photo book with your thumb drive I am with my 11 and 13 year old that of course want their photos with the dolphin so I have to spend another $260 !! You should be up front with people to let them know the ridiculous cost once you are their ! I could have hired a film crew in Mexico to document our 3 days for less than this thumb drive Buyer beware !!
:). We went to spend one day with all the family. My husband, son and niece were swimming with dolphins. They had a very good time and we took very nice pictures.

Amazing experiance. This was the activity I was most looking forward too when visiting mexico and it didn't disappoint. I did the dolphin ride package which included 15 min guide then 30 mins interacting with the dolphins. The activitys included singing, dancing, kissing and the dolphin fin pull ride. There could if been up to 12 in a group however there was only 8 which was good. Once we had finished we were taken straight to the photo area to look at the photos, it was good that my partner had been watching and had the towel with him as we didn't have chance to get ready first and was dripping wet. The photos were expensive however I got a package which included all 58 photos which featured me as well as the video on a memory stick as well as 2 prints and 2 frames for 94 usd. Not sure if this was a discounted rate as they had the dolphin swim at half price for black Friday.  If so I was lucky.

Expensive but worth it.... Its always been our dream to swim with dolphins. Finally did this in november 2015! We did the silver package where you spend around 45min-60min in the water with them. You can kiss, dance, stroke, interact and play with them. Everything is controlled and you are told how to stand or what to do etc. Lifejackets are given to everyone aswell as lockers. You cannot take photos as someone else does this for you. The prices are expensive. We were in a group of 4, both of us were couples who didnt know each other. This wasnt a problem but they dont give you the opportunity to take photos of you as a couple with the dolphins even though our trainer was aware we were separate couples which was a shame. We would have loved a photo with the both of us but instead had to purchase two separate photos of each of us with the dolphins. Each photo is $40 dollars. They will bargain with you on the price if you say it is too much and drop the package price... overall great experience but they do warn ladies to hold on to your bikini bottoms when you do the 'foot push' dolphins are very fast!!! Suggest a one piece suit!

Amazing. The 4 of us spent an hour with our dolphin having the experience of a lifetime, an absolutely amazing feeling. Afterwards when we went to purchase our video we learnt that it hadn't worked , so we had to put our bathers back on & get back in, what a shame lol....

Great experience tarnished by photo prices. This was a great experience. We paid the slightly extra package to have a smaller group and 15 minutes longer with dolphins. I believe this was worth doing.The activities were fun and the staff with us were very good, so despite the considerable price of it, I'd say it was worth doing if you haven't done before.My advice to anyone doing this would be to have someone in the seating area with a camera. Being in a pair who both did the activity together, we didn't have this so our only option to have photographic memories was to pay the disgraceful prices they charge you here. They showed us a good selection of photos they'd taken, plus a DVD of what we did. This was all great, until they told us how much they'd cost.1 photo - $40All photos - $180All photos + DVD - $210On top of a very expensive activity, these prices are disgusting and I sympathise with any parents who have kids who want these photos after doing it.

Couple Dream Swim with Dolphins. It was our first time when we were swimming with dolphins. It's an expansive trip for only one hour but you will get back lots of impressions and it was really funny swimming and playing with our dolphin Chiara. You are not allowed to take pictures because during your swim a photograph and a girl who makes a video of your swim does that for you. You can buy these pictures and the video after your swim. It's also expansive but we bought it completely because we wanted to have some pictures of us with the dolphin.

Incredible experience!. We stayed at the hotel next door and shopped around for the best deal to go to Delphinus, which incidentally was with the in-house 'travel agency' in the hotel. We did the Primax 4 for my son's 7th birthday and there were just the 3 of us, which was amazing! You get a full 45 mins with the dolphins and it was a beautiful experience. The dolphins are very well cared for. They took loads of photos and did a video which you have the option to purchase afterwards - pricey but well worth it!

If you don't have anything nice to say.... ...but I will say this. Price gouging everywhere, nickel and diming, and major disrespect towards Americans and anyone that doesn't speak Spanish seems to be the norm here (especially in the dolphin area). I also encountered several dishonest workers in the picture area which was very unsettling. If all this is acceptable to you then do come here. If it's not acceptable to you then spend your $1000 (yes you read that right) in the United States on something that you will enjoy.

Amazing!. Swimming with the dolphins here was the best experience i have ever had. I loved every minute! There were 4 of us in our group and 2 dolphins. The instructors were very nice too. I do think the photos and video was a little pricey but overall a fantastic day which i would recommend to anyone!

Great experience but disappointment at the end.... We´ve done a Primax for couple, and this was amazing experience! Our instructor was Maria from Puebla (mexican town)- very nice person and a good trainer! We´ve spent an hour there with dolphines and that has been one of our best experiences in our mexican vacation. However, at the end they offered us to buy photos for a rediculous price- 39 USD per photo, or several packages (the cheapest one was 249 USD). I think this is just too much, considering the high price of a program itself (we paid 349 for this program). I haven´t taken a credit card with me for security reasons, but the photographer mentioned that I can purchase the photos later on from their internet site... Our visit was on October 28th, and our photos never appeared on their site by now. Disappointment. However, I would still recommend to make it- great experience with dolphins!

Excellent activity but very expensive photos. Firstly, this activity is amazing and a bucket list item for many that won't disappoint. The setting in Xcaret is lovely with natural surroundings. Very nice welcome from the staff and nice changing area. Before you go in with the Dolphins you watch a 10 minute video all about how they are cared for and their breeding programme. I don't doubt they are well cared for but I'm not sure how I feel about them being bred for captivity rather than being rescues like some of the others in this area. Your group is then assigned a photographer who will take you off to start the photos. There will be about 40 people at a time and you're then broken down into groups of 4. You are given the opportunity when you arrive to upgrade to a couples swim for $30US PP to swim alone which is worth it as you do get much more time with the Dolphins. However, we found ourselves sharing the same pool as 2 other groups of 4, which I haven't experienced elsewhere. It struck me that the pools are quite small for the Dolphins too, whilst they are natural lagoons and a reasonable depth of 4m they didn't seem to be that big in surface area. Having said that, the Dolphins certainly appeared to be in good health and happily interacting with each other and the trainers. The couples swim allowed us to interact in the water with the dolphin, have a water fight, shake 'hands', cuddle, dance, complete the fin pull and the foot push. You get less if you go in the groups. Yes it is an expensive activity but if that goes into care, that's fine. The huge gripe for me is the ridiculous price of the photos. Far more expensive here than elsewhere - how the well any I don't know! I have seen the management comments on here about some of the money going into care and research but having experience in this area, if they halved their prices they'd sell a hell of a lot more and make a lot more to put back into the Dolphins. In the groups we swam with - no one bought photos and not because they didn't want to, but because they couldn't afford to. For a video on a memory stick, photos on CD, an album with 20 photos and your favourite on printed $350US!! And for a CD with your 12 favourite photos on only - $230US!! Unbelievable. They definitely need to rethink this if they genuinely want to make money to put back into the facility and not just profit making. If you are travelling with Thomson / TUI this is their preferred facility but I would recommend you do your own research on the different facilities before you go looking into their purpose and priorities. Whilst the facilities here were nice I don't think I'd personally choose to come back to this one, although don't get me wrong the activity itself was fantastic. Shame we've come away with no photo memories.

Fun time swimming with the dolphins. It was a great experience. This was actually my second time doing this as my boyfriend really wanted to do it so I went with him again. The place is nice- has lockers, showers, changing area. They give a brief video and intro on how to handle the dolphins - what to touch, not touch. Then you head to the water. Our first group of dolphins were acting up so we had to move to another set. Apparently they were teenagers and when they want to play- they just let them at it. The next ones we met were much tamer. We did the boogey board ride which was fun as well as the dolphin handshake, kiss, and another pose. Our pictures didn't come out that great so we opted not to buy any. They are rather expensive (all packages were over $100 USD). You could buy one for $40. Overall it was a nice experience.

Once in a life time activity. I swam with the dolphins Maya and Melissa. They tramer was Fani! I felt very happy! It was a nice experience and i'm glad i did it! Fani is very kind and nice! She did a very good job. I choosed the 30 minutes programm, but the 45 its better (two dolphins are coming from behind and swim just with you). Everybody should try this!

You will remember for the rest of your life !!. It is located in Xcaret Park and is one of the famous attractions of the park. A little expensive to swim with the dolphins but worth it. I f I am coming back to Cancun I will do it again.
Wonderful.. It was certainly a dream come true ... swim with the dolphins! Just wish I had had more time in contact with them. But it was worth it. Maybe one day back ...

30min swim. Very enjoyable experience only downside is they don't allow cameras or go pros and this means some are forced to purchase photos from the park which can be expensive.We really enjoyed this experience and would go again.Program facilitator was very informative and friendly and dolphins are spectacularly beautiful ☺

One of the coolest things I have ever done.. My 6 year old and I swam with the dolphins here and it was amazing! We loved every minute of it. We were staying at The Xcaret Grand next door to the park and they had a special entrance which made it easy to access. Nice changing/ locker rooms also. My only issue with the whole experience is the price of the pictures at the end of the swim. To get one 8x10 photo of you and the dolphin is $40 USD. There were other packages for photos but they started at $170 and up from there.

experience of a lifetime. What an amazing hour spent with some wonderful creatures. Wouldnt normally visit attractions like this as they are commercial profit makers however this one puts the welfare of the dolphins first and is doing so much for the dolphins. Trainer very good and patient the full hour is spent in the water with the dolphin and amazing photos taken. Amazing creatures.
Great Place lots of fun. Just wonderfull. Not enough time to see all in one day. Do not miss the final show. Mexican culture in about 2 hours show. We love the place.

Happiest I have ever been. If you have a chance, you must go to delphinus Xcaret to swim with the Dolphins. Our instructor was witty, entertaining and most importantly made you really admire and appreciate what amazing and beautiful creatures dolphins are. This was a dream come true.
Dream come true. Fantastic experience, once in a lifetime dream...complete. The trainers and staff work so hard to make your experience the best possible ever.

MAGICAL DAY - TRAINER FOR A DAY. We visited here in September and paid for the gold package which is Dolphin Trainer for the day, this was absolutely fantastic !!!!!!!! we arrived in the morning and were given our trainer TShirts we could keep, we then got in the water with the dolphins to touch then and learn some basics, time was them spent in staff only areas helping scrub the dolphin wounds and clean them, the whole day was spent in the water with the dolphins rather than just 45 min on other packages. These creatures are amazing and I recommend anyone do this package. At the end you get a DVD and upto 200 photos of your day, which is a little pricey, but as all the money goes back into the conservation of the dolphins we did not mind. Thank you for a magical day.

Ivan: best dolphin trainer!. We opted for the 30 min swim with dolphin. Our trainer was Ivan and he was wonderful! He helped us learn about our dolphin, Kiram. He made us feel comfortable in the water and encouraged us care for our environment. We enjoyed all the tricks the dolphin was able to do expertly from letting us pet her belly to sharing a kiss! We will never forget this amazing experience and highly recommend it to anyone, young or old. Then we were surprised to learn our dolphin was expecting! We opted for the photo CD which included all photos for $114 You are not allowed to take your own camera as all accessories could be a hazard to the dolphins.

Lot of Walking. I liked the Mexican show and the church display. The map highlighted where we needed to go and the trail was marked which colors. There were lots of employees to ask for guidance if you got off track. Bring plenty of money because things are very expense.

Amazing experience - shame about the photo rip-off. We had a really enjoyable experience with the dolphins and learned a lot. The instructor we had was excellent and taught us a lot and was a lot of fun. We went on the only day of our honeymoon when it rained but the pool is very warm. The only disappointment was the attempt to sell photos for $150!!! Such a shame! One photo was $30!

Amazing Experience but..... Firstly, the experience of swimming with the Dolphins was amazing! We got 45 minutes in the water with them and performed a number of different activities during that time which was great. On this alone, I would definitely give a rating of 5However...We decided to pay a little extra and go for the experience in a group of 4 rather than the standard 10-12 as we were on honeymoon and was promised that by paying the extra for this we would be able to have photos together with the Dolphins as a couple rather than individually.When we arrived on the day, we double checked this at the ticket booth but we was told that we would have to pay an additional $60pp for the 2 person experience in order to have photos together. Not what we was told when we purchased our tickets!! Having already payed over $300 we refused to pay the additional cost and stuck with what we had!!Also, if you intend to buy photos afterwards, make sure you take plenty of money! You only get the choice of 3 photo packages (so can't pick and choose what you want) and these start at $180. For $180, all you get are 12 photos on a CD!! Having previously swam with dolphins and purchased photos in a different part of Mexico last year, these were massively overpriced in comparison.I would certainly recommend this for the experience with the Dolphins but due to the lies/misleading information and ridiculously priced photos, I can only give this a 3 star rating.

Experience of a lifetime . Swimming with dolphins was the highlight of my trip to cancun.. I have an amazing picture with the Dolphin and it's just something I will remember for the rest of my life.. Dolphins are beautifully and smart creatures! You will not be disappointed with that.. As far as the prices I don't know because I didn't have to pay for anything because my uncle did but we got the deal that gave you all the pictures and even printed out 5 big pictures (because it was 5 of us, each had their own picture) for the frames they gave us. If I am not mistaken I think it was $206 or $260 for everything .. I think that doesn't include the video (not sure) but that one less for my bucket list! ☺️

Wonderful Experience. I don't know what I expected, to swim and interact with dolphins, but whatever it was, this exceeded it. Such a humbling and wonderful experience to meet these fascinating creatures and to see how they learn, have relationships with their trainers and are just so gentle. Ours, uninstructed, flipped over because he preferred belly rubs! It's one off the bucket list, for sure, but I'll no doubt do it again at the earliest opportunity! Ps. Photos are pretty pricey, so be prepared for this. But they're worth getting as the photographers and videographers are brilliant. They capture every moment perfectly!
Dolphins at xcaret. Well worth the experience with very knowledgable staff . You will get stung with buying photos after ,but they all do this.

Off my bucket list. This was definitely a neat experience. We did the primax where you only share the dolphin with a group of 4 although they take the dolphin away like 5 times to push other folks. That is the best Bart when two Dolphins come behind you and push your feet. Make sure your suit is on tight cause it will fly off. Girls should wear a one piece suit if possible. Overall neat to swim with dolphins but a bit boring at times when the trainer has him swim around you and let's you pet him. It would be better if they pushed you by your feet more than once.

amazing experience. we went swimming with the dolphins here and what a truly magical experience we had. We had an amazing lady MARY that was with us and fully informed us about the dolphins which was so intetesting.She was so nice and funny. My 11 year old daugher fully loved this aswell as me and her dad. Had an amazing onced in a lifetime experience which made me cry because i just couldnt believe i was actually swimming with these beautiful mammals.Thankyou so much i will remember

Swim with Dolphins!. We swam with dolphins & Manatees here, I don't mention the nurse sharks as that bit was a bit boring, they just lay on the bottom.The Manatees were just lovely, we fed them lettuce & stroked them.The Dolphins though, wow what an experience just do it & go for the Royal Swim as they lift you up by your feet. Incredible!

Experience of a life time!. We will never forget our couples dream swim at Delphinus Xcaret...it was incredible! We got to spend 60 minutes in the water with two dolphins. At first we were a little nervous but Margareta, our trainer, made us feel very relaxed and comfortable. We got to spend a good amount of time petting the dolphins to help us get used to them and then we did some tricks with them, such as splashing and talking etc. We both got dolphin kisses and the dolphins swam around us really fast, which was great fun! The foot push was exciting but also a little nerve wracking! Words cannot describe what an incredible experience that we had and it was the highlight of our trip to Mexico! We opted to buy photographs of our experience - the price we paid included a video and a photo in a frame. They were wonderful but very expensive. Swimming with dolphins is an expensive experience so it was a little disappointing that the photos then added such a significant amount to the cost. However, we would still do it all over again because it was amazing!

Amazinf. An amazing day out! Great day for none swimmers too! So much to do had a great day! couldn't ask for better staff or Dolphins! Did activities for people with bad backs and people who don't like deep water so they could stay on the platform! Amazing experience! Swam with dolphins 3 times now defiantly the best!

Extremely pricey day out!!. Ok so you pay an arm and a leg per person to get in... then you pay at least twice that again to swim with the dolphins... the dolphin photo package then sets you back another £200 (i kid you not!!...total wrip off for what you get!!)..... then if you choose the pay for automatic photos to be taken by photographers strategically placed around the park, that's another £40.... its just geared up to extract as much money as possible out of you and to be honest I wasn't that impressed with xcaret as a day out... for the dolphin swim they pack so many people in for each session that it's really not that great an experience in the end.... the swimming in the river was ok but really cold and crowded... was nice to see the turtles and manatee but would prefer to see them in their natural habitat than cooped up in captivity!

Really Good Experience. Really good experience, me and my 4 sons visited Delphinus. Amazing to get so close to the dolphins, lots of interaction with the dolphins, different tasks carried out so you have a really close experience. Only downside was the price of photographs/dvd/memory stick.

Great experience!. 9 of us swam with the dolphins and it was great that they only allow 4 people per dolphin, unless you specifically ask for more, which we did as there were 9 of us so one group had 5 but we had to sign to accept this. Photos are expensive $39 for one, there are packages available from around $190 upto around $390 if I remember rightly. You will struggle to take photos on a phone from the viewing area. We used an iPhone 5s and the zoom was not good enough. Unless you have a professional camera you are going to struggle to get decent photos from the area that spectators are allowed, so be prepared to pay if you want photos. This excluded the experience is fantastic for all ages and all swimming abilities as you have to wear a life jacket.

A life experience: profesionalism, Friendliness & happy dolphins. I have swum with wild dolphins before in the open sea, in Zanzibar, but it was for only a few seconds, just a few glimpses and lost and then a few more and lost, repeat 3-4 times and that was it.this was different: the personnel is highly professional, educated, informed and most of all full of love for his job and the dolphins.yes it is a park, yes the dolphins are trained, but what you do get in terms of emotional fulfillment is a life experience.And no, the dolphins do not feel lonely, the are not in a hunger strike and they are not feeling depressed or miserable.As long as the dolphins, socialize, moving, playing, eating, joking, having sex they are perfectly healthy even in captivity. besides many of them are already born there so they could not survive in the wild.Not to be missed!!!!take your go pro with you: the charge for the photos is too high

An amazing experiance. i booked the couples only swim through our virgin rep grant at the hotel, which is next door to the park, so only walking distance for us.The dolphin swim was amazing, just the 2 of us, the great trainer, the photographer and of course the star of the show PRINCESS, a 3 yr old female dolphin.We spent an hr with the dolphin in the water doing amazing tricks and learning alot about the animal and its habitat.It is worth doing and i recommend Delphinus very highlyWe have some really great photos of our time with PRINCESSA trip we will never forgetTHANK YOU DELPHINUS

Lovely Experience. I've done other dolphin experiences and this was by far the best. We were a group of 4 which was fabulous as it was just us with our dolphins. After you get your lockers and watch a short DVD - the interaction lasted about an hour, was well organised. The foot pushes were amazing. The staff were very knowledgeable and genuine. Yes the photos/DVD were a little expensive but we split the cost between two couples so worked out ok. Would highly recommend.

Left stranded after the swim. i booked this through our holiday company for my 11 year old son and I and paid nearly £120 as it was endorsed by the holiday company and included transport there and back. The swim with the dolphins was amazing, however, our trip was utterly spoilt when our driver decided he couldn't be bothered to take us back to our hotel which was a 30 minute drive from the site. We were left stranded there for over one hour in the middle of nowhere. After a 40 minute wait a minibus turned up but I was shocked to see the Delphinus staff get on the bus and leave us there!! Eventually a driver from another company kindly came to pick us up and take us to our hotel. As we left the site we saw our original driver parked up the road and when he realised it was us in the van he dived into his minibus to try to hide!! I made a complaint to the holiday company as it is unacceptable to leave a woman and 11 year old child stranded in the middle of nowhere. Delphinus were unable to provide any kinds of explanation as to why we were left there and not taken back to our hotel an hour earlier as was supposed to happen. My advice, if you want to swim with dolphins and make it back to your hotel again Do Not go to Delphinus.

A day to remember. An experience not to be missed. The whole morning was excellent. Swimming with these wonderful creatures is something we will remember for the rest of our lives. The 'footpush' is something I never thought I would have the nerve to do but the trainers do am amazing job with the animals and give your the faith you need to do it.

Good experience and good interaction with the dolphins. As part of the resort credit from Hard Rock Riviera Resort, we took this excursion Boogie with the Dolphins. Last two years we did a similar activity in Moon Palace resort and we must say the experience at Delphinus was much better. More interaction with the Dolphins and smaller group (10 people). The staff was professional and nice. My autistic son, my wife and myself couldn't keep ourselve to float to be ready to be pushed by the dolphins, so a trainer was there in the water to help us all the time. As other reviewers said, the price for the pictures and the video was outrageous but if you can afford it, then buy it. They took very good pictures and good video. It will be a good memory for you to keep and share!

Amazing!. We did the package just with 4 people and it was amazing! When we arrived they did try and get us to upgrade but it was a little bit expensive. We then went and got changed - you had your own locker with a key. Then you walk down to the hut and get a lifejacket and watch a intro video before you get a talk from one of the instructors about what not to do. You then go down to the lagoon and get in and start interacting with the dolphins. You have an instructor telling you what to do and there's another guy filming and taking photos. Overall the experience was amazing! We bought all our photos and the video and got 2 framed photos for around $200 as it's a once in a lifetime opportunity! We did barter a little to get the price down. We booked through our Virgin rep and the bus there from riveria maya took about 50 minutes but it was well worth it!

So fun!. This was an amazing experience to be able to swim alongside dolphins. They are incredible animals. We booked through the Hard Rock Riviera Maya. Everything worked out perfectly. We had transportation there, lockers, lifejackets, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. They take pictures of your time with the dolphins to purchase later on. Yes, it was expensive. $285, but there were three families so split into three, it really isn't that bad at $95 a person. Although with one family, I could see how it would be expensive. However, you do get all the photos and the quality is amazing. We weren't interested in the DVD. We didn't think we'd ever watch it. But the photos are a great memory and we are really happy we purchased them. Amazing experience and a MUST if traveling to this area!

Great experience, but picture prices are crazy. Went with our two kids, ages 15&17. We really enjoyed the experience, as swimming with the dolphins was on our bucket list. We paid a little extra to just have the four of us in the group, and it was worth it. The dolphins pushed us each by our feet, and that was a lot of fun. I had sticker shock at the price of the photos - those and the video were $260. That added 50% to the cost of going there, but they know they've got you. My advice is to look at the reviews of other places. If they have the same experiences without the high-priced pictures, I'd probably go there. If not, this was a lot of fun.

What a ripoff. This review is for Delphinus only, not the Xcaret park. We made the mistake of missing our scheduled pickup from our hotel so we paid for round-trip taxis to and from the park - wound up more economical than the $12pp they were asking for. When we arrive, they tell us that our session already started and wasted 10 minutes trying to find someone who would know if we could enter or not.
