All other sessions for the day are full and we could have the remaining 10 minutes left in the session - would have been wonderful if they didn't waste our time trying to figure that out.We decide not to reschedule to another day and save all of the transportation money. The dolphin was beautiful from afar, but once you were in the water with it, you saw the scars. This particular dolphin had a cracked lip and was bleeding lightly into the water.When they did the dolphin kiss, my niece had blood on her face. Terrible.If you are going to be a spectator and take photos, do not waste your time unless you have a 55-300 or better zoom lens. The "spectator area" is on the side and, depending on which pool your family is in, you may not see anything. Of course, this is intentional so that you buy their pictures. Here are the details on that scam - individual pics are USD $40 each. Or, you could buy their CD-Rom with all of the pictures (about 120 for our group) for USD $280. Or the Pics and Video for $320. Or the pics, video and a book for $350. In other words, If you want any pictures from your day, be ready to shell out another $300. Mind you, this is on top of what you paid to enter and the transportation so it does wind up being one of the most-costly days you could spend in the Riviera Maya area.In all, we cannot recommend this particular park. You may have better luck with any of the other parks offering dolphin experiences.

Awesome experience. Went with my two daughters (6 and 7). Did the package where you get propelled thru the water by 2 dolphins (4 per group) but it was just us 3. They put in a great deal of education into the program I learned a lot. My kids LOVED it. I tried to tip our instructor (Samantha? Sandra?) but she was in the next session. Gave her tip to Rodrigo (the guy who gave us the pre-instructions and showed the instructional video) and I hope it made it to her. The photos/DVD were awesome. I went thru it all before purchasing after reading a review here where the DVD was only half a minute and poor pictures. Ours came out great. It was expensive but worth it for a once in lifetime experience. I mean I was surprised that we interacted with them so much. Even when you were going between activities just being in the same water with them swimming around other guests was special to me. I would probably do this again to be honest if my kids wanted to.

Brilliant experience . We did a 75 min experience with the dolphins. 1st time I have done it. I was a bit dubious, didn't want to do it if the dolphins enclosures were small and unkept but the place is lovely and the dolphins are well looked after and appear very happy. However the cost of the photos and videos are way to much. Our experience with the dolphins was cheaper than the pics. This they should seriously reconsider.
DREAMY. It´s a dream come true to be able to swim, interact, kiss and play with dolphins. They are very kind, sweet, the personnel is really nice and they just love what they do.

Such an amazing experience!. This place is wonderful! They take such good care of the dolphins and not only is the experience fab with all the best bits (foot push, jumps, etc.) but they actually explain and teach you lots about the dolphins, what they like, what they eat, where they come from etc. The photographs are so very expensive and this was the only drawback, $39 for a single print is just far too much so we came away with no photos but some fantastic memories!

Very overpriced. We booked a couples only swim and promised we would have an exclusive swim with the Dolphins. This was partly true but in our pool were another family so we did have to take turns and wait .The experience is amazing but I was very frightened from my ill fitting life jacket in such deep water.The photo package is very expensive and you are not really left with any option as you are not allowed to take your own pictures

Delightful!. Spending time with the dolphins is inexplicably joyful. We were in the water swimming and playing with them. They love a bit of exfoliation, so being stroked is fun as far as they are concerned! If you get the chance, have them swim under your feet and push you out of the water- just brilliant. We paid extra to do the under water experience too - a little scary but fascinating. Only "dislikes" - there is a little bit of waiting around and the official photos are a bit pricey - otherwise thoroughly enjoyable
Dolphin Program. Our trainer was excellent! He was very customer conscious and wanted to make sure everyone in our party was satisfied with the program.

Amazing. This is the best location to swim with dolphins in the area. They have the Dolphins health and welfare in their best interest and they are well looked after. Yes it cost more than other places but you really get your monies worth. The pictures do dose a lot of money but it has to be done.

Great Experience. My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock Riviera Maya for our honeymoon and were delighted to find out that the resort offered a tour at Delphinus! We paid a very fair price for the tickets themselves and had to pay $24USD round trip for transportation to and from Delphinus Park (plus driver's tip). The park was very clean and the staff was friendly. There were also 4 beautiful parrots sitting at different locations throughout the park. We were told that our group (the dolphin boogie surf ride) would have 10 people max in it. But we were put in a group of 9 small children along with their parents and grandparents. The children were very rude and disruptive, and I feel like the dolphins were annoyed and not cooperating like they normally would had it been all adult guests. No one mentioned this being an overbooked group, so we just sucked it up and went along with it. We honestly had an awesome time, despite the overbooking and obnoxious children! We got to do a number of activities with the dolphins and it was a super fun experience. For what we got to do, I don't think that I would have paid any more than the price we got through the resort, but like I said, it was still a very enjoyable time and I would still recommend this to anyone.Side note, you are not allowed to bring your own cameras to this attraction. No cell phones, GoPros, etc. The only way to get photographic memorabilia of your experience is if you purchase the photos that the staff took. The cheapest price for these photos started at $120USD! It really would have been nice to have some photos to look back on, but there was so way that we could 1) afford that price and 2) justify spending that kind of money when we had already paid to get in, paid to get there, and had a perfectly working GoPro that we were told we had to lock up in the lockers at the main entrance. So we just have the memories in our head instead :)

Cancun Dolphins. It was GREAT! Dolphins were great, and so was the staff. I was worried because of so many negative things I've heard about Dolphins in captivity, but they seemed to really care about the animals.

Excellent experience, highlight of the trip to Xcaret. Our 4 year old loved it. This is a good experience with plenty of time in the water. The dolphins seem happy and well taken care of. Definitely worth the money and would make sure to do this if you go to Xcaret. Pictures are ridiculously expensive though so we passed on those. They told us they didn't have lockers for our stuff so I was a little nervous even though I could see our bag from the water. When we got out we realized there were Xcaret lockers just across the path by the bathrooms!

Bronze encounter. We did the bronze encounter as my husband is not a confident swimmer, but swimming with dolphins was on my bucket list, so we couldn't go to Mexico and not do it. We had about half an hour with the dolphins where the swam all around us and we were told how to make them do tricks, such as kissing, clapping, jumping out of the water. I loved every second of it and purchased the DVD with all the photos and video of our experience,

Awesome!. First of all the park is beautiful. We paid a extra $119 usd each to swim with the Dolphins. It's located in the Xel-Ha park. Which cost us around $129 usd each. This park was all inclusive. Alcohol, food, etc... Food was great, the staff was friendly and they seem to care about your needs. Back to the Dolphins, we went on the "dolphin trek" you wear a astronaut type mask over your head and go under water to see the Dolphins in their habitat. I want to say, the pressure hurt my ears. But after a few minutes they were fine. We got to kiss, hug, and dance with the Dolphins. The pictures started out at $205 usd. Which is a little high but they record everything with a GoPro Hero 3. Overall it was a very awesome experience. If you have the extra money it is well worth it.

wow. This has been on my bucket list forever and I was not disappointed. What wonderful gentle creatures they are. I am not a swimmer, but still thoroughly enjoyed this. You are given a life jacket which totally keeps you afloat. We swam with them, shook fins with them, tickled them, got kisses from them and got foot pushed through the water. AN AMAZING DAY.

Amazing experience. We paid for the Primus package that included 2 dolphins and no more than 4 people. The dolphins swam around you and you got to pet them. You got to kiss, shake fins, and a foot push where two dolphins propel you across the water - very cool! The dolphins also did tricks like sing, splash, and simulate a whirlpool around you. Plan to spend an extra $100-200 for photos/video as they won't let you take pictures. There are free lockers, towels, and showers.

Well worth it. The animals are loved and wonderful to be with. The "baby" (5 months old) was in the pool with us and while we were asked not to touch her, she kept comming up and bumping us for pets. Expect to get hit up for an outragous photo package. They start at $150 for the stills, but can be talked down to $120. They also take video if you are willing to sped up to $175. They don't allow your camera in the pool with you.While there are acusations of animal abuse at other places, there did not seem to be any indications of it here. There are long term relationships with the trainers, and dolfins. The Dolfins actually made many of the interaction choices, not the people. It was a wonderful experience.

Great time!. We had a great time with the dolphins and their trainer Dana. We liked the tricks and everyone had fun.The pictures are expensive, but our group of 6 split the bill for them and the videos.

Dolphin Discovery is better value. We paid $169 each for our kids to have the primus 4 package, so was just 4 people with one dolphin. My kids loved the experience, however were a little disappointed no dorsal tow int this package. If you compare with Dolphin Discovery you can do basically the same as the Primus 4 but with extras including the dorsal tow and food and drink is include too! Wish we had known this beforehand. Anyway like I said they did love the experience with the dolphin. Everyone mentions about the photos being expensive and yes they are. About the price of another dolphin swim! It's a big money maker but at least it's something off their bucket list.

Don't believe all the negative reviewers! It's GREAT!. Like you, I read a lot of reviews for this attraction before booking it. The main criticism seems to be the price of the photos etc. we decided this was a "Bucket List" opportunity and booked the "couples swim" package. Just the wife and I, with our own dolphin and trainer for an hour. On arrival we checked in at reception and were guided down to the changing area. Here we signed our disclaimer, and changed, and were given a secure locker for all our belongings, included in the price.We were then sent to the shaded waiting area where we were able to watch an informative video regarding all the work they are doing there and the health and welfare facilities for the dolphins. I must say all very impressive. We could also watch the dolphins interacting with the other groups already in the water with them.We were then given a full safety briefing, more for the welfare of the dolphins than our safety. Following this we were issued with our buoyancy aid, and lead out to start our experience!We actually swam with three different dolphins during the session, and the trainer we were with was Pakal, who was warm and friendly, and gave us lots of information about the dolphins and their care. This was a once in a lifetime experience and it lived up to it. The Photos.For the period of your session a photographer and videographer record your interaction. Yes you may think the cost of the photos is high, but let's put it in perspective. There is no compulsion to buy - there are no high pressure sales tactics. To be honest, the cost of a single picture is quite high ( $40) BUT if you opt for one of the packages the costs tumble. The package I went for was 100 pictures, an 8x10 framed photo and the video record. This was $277. Sounds a lot but without the print and video that works out at $2.77 a picture all on a USB actually a fair price in my opinion. All in all a fantastic, well organised dream come true for us - don't be put off by any of the negative reviews and do this! You will regret it if you don't!

Great experience, Fiance got foot slapped. mostly a great experience, but watch how close you get to the adolescent dolphins. My fiancé was accidentally slapped on the bottom of her foot by one at the very end of our excursion. It would be a higher review had that not happened.

Pure Joy. They really do love their dolphins. it was an amazing experience.It really shows how clever the dolphins are, The optional photo and video package is very worth while, we've watched it several times already.
I love Dolphins. I love to swim with dolphins, the staff allowed us to interact with the dolphins and have fun with them. This is a great activity to remember forever.
Very cool!. This was a great experience. Pictures are pricey so be prepared if you want a keepsake. All in all was worth it. The dolphin trainers are very knowledgeable and friendly.

A dream came true . It was such a amazing day with the Dolphins.we paid for 5 people (two kids 14 month and 2 1/2 years old) 119$ dollar ...20% off ... Instead of 149$ .thanks to the nice staff :) the kids had so much fun! But still feel bad for the Dolphins :( The only thing that really annoyed me was the ridiculous high price for the pictures! (Own cameras are not allowed of course) over 200$ for an usb stick with all the pictures in it + the dvd ... So I just took one photo (you get also a frame with it) and paid 39$ ... Make sure you bring a loooooot of money with you or be smart and let someone take pictures of you from the audience stand ...

Great experience. Have wanted to swim with dolphins for a very long while and am so glad I did. We did the 60 minutes experience. There were six people in our group and only one dolphin which I thought was a bit sparse as we were watching other people quite a bit. However did really enjoy it and the trainers were friendly. The only thing that spoiled it for me was the rip off price of the photos. It was £140 (ish: conversion rate) for a disk with the photos on, we had 59 photos taken. Absolutely extortionate price. As we had nobody else with us on the day, had nobody to take photos from the spectators area. But really wanted photos to remember our experience so went for it. There were other packages they offered you too with extras such as a video which were even more money! Overall we enjoyed the experience.

Totally worth your time and money!. My husband and I LOVED this experience! Dolphins are my absolute favorite animals and getting this one on one experience with them was unforgettable. Some would say the cost is expensive, but I disagree. You're swimming with dolphins! These are highly intelligent creatures that have to be consistently trained and cared for. The veterinary costs alone must be astronomical along with the fees for upkeep and care of the facilities. We had a 2 for 1 ride, so we opted to do the highest level of the experience which included everything (kiss, hug, dance, ect.) and also decided to get the full picture package which included a dvd of our experience, all of the pictures on a usb, a printed book of our pictures from our experience, 3 printed 8x10 photos and 2 wooden delphinus frames for our pictures. To us, this was worth it in order to have our experience. The employees were great and truly care and share a relationship with these animals which I love and respect. Definitely worth the visit.

Love Time With Dolphins. We did the Promax (4 people only) and the only issue was we only had one dolphin to ourselves (other groups of 4 had 2). Otherwise Loved IT! One thing to know is that the cost of pictures / video is extremely expensive. All we really wanted was the video because so many of the photos were just bad pictures but you had to buy a package to get the video. This is the reason for less than 5 stars - otherwise I like the program and that the dolphins are being born in captivity and not captured.I suggest if you have multiple people in your group that you split into two times so you can take your own photos/video.

Expensive but truly memorable and worth it!. We booked Delphinus' top package through our hotel, rather than with the tour company.We struck really lucky on the day and our party of three was joined by a nice Spanish guy, and we got to share 2 dolphins for our experience. It was awesome!!!

comprehensive enjoyable educational experience. thoroughly enjoyed this small group swimming with the dolphins. this also included an educational session on marine biology and these incredible creatures. well worth the money
Dolphin experience. Great experience, picture package they offered was way too expensive , almost $200 for basic. We would have bought if half the price

fun excursion!. we did the extra fee to swim in our own smaller group, with the dolphins. We also bought the photo and DVD package. So, our day was quite expensive, but we enjoyed it. It's not the kind of experience that we can get at home!

Dream came true. This was really a dream came true. We went swimming with dolphins on my best friend's birthday. We did the couples dream swim so that we had more time with our dolphins. It was just us two with 2 dolphins. They were so cute.You first get to see a movie and some extra information. Then it's time for the dolphins. You get to pet them, kiss them, you get the footpush, they jump over you,...Our instructor gave us a lot of information about the dolphins. There's also a photographer and someone who's filming you from the beginning till the end.After the swim they escort you to the room where you van see your pictures.A lot of people say that the pictures are too expensive, but it's a one's in a lifetime experience. We got all the pictures on a USB stick and the dvd movie.

Absolute dolphin experience. Absolutely the most expensive swim with Dolphin experience ever but we were greatly satisfied. From pick up at hotel, to the swim, a full hour with only my family and our own dolphin, trainer staying with us and entertaining the entire family, photo shoot exceptional that get sold to you after you see them. Can't say it is anything else than everything you can wish for except having one at home.... but you'll get the bill that goes with it if you're a family of 5...;-)

One off the bucket list. Unlike most people I've never been that keen on dolphins but I was persuaded to do this and am glad I did! Was a fabulous experience and I'd recommend it to anyone. I did the very basic package but still you get plenty of time to stroke and play with the dolphins, you get to learn about them and there's lots of photo opportunities. I felt their welfare was a priority and they were well cared for.It annoys me that other reviewers have moaned about the price of photos - of course they aren't gonna be cheap, they never are in theme parks etc! You'll probably only do it once in your life and for me the £30 or whatever is money well spent for the reminder of the memory on my wall. Also I wasn't pestered at all, I was told where the photo area was and was allowed to go there in my own time. I think you can only buy the dolphin photos from there rather than in the gift shop like the photos from the rest of the park so maybe some daft tourists need telling this.

A money grabber. Check in staff was it very helpful. I wasted 10 min with the first booth trying to find my reservation for the dolphin swim only to realize it was where you purchase pictures after the swim. The swim itself was good. My family enjoyed it. We went in a group of 9 (5 from my family and 4 from my sisters). Once they saw it was 2 families, they split us up (in the same tank still). We realized why...they took pictures separately so they could sell 2 different discs rather than have the pictures all in one. The least expensive option as $200 for the disc. One single photo was around $45. Yes, like other reviews, they take you to the photo booth before you even have a chance to dry off (probably to get you while the emotions are still fresh).

Overpriced photos but a good experience. My husband was desperate to swim with dolphins and we booked the silver package through Thomson. All the parks provide free transport with the ticket which is great.The pools seemed small for so many dolphins but they all seemed happy enough and most had been born in captivity - I'm no animal rights expert.The handler was great, very funny and helped some of the more nervous members of our group.It was a good experience for me but my husband especially loved it.The bit where the dolphins push you along by your feet so you feel like you're flying is surreal!Photos were far too expensive so we left disappointed that we couldn't just buy one of them.

Not bad.... This was my second experience with swimming with the dolphins. Our dolphin handler was really good, he explained a lot about the dolphins, which we all found interesting. The checking in and getting to the water went very smoothly (we were staying at the Occidental Grand Xcaret, so it was an easy 5 minute walk). During the interaction, I felt there was confusion, it seemed to me that the same tricks were being done for extended lengths to burn time. The photographer was also missing several times.All in all, not to bad of an experience, not sure if it is worth the high price. Now on to the TRAP..."PHOTOS". As soon as you get out of the water, you are ushered to look at your pictures, they don't even let you grab your towel, then you need to make your selection. The photos are put into a totally different sequence (not the same sequence as they were taken). This makes it hard to realize what you are actually getting. Once we got home, then you see all the duplicates (and there were many). The ONE picture I wanted, the one with the dolphins jumping over my group, was "NOT" even included. We ended up buying package two for $286 USD which was supposed to included ALL pictures and the video. That's the trap, they have you there, dripping wet, excited about what you have just done...so you buy pictures. All in all, not a bad experience, but really look over the pictures before you buy...

Brilliant yet Appalling. We booked the trip to Delphinus via the tour desk at the Azul Sensatori. They had a strange system where they'd charge you the full amount for the trip (Primax) of $169 then give you a refund on your return of $40. Three of us opted for the trip though it was mostly for the benefit of my 8 year old son. We were picked up promptly and the trip took 40 minutes. On arrival we were dealt with efficiently enough and given a wristband and allocated group 2. The trip we paid for gave us 45 minutes in the water with the Dolphins with no more than 4 people in a group. So far so good. The briefing was given and we had a teenage girl in our group bringing the number to 4. Mistakes happen and 2 people also appeared to be in the group and started the session before we were in the water. We pointed out there should only be 4 but were told they would sort it out. After about 10 minutes the 2 interlopers were asked to go to a different area of the lagoon. The interaction was interesting and the Dolphin performed various tricks (photo opportunities ) that thrilled our son. All in all excellent.Then it started going wrong. We were taken straight into the photo selling area, dripping wet whilst the "photographer" - I use this term loosely, started selecting photographs. The young girl's parents were shown a video and photos and offered a couple of packages one of which was $100 for photos the other $143 including the video. I had heard prices were extortionate but we probably would have bitten as our son had enjoyed it so much. But no, our package, which was identical to the other party in the group was $322 ! This didn't make sense so we said we could not afford that but could we look at the video which was available at $89. We possibly would have gone for that bar 2 factors, the quality of the video was quite poor and more importantly the 2 people who were removed from our group earlier were in a group of people being offered their complete photo and video package at $99 ! We were at this stage very unhappy and the photographers response was that we were on a more expensive experience, therefore the photographs were more expensive. The photographs themselves were only "OK". They missed several of the key moments (including my son's "Foot Push") and featured more shots of me and my wife rather than our son.We complained to the desk who's response was a deadpan "fill in the customer comment card". We reluctantly bought a single photo for $40 because our son was upset.I could go into more detail but would proffer this recommendation. If the photos don't bother you then this is a great experience, however the blatant rip-off regarding photographs is appalling. I have seen defence of the prices by management stating they are cheaper than other venues this doesn't make up for the attempted exploitation of customers.
A must do. Amazing Experience for the family or couples. The kids loved it and got to swim with the dolphins.Would do it again:)

Amazing. I had the best time at this place having never done this before. The staff were just great (I think her name was Margarette) and gave us a great in-sight into the Dolphins life there.We got to hold their flippers, allow them to roll, we got pushed along by our feet. Expensive photos at the end, but you can go home and view them on-line so you are not carried away in the moment!Well worth the visit.

Amazing wow. This was truly one of the best experiences of my life!One 'to do' from my bucket list ticked. My daughter and I booked this through our Thomson rep and we opted for the silver package which gives an hour in the water with the dolphins and up to 4 people per session. Luckily for us we booked later in the afternoon and we had the dolphins between the two of us. It was UNBELIEVABLE. We played with the dolphins, swam with them and did various tricks where they swam with us or spoke to us etc. my daughter had a bit of a cold so she left the water leaving me alone with these magnificent creatures for what seemed like hours. Physically being with the dolphins was amazing. I felt my heart beat slow down and it felt as though my blood pressure also reduced whilst in the water. Weird I know but true. The culmination of the hour was when the dolphins push you through the water by the soles of your feet at such a speed that you rise up out the water doing what I call a 'titanic' pose with arms out at your sides. This was awesome! I also had the two dolphins swim up on either side of me allowing me to hold on to their fins and pulling me through the water. I could go on and on but I won't as you just have to experience this for yourself! The only criticism is that you can't take any photos of your experience. Whilst in with these amazing creatures a photographer takes professional pics and a video. They are EXTORTIONATE!!! After paying over £100 each for the experience I personally thought that charging nearly £20 for one photo and about £150 for 8 pics was way too much to ask. I didn't even ask about the DVD!! In the end I chose one photo of my experience which was a bit of a shame as I would have happily bought more if they had been asking a reasonable price.
swimming with the dolphins. super fun! organized, exciting for kids and adults, dolphins do tricks with you in the water, cute pictures

Amazing place!. Amazing place! Good choice of different activities and attractions - water, nature, cultural. Great place to spend at least one day there, although I regret that I could not spend more time there :-) O had so wonderful time there!

Absolutely amazing. My husband and I booked a couples dream swim and i can honestly say it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. The dolphins were fantastic, the trainers knowledgeable and friendly and everything was just so wonderful. Yes the photos are expensive - we paid 250usd for all our photos on usb (83 photos), a dvd and a free print but the money is used to help fund breeding and other worthwhile causes in the park. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a once in a lifetime experience! Mary, Luana and Kiara really made our day! Thank you to everyone at the park for a wonderful day! We were even shown the medical positions the dolphins are trained to learn and some other interesting educational facts!

Brilliant. We had 4 people in our group and we spent about 1 hr in the water. I am not a very good swimmer, but I can honestly say it was well worth the money. Photo packages are expensive, but you get 3 choices. We didn't take much money with us, but they delivered to our hotel. Seems a very caring, thoughtful venture with the welfare firstly of the dolphins.Thank you for a memorable trip.
Amazing experience!!. ¨For all the Dolphins lover, this is a wonderful place to visit!!!the experience of swimming with dolphins is amazing and unforgettable!!

what a ride. if you can call something an experience of a lifetime this definitely is to swim with a dolphin.what intelligent creatures they are!!not much to say someone must do this at least once in their lifes!!only con....pretty expensive...

Dolphins in Cancun Riviera Maya. There is an incredible experience, if you go to Xcaret you should try the dolphins, baby sharks, snorkell and diving, there so much fun in the beach and the food is very good, the only thing is the pictures are so expensive. Don`t forget to go the show at the end of thr night is almost to 6:00 pm and its very nice.

Another thing off the bucket list. Dolphins are such amazing intelligent creatures. A chance to interact or even touch them felt so heavenly. Our dolphin was a 24 year old female, called Chiche? Umm, I don't remember the name but we felt in love with her, that's for sure. It was a memorable 45 minutes.Delphinus is located inside Xcaret Park so you need to pay the park entrace separately. Me and my partner pre-booked online and purchased Interax for total of $145 USD. It was fun sharing it with 10 other people but they have options for four people only. In our case, we didn't mind meeting other people too so it was fine.There were shelves (not lockers) provided for our stuff, which made me a little uneasy. But I never read any incident of stolen personal belongings and figured it was pretty secure.Cameras were not allowed but there is a viewing area for the public and we saw some spectators sneaking photos of their family. Since we didn't have company and really wanted photos and video, we were okay paying another $136 USD (total for both of us). Which I think was not too bad considering that it had all our pictures, probably 20 plus in total, two framed photos, DVD of the entire swim, and a cute dolphin USB. We figured it would really be expensive so we were prepared.Only thing was, the dolphin enclosures were pretty small. We asked the trainer if they let the dolphins loose after their operating hours just to have them freely swim in a bigger enclosure. He said they don't do this as it would cause a fight between the dolphins. That being said, I hope that the expensive fees would be used for taking care of the dolphins and making sure their well-being is a big priority.

A lifetime memory . From being picked up by our driver (Edmundo, excellent guy) to leaving and being dropped back this was an afternoon we will never forget The swim was amazing, myself my girlfriend joined up with 2 other girls and had two dolphins.The trainer was extremely knowledgeable and funny, she kept us interested and entertained throughout.The foot push was easily the highlight of the afternoon. Being able to stroke and play with the dolphins left us buzzing even later that night.You will never forget it for as long as u live.I think they realise this though and we did feel shocked at the cost of the photos and video packages.We paid $155 usd for 12 photos to be put on a DVD. We saw many groups who like us paid around $170 usd for the experience, to then add another couple hundred dollars for a few photos seemed massively like a well worked tug on the heart strings.We paid and a few other people we met also did, and a lot of other people were simply priced out by how expensive it was.Anyone in 2014 knows how easy and cheap it is to put a digital photo onto a blank disc.Even a $99 dollar package would have seen them sell twice as many but $155 just seemed to much.The day was amazing and I can't recommend it enough. But the price of the memories will always be a sore point

Dolphins a great experience. We did the Silver experience as a family and really enjoyed the event, we not only swam, touched, stroked, had a foot push ride but also got up close with the trainers and their dolpins on the pontoons to listen to and understand how passionate these trainers were with their animals. It was a bit cheesy in places but overall these beautiful animals are well tendered and bred in a safe and caring environment. The experience was a bit tainted by the cost of the DVD and photos but these are wonderful experiences and I'm sure that's why the costs are hiked so high. Overall were weren't dissappointed. Enjoy!

Amazing day!. We done trainer for a day and it was really worth the money. You are doing a lot of swimming with the dolphins like 8 activities and aswell you can see behind the scenes.We started around 10 and I think we were done at around 16:30.The photos are expensive but for trainer for a day I think it was worth it.
at long last. My wife and I we have waited years to be able to do thisit was great with just Dolphin & Trainer for the two of us.Brilliant, we learnt a lot about Dolphins as well

Amazing experience!. Our family of six (2 adults, 16, 14, 10, 9) swam with dolphins here for my daughter's 9th birthday. We were staying at the Occidental Grand Xcaret Hotel next door and our package included unlimited access to Xcaret park therefore we just had to add the dolphin package on top which we did through the Delphinus website before arriving.The experience was amazing. For the quality of the experience - the price seemed reasonable and we all got to spend quite a lot of time with the dolphin as well as experience the footpush. The trainers were very friendly and the dolphins appeared well cared for. An unforgettable experience!
Fun experience. Nice experience, trainers were friendly. The photos are pricey though, 12 for $137USD but nice to get for memories.

Amazing. I did a lot of research with swimming with the dolphins & where I travelled I had a lot of choice, I chose Delphinus because they care immensely for their dolphins. We were only four in the group which gave you lots of time with the dolphins, they were so beautiful. The Dolphin push was amazing, loved it. You can take your own photos, which we did. I also purchased the video & all the photos as they were so reasonable $143. and contrary to what I read in reviews ,I WAS not hassled at all to purchase & the quality is perfect. I would definitely recommend. We had a great day in Xcaret & stayed into the night for the show
Such a cool experience. I loved that they seemed in good care. Insanely fun and awe-inspiring. The dolphins really seemed to enjoy human interaction.
Amazing experience. Loved every minute of this experience , the trainer was excellent and made sure she gave us plently of information about the dolphins. Thanks for such an amazing experience
lovely experience. loved it but expensive photos. very good trainers and gorgeous dolphins, bit of a long intro and wait though.

Good experience. We had an amazing time swimming with dolphins well worth the money but the photos are over prices my auntie brought the photos and video and the cheapest package was £150 this comes with a video 3 printed pictures and a USB stick with all the photos on

Manipulative and outrageously expensive. The pictures prices are outrageous! 155 dollars for 12 pics?? almost 300 for all pics and video?! And the worst part was that the guide told us that its avaliable on the net but 3 dollars more expensive. When we entered the site later, we discovered that its much more cheap than what we have told! Trying to manipulate people with feelings by presenting higher prices right after than what appears later on the site is very mean! You should be ashame of yourselves

Amazing first time!. I visited here with my two friends yesterday, due to my friends had already swam with the dolphins, they sat & watched. It was my first time swimming with the dolphins & i loved it. I would defiantly do it again sometime! I done a variety of activities with the dolphin, which included; kissing, patting, & doing the foot glide (which felt funny but i loved it)!

An amazing experience!. At first I was very nervous to swim but all the trainers put you at ease they are all very friendly, very professional and you can't tell they really respect the Dolphins.
Worth every penny!

Dolphines whats not to love!!. We have previously swam with dolphins in Florida (and Mexico for me!) BUT this place was phenomenal. We had the silver experience so a full hour in with the dolphins, you arrived and we were given a free tshirt each, then shown to where you could store your belongings and then onto a briefing room. Very quick briefing telling you what to expect and what you can and can't do...then once you had been kitted out with a snug life vest you were put into groups (we had 4 in ours) and taken in to the dolphins area. This was very spacious and very interactive from the minute you get into the water, we swam PAAL and Alush...my daughter who is 12 is not a nervous swimmer but they were instinctively around her alot which she loved. We did the footpush which is awesome although the pictures and noises you make are hilarious but it was totally exilerating....the trainers were very friendly and if you asked questions well that was it it was a mine field of knowledge which is great for everyone.It's expensive to buy pictures and the video but if you are going to do something like this it's worth it for the memories.I have to say this beats Discovery cove for the dolphin interaction alone and would recommend this to anyone,as this is right in their habitat...they are also into educating people and the local school kids and also a breeding program to better understand this species and also education and animal welfare, they are doing so much for this including cleaning beaches up and organising visits for disabled kids to help with their rehabilitation.What more can you say but it's so worthwhile it really is!
Great day. Great time - would advise a hat if you're prone to sunstroke as there is no shade available while interacting with the dolphins

A FULL day of all kinds of fun. Not sure where to begin. It is kind of like a nature/old town/rodeo/water park Universal Studios kind of place. A enclosed park, but sooo big. Started off by touring in the old churches (hot up top, cool under ground), then went for a underground type river tube ride with a snorkle...this took 1-1/2 hours and was so fun (not to rough at all - and spotters on the route for safety). Then ate at a buffet of every authentic Mexican dish U can imagine. Watched the horse show, and small parade, then rodeo type event. WOW, already 3pm! Finally found the beach/ocean and u can swim with the fish (Warm water) on ocean edge. NOW we did not do the tour (no bus), we rented a car, so if you do this, do not freak out.. the federal police will stop you at two checkpoints between Cancun and the Park.... no worse than a border checkpoint US/Mexico. Advice is lots of sunscreen, and water!

You don't do this at SeaWorld!. We went for the 30 minute (v. 45 minute) package, which was $99 (v. $149) at the park. I suspect that the more expensive package has a few extras/fewer people per dolphin, but if you have small kids with you (ours were 4 and 5), the 30 minute package was more than plenty. It actually was 45 minutes in the water with "our" dolphin, but I don't think you get a few of the extras like getting pushed by it or having it jump over you (which, frankly, might have been too much for our kids). Everyone wears a life vest, and if you are with anyone who cannot swim, make sure that they are comfortable being in the deep water in a life vest. All that said: This was a blast. It might not have been the best-spent money, but it was the most fun. There is an assembly-line aspect to the whole operation, but who cares as this is probably the first time you've done this! You really do get to see the dophin up close (lots), and it's enough fun that you can easily suppress for the moment any thoughts of whether this set up is good for the dophins (probably not). At least they got a lot of fish. For the kids, it was a memorable time; adults, too. Lots of the reviews slam the photo costs, with some justification. Basically, the staff take a bunch of pictures, and then they descend on you like used-car salesman until you relent. We ended up paying $200 for all the pictures in digital files, and a mostly useless movie (terrible quality), and they threw in a print and frame. I suspect had we bargained, we could have gotten more thrown in, because it is all margin for them. If you have a large group, the pricing isn't as outrageous for the number of pictures you get (and a lot of the pictures were quite good), but if all you wanted was a few pictures, the pricing is a bit off-putting.If you are at Xcaret and have any interest, you should do this, particularly if can get pricing that's better than what's offered at the park. It was a real highlight of our visit.

Dolphins great - Complete package - Not so good. Swimming with dolphins is probably gonna be one of the greatest experiences in your life - this fact proved to be true for us, but sadly the Delphinus crew did not want us to bring home the memories in form of pictures and videos unless we paid a total sum of 309 usd for the complete material on a DVD. Now - how stupid is this. You are not allowed to shoot your own images - so you have to buy a package to get any photos. This is ridiculous. I would suggest to Delphinus that they offer you 1-2 photos for free if you share them on facebook, instagram or whatever. This would both give Delphinus free marketing and the guest would be able to bring home free memories and be more likely to invest maybe a smaller sum to get the video and more pictures.

My daughter's dream came true. Booked through Thompson silver experience just right, got T-shirt and 45 mins in the water with 2 dolphins we got in and up close watched the Dolphins and joined in their tricks, best was the footpush at the end. You get to view all of the shots taken and are offered options to purchase not cheap but a must have as you cannot take your own shots. You cannot wear lotion only bio degradeable if an hr before. Towels, lockers showers available.

Wow. This trip didn't start off too well. Seemed very busy and disorganised and we were worried that we would be in a large group with little chance of seeing a dolphin. But what a surprise when we finally got to the swim - my husband, my 4 year old son and I were with an instructor on our own with our own dolphin. The instructor, Ricardo, was great with our son and allowed him time to get used to the dolphin and then started doing interactions. It included the dolphin jumping over us all and a toe push, which was amazing. Photos and dvd could be purchased, expensive but worth the cost for unforgettable memories.

Swam with the Dolphins!. This was an amazing activity, and I loved that it was attached to our resort (The Occidental Grand XCaret). It was worth every penny for the Prima experience with the dolphins, and I wish I had taken my 3 1/2 year old, because she would have loved it as well!The only downside was that we paid $242 for pictures, which we had no problem doing, but once getting home and looking through the USB, we realized that two key pictures we all really wanted were not there. After an e-mail to Delphinus it has still not been resolved. I am hoping they will find those photos or offer a partial refund. (And yes, we know the photos were there as we viewed them before purchasing the $242 package).

Fantastic Experience. One of the best set ups I have seen for swimming with dolphins and the best thing is only 4 people per dolphin. Perfect time, wonderful memories. Just beware you need a 2nd mortgage to buy photos and dvd.
swimming with alexa. Had an awesome time, the trainer was really patient and Alexa was beautiful. The footpush was amazing!

Once in a Lifetime. What an amazing experience, We had 45 minutes in the water with 2 Dolphins, and we danced with them, stroked them, had them dive over us :-) and also got pushed through the water by them.We have some wonderful photos and Video of the session, which are taken by their photographers. You don't have to buy them, but we are so glad we did.Everything is provided on site, life jackets, lockers, towels and a very knowledgeable trainer.We are so glad we did this, as it is probably something we will not get the chance to do again, it really is a once in a lifetime thing to do.

LOVED every minute & couldn't stop smiling!. Once you get through the rigmarole of your "orientation" and in the water, it is a spectacular experience. Cab was our girl and she was a delight. We were a group of 4 and had about an hour in the water. We did the dolphin push in addition to lots of other activities with her. Our trainer was very informative and friendly, wish I could remember his name. As other reviewers mentioned it isridiculous how much is charged for ONE 8x10 photo in a cheap wooden frame with no glass. Since you could not bring your phone or camera with you, you had no choice but to buy if you wanted a photo. The $39 photo was the least expensive.

Good day out. Me and my girlfriend went here in june 2014 had an amazing experience swimming with the dolfins, the only down fall is the price was about £80-£100 per person and they took photos and a video of us with the dolphins and that cost over £100 but the way i look at it iv done it now got the tshirt, and probely wont do it again. The dolfins where treated very well.

5 star experience ruined by the price of the photos and quailty of the video.. Me and my girlfriend booked to do the couples dreams swim about a month before we went to Mexico. We saved a lot of money booking it online so it was well worth it. On the day the mini bus was on time to pick us up and the whole day run very efficiently. The actual experience was amazing, easily one of the best things we have both ever done. We thoroughly enjoyed it and it was well worth paying the extra for the couples swim as we got a whole hour in the water with a dolphin that stayed just with us two the whole time. I would definitely recommend the couples dream swim to any couples thinking of visiting Delphinus. Now on to the negative and it’s a big one. We were fully aware of the outrageous photo prices before we went as we had looked on trip advisor before we went. After the swim you are told to go into the photo shop before you've had a chance to dry off or get changed. They then show you all the photos, which were very good quality pictures. They then show you a small excerpt of the video which also looked good quality. They then tell you the prices which are insanely expensive. In order to get all the pictures and the video it cost us $252, we desperately wanted these so we reluctantly paid it. When we got home back to England we were eager to watch the video and look at the photos. There was 157 good quality photos which we were very happy with. When we looked at the video it was 10 minutes 57 seconds long, we were told it was a 12 minute video before we purchased it. Our disappointment was then furthered when we realised the first 7 minutes of the video was just the dolphin swimming around us in the pool. We did so many activities with the dolphin yet over half of the video was just the dolphin swimming around. This seemed to be to just fill the video out to make it longer. The excerpt they show you in the shop is the best bit of the video to get you interested in buying it. The video also has music being played over the top, so when the dolphin is making noise you cannot hear it. This is one of the activities you do with the dolphin yet you cannot hear it on the video. We felt really let down by this so I emailed Delphinus to complain about the video, they emailed back straight away and sounded promising in sorting something out for us. However I didn't hear anything for two weeks so I emailed them again to which they replied. They sent me a link to download the same video again and saying that the video could be shorter than 12 minutes, this wasn't what we were told before purchasing. They didn't address the issue of the video being filled out with footage of the dolphin just swimming about. They made it seem like they were going to be very helpful but ended up being very unhelpful. Overall the actual dolphin swim experience is absolutely excellent but be prepared to be ripped off for photos and receive a poor video if you decide to buy that too.

Outrageous cost. Now don't get me wrong the overall experience is unbelievable. 3 kids and 1 adult it wasn't cheap but the kids wanted to do it, I didn't mind paying the money for the experience when you ask the rep about the cost of pics at end he was very evasive you know you are going get stung. They kissed the dolphins danced with them got foot pushes out of the water and were full of excitement when they had finished. Now they hit you 113 photos and a video we took of your family. You can have 12 pictures for $199 or all pics and video on USB for $242 yes you heard me!!!! Absolutely ridiculous price for photos no movement on the cost at all. In the end we took all pics and video got a $22 off the cost.The photos and video are unreal great memories to always have.

Wonderful. Had an excellent day with Andre as our trainer. We bought the Trainer for a Day package, as a couple, and I am not exaggerating when I say we were with the dolphins from 11 am till 4 pm with short breaks in between. It was so worthwhile, just for the foot push alone, and the photos we bought were amazing!We also got a free photo, certificate and t-shirt, which is cool. It was also all-inclusive so we had lunch as well as towels and lockers for our convenience. The experience with the dolphins was incredible and while I had my reservations about the nature of their captivity I felt content after seeing how well looked after they were. I would thoroughly recommend this experience. Tip - remember to take plenty of money to buy the photos. It can cost up to $250 dollars.

ABSURD. The dive with the dolphins was great, but they take advantage of this unique moment to exploit people. At the end of the dive, when you think you have the record of this moment, they assail you: $ 39 for a photo, $ 179 for 12 photos and $ 220 for all the photos, while the dive is $ 79. It's absurd! We felt ripped off. At least they had warned the prices before the dive. I can not be silent in face of this fact.

What an experience. This would be a 5 (was our unanimous fav trip) if not a bit disappointed by the video ( read below).Family of 4 booked via Thomson on silver package. Lots of time with dolphins (about an hour in the water), staff superb and the foot push a real treat. If you ever fancied this, Delphinus are fab.The photo and video package: we saw some of the photos and an excerpt from the video so purchased this package (on USB and DVD) but of course couldn't view until back in Scotland. Photos great but DVD poor value as 2 thirds from one section of swim with lots missed out ( dancing with Pal, kisses with Pal, and others) hence why not 5 as the package isn't cheap. I recommend watching video before deciding.

Amazing experience. We came here on our honeymoon and paid a bit extra for the silver package. It was well worth it. We spent an hour in the water with a dolphin my husband and I.it was a magical experience. Loved every minute. I would defos recommend. The dolphins are very well looked after.

Primax package is awesome....photographers and pictures not do much. Let me start off by saying the Primax package is amazing. The dolphins are phenomenal, the trainers are very knowledgeable and caring, but the photograph package was excessively expensive! We arrived at the lagoon during a rainstorm and when there was a break in the clouds we entered the lagoon to swim with the dolphins. Once on the dock we were assigned our own personal paparazzi since we paid extra to have a dolphin experience with just our family. Once we got in the water it started raining again and our personal paparazzi disappeared (understandable as they wouldn't want the equipment ruined). After a few minutes we had to get out of the lagoon due to lightning, so we waited about 10 minutes for the storm to pass. Once we got back in the lagoon our photographers did not return, so our trainer kept making us do the same stunts over and over hoping the photographer (who was now photographing a different group) would return. We could tell the trainer was getting frustrated and moved us closer to the photographer in another pool. When we finally had the pictures taken we were asked to get out of the pool and that our experience was complete.We were ushered into a photo/video hut to view the videos and photos of our group. Our video had other people on it even though we paid for the primax, but our photos were good. The price however, was craaaaazy. For $199 USD you could purchase 12 digital pictures on a USB, Or for I think it was $249 you could purchase the video plus all 80 pictures that were taken...ummmm....WHAT? We asked if we could change out of our wet clothes and let them know once we were changed-all of a sudden our sales person no longer spoke English other than the word 'no'. This was our kids first tropical vacation and dolphin encounter so we reluctantly purchased the bigger package, but are REALLY unhappy with the price...as a bonus they printed four of our pictures on really cheap photo paper and said we would get 4 frames (which we never got).I realize there is nothing we can do about the weather, and the trainer seemed just as aggregated as we were, so I will say the experience was worth it... But for our family of four the little experience cost us over $800USD for 45 minutes. Yikes!

Dream Couples Swim. We did the couples dream swim at Xcaret (not in the park we came through a separate way just for the dolphins). The swim was great, our dolphin was very nice and looked happy. All the dolphins were given great care (our swim was stopped to make sure our dolphin got medical care for a small injury she had on her dorsal fin). Our trainer was AMAZING! Every time I go to places like this I ask a lot of questions because I want to learn & she was never annoyed & very informative. Her name was Stephanie and she spoke English and Spanish very well!I really loved this place (although prices for pictures are ridiculous). We got a deal because our video didn't record, if we hadn't gotten the deal I wouldn't have purchased them.I would not recommend doing the excursion in the park, it was much better going there for only the dolphins because you go in a different secluded area. Also, you get special pictures with the couples swim and instead of waiting in line for the next thing (which you do if you have more than 2 in a group) you get to touch and play with the dolphin.

Excellent Experience. We had a great time; the Dolphins and trainers were truly amazing. The Dolphins are clearly very well looked after and from their behaviour you can see how happy and relaxed they are. We picked this complex after seeing just how much better their large natural pools were compared to some of the other swimming pool style ones in the area. They also take you through how the animals are treated and how rescue animals are rehabilitated. Would highly recommend this bucket list activity. Only bad thing is they really lock you in to buying their photos which are a little overpriced though they are very professionally taken.
Even You Adults Will LOVE THIS. AmazingMust DoFor Interested Children buy Trainer For A Day which is just a few $ more but ABSOLUTELY Fun

overpriced and unprofessional. The price is unbelievably high. I bought it in my resort (Grand Mayan Riviera Maya) and they charged me supposedly 169 USD with rate 13.3 and refunded 40 USD after visit at rate of 11USD. So, the price was not as p[promised 139 USD considering difference in exchange rate.Delphinus Xcaret personnel keeps observers so far from where your relatives or friends are communicating with dolphins that you cannot take pictures. This means you have to buy them. OK, it would be fine, but they promise 12 pictures because there are 12 activities with dolphins and you get one pic of each activity. We could not choose 12 pictures because they suck at taking pictures. They did not have all activities and they took pictures at worst moments. We liked only one picture and I asked if I could purchase only one and they said yes but 12 pictures were 100USD and one was exactly half of that. Really!!!!Also, as many stated experience was suppose to last 50 minutes, but they have soooooo many people at any one time divided in groups of 4 and 5 letting them one by one to do one activity that lasts less than a minute. Also, they talk too much between activities so total time for 169USD you spend with dolphin averages to 15 minutes with horrible pictures at the end that I had ti purchase because my child begged me to (which mother can tell no to a child).There were also a lot of restrictions as what you can do and when. You just stand there and not swimming with dolphins (ironic because it called swimming with dolphins) and trying to be quick on just petting it as it swims by you. Horrible, horrible, horrible, horrible.Now calculate how much money those thieves making on unsuspecting tourists: 169 per person (was about 30 people X 169=5,070; lets say half of them purchase basic package at 100X15=1,500 ---- everything totaling to 6,570). All that only for first group of people at 7AM.

Overpriced!!!. Great experience but totally over priced and they then try to make more money out of you by charging an absolute fortune for the pictures.I think the basic picture package started at $160 US dollars. The dolphins were great and we had a lovely time but just felt a bit ripped off by the whole experience!

Mark it off your bucket list. Very, very, very (and may I repeat, very) expensive experience. There is so much wasted time that you pay for, it is unbelievable. Beware- if they have you walk across the wooden deck be sure you have your flip flops on. We all burned the bottoms of our feet (my poor little girls ended up having to be carried so they wouldn't get blisters) . It is a long walk (or run if the soles of your feet are burning.)The worst part was that they didn't warn us, nor did they feel bad that we were all in massive pain. Once we were in the water with the dolphins, it is an amazing experience. You can ask the trainers questions about the dolphins and they are very knowledgeable. Two of the dolphins were pregnant and we were allowed to pet the underside of their body.If you plan on buying the pictures be prepared to pay top dollar. They want over $350 for the pictures and a DVD of our 30 minute experience. Wow! That was outrageous. Needless to say, we did not purchase them, however my mother was able to get some pictures from the outside waiting area. While I would not do it again, I am glad we did it at least once in our lives.

Swim with the Dolphins. While staying at the FAB Secrets Maroma Beach we swam with the Dolphins at Delphinus Xacaret. Although a little pricey it was a once in a lifetime experience. We went with a group of four and got to spend ample time in the water with multiple dolphins. We got to touch them, do tricks, get a kiss and even have two of them push us through the water their nose to our feet! It was incredible, but the experienced was ruined with the price of the pictures afterwards. It cost almost as much as the experience itself to buy 12 photos. 1 photo was $40 and they didn't even provide an option that had me, my husband and a dolphin in it! It was either or. Then we found out that if we had a spectator with us they could have taken all the photos they wanted for FREE! It felt like a scam. The swimming part was great, but it was soured in the end.

Great experience with dolphins - administratively not good. You waste a lot of time with adminstrative type stuff and it is very unorganized. The dolphin portion was great, but there are other dolphin experience with out all of the hoops to jump through.
Expensive experience of a lifetime. Once in a lifetime,thank god because of the price,great interaction full hour of swimming.BEWARE the photos are a right rip off,

Once in a life time experience. What can i say? It was on our bucket list and Delphinus didn't disappoint! the set up is very natural with fresh sea water coming in and out (know this as there are fish and jelly fish around). The Dolphins are amazing and seem really happy. What i loved about this place is that it isn't just about the tourism, they are also a conservation project and work with children with learning difficulties and provide sessions called dolphin therapy.Out of all the dolphin experiences on offer, i would recommend this one!!! Only down side is that you can't take your own camera and the pictures are VERY expensive. $39 for one picture and over $200 for all the pictures and a 10 min video. If you go as a couple they don't take couple pictures with the dolphins.

Cool place.. Pros: Tons to do, a beach, a man made river to float down, life jackets provided, a bag to put your stuff in while you floated down the river (I did not put valuables in it for obvious reasons). There was an inlet with tons of big sea turtles that you could get really close to. Holding tanks you could walk right up to with baby sea turtles. There was an amazing butterfly house, a jaguar island, a manatee lagoon, an orchid greenhouse. The restaurant food, and service was great from what I recall. All of the employees we encountered were very friendly. They had tropical birds, and all kinds of wild life there including dolphins, and stingrays that you could swim with, etc. Something for all age groups. We did not see the show at night, but I had heard it was awesome. The place was well worth the money to me. You can get a locker with the Xcaret Plus package which comes with one lunch buffet, a drink, and use of the snorkeling equipment. We opted for the basic package, brought a water proof zipper pouch, that clipped to a belt loop, to put money in, and paid for lunch separately. Just as a side note, there is plenty to do if you don't want to shell out the extra dough for the extra experiences. Cons: I would have given 5 stars if their bus hadn't left us there. They had 2 buses that we could take one around 5pm, and one after the night show. One hour before the supposed departure of the first bus we were out there waiting for it only to find out that it left very early, and wasn't coming back until after the show. Fortunately, they had an atm inside where I was able to get some cab money. There were tons of cabs out front. Otherwise we would've had to wait there exhausted for another 4+ hours.Tips: Bring cash for a cab, money for lunch (the restaurant took debit when I went), sunblock, a waterproof camera, swim shoes, rash guards are worth it for those who burn easily. Be prepared to take LOTS of pictures.

Great Experience for My 7 Year Old. My son swam with the dolphin during our visit to Xcaret. I was a little nervous at first because he was going to do this adventure alone (with me watching, not in the water). He was also a little nervous at first. The trainer was very welcoming and guided my son into the water and allowed him to get comfortable before having the dolphins get too close to him. Once is was comfortable, he loved the experience. The dolphins seem very well cared for and they were very appropriately trained for children. My son was able to touch and guide the dolphins, an experience he will never forget. I would recommend this experience for all, young and old.

Bucket list. This was on our bucket list of things to do, and we did it! As we were honeymooners, we got the full works, just the two of us in our group, and got such quality time with our dolphin 'Jacumm' and his trainer. Truly fantastic

memories are made of this.. we went to mexico in april of this year and the highlight of the holiday was swimming with the Dolphins in Xcaret. It has been one of my biggest wishes to swim with dolphins, not that I thought I would ever be able to, but my came wish came true just 2 weeks ago and boy was it worth waiting for!!! We had the silver package (Thomson) and spent 75 minutes in the pool with the dolphins and trainer, who was really very nice, answering questions etc. Towels were supplied and transport too, and there were only 4 of us in the group so it felt quite intimate.I cannot tell you how much I enjoyed it even though I am not all that confidant in the water it didn't matter because you have to wear a lifejacket. I felt like a kid again, and that doesn't happen too often when you are 66yrs old!!!! So many thanks to the staff at Xcaret and my new best friends THE DOLPHINS OF XCARETxxxxx
Loved it!!. Fantastic time swimming with dolphins here! they seemed very well looked after and the staff were really nice. great experience

amazing. swimming with the dolphins was always on my bucket list so I was like a kid in a candy store when I seen those beautiful creatures... Our guide was a little blunt, didnt seem to have much personality ( didnt show excitement for her visitors) but I never let that bother me, I was too happy ! They also took wonderful pictures !!! P.S anyone going to the site with you and are not getting in with the dolphins can easily get nice pictures of you from the shore with a good camera!!

Awesome. Booked the silver package through our holiday rep which gives you an hour swimming with the dolphins. Compared to other parks we looked at this one does not take more than four people into the pool which gives you more one to one with these amazing mammals. I cannot really put into words how fantastic it was but the most memorable moment was the foot push OMG it was something I will never forget.No cameras are allowed in the park but there is a photographer who takes loads of pictures which you can purchase at the end. I will say on this point that they aren't the cheapest !!

Amazing animals. Swimming with dolphins was on my bucket list and interacting with the animals for one hour was amazing. Dolphins truly are extremley intelligent animals. The highlight for me was the dolphin push where you lie flat in the water and two dolphins use their beaks to push you out the water. Thoroughly recommend this on your stay in Cancun.

Amazing experience. We booked the 1 hour package and really loved it. We were travelling with a 2 year old so were a bit apprehensive since only the day before we took him to the beach and he was afraid of walking on the sand. Our little one was a trooper. He was happy and apprehensive but didn't cry and even kissed the dolphin. If you are travelling with young children wouldn't worry too much as all kids love big fish(I know it's not a fish but that's how we made sure he wasn't afraid). The foot push was incredible. Only disappointment was the expensive photos and video. The video isn't even HD. I brought my camera and thought I would be able to film in pristine hd, but hey had to bite the bullet on that one. Overall I loved it.

fabulous!. swimming with dolphins, just awesome, trainers really fun and friendly and dolphins obvs happy!! :) book seperatly with rep though not actually at the xcaret as you go to a different private place at the back of the park not in the xcaret park where everyone can see you.

Memories to treasure for ever!. My friend and I have always wanted to swim with Dolphins, and after talking with our Thomson rep, we decided to go for the Silver package at Delphinus at Xcaret. We weren't sure what to expect and were able to take some friends along with us to be our photographers etc...but what we didn't realise is that with the Silver package, you are taken to a more secluded area away from the main pools so that you are on a more personal note with the dolphins. They don't mind about friends coming, but our friends were waiting in the main spectator section and therefore missed our session - so I had to buy the DVD and photographs as it is a once in a lifetime experience for me and I really didn't want to have anything to remember the day by.There are a maximum of 4 people with 1 dolphin on the silver package and near the end of our session we had another dolphin join us. We did the dolphin push, the pull along, the kiss, and many other things - it was truly amazing!
best swim with the dolphins ever. we did the couples dream swim and it was awesome. we learned alot about dolphins while also getting to interact with them.

NEVER GO! The biggest steal in the amusement industry!. The whole xcaret is a disaster! Fake everything for a cost of an entire vacation in Mexico.They sell this magic xcaret+ with a "discount" for 143$ with an inherent value of probably 14.3$! The bus taking you there is not even close to what they commit...the place is cery poorly arranged...dispersed and not even clean. Everything has a cost higher than even Disney parks...the buffet they upsell for 35$ a person is awful...worse than the worst all inclusive...and they even charge for coffee during the meal. The worst of everything is the Dolphin experience! 109$ for a 20 minutes group visit (groups of 8) where you can probably touch the Dolphin for 2 minutes total! They try to sell you a 30$ upgrade to "enhance" this horrible experience. Parents and friends can never face the kids...so no pictures can be taken...out of the water they call you in a room where they try to sell a dvd for 360$!!!! Or 300$ if you don't want the 15 seconds video...when you buy (stupid of me) the pictures only dvd and share the cost with your friends you realize that the pictures are no more than 10 per kid...and the resolution is worse than my iphone's! The size of the pictures are 800kB!!! They should close this whole village down and sue the people that are behind it. NEVER GO! Enjoy the cancun and riviera maya nature...

Xcaret - The Highlight of our stay in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. There are many signs along the highway from the Cancun Airport to Playa del Carmen and in and around the city of Cancun advertising Xcaret. This is one place I think visitors to the area should go and really plan on having a wonderful time. I have been fortunate to have been there twice and I find it a wonderful place to visit. The entire complex is very well organized and run with efficiency. The staff are friendly and very accommodating. The grounds, pathways, bathroom, showers and changing facilities are extremely well maintained and clean. There is numerous activities to take in which are included in the price of the entrance ticket. There are other activities which cost extra but also provide a wonderful experience. When we went to Xcaret there was a sign stating that is you paid using a Mastercard your second day was free. We bought our tickets at our hotel and received the second day half price. So keep this in mind. There are wonderful authentic restaurants on the complex with a variety of delicious food items. After a full day in the sun and swimming at the Xcaret beaches there is a wonderful stage show featuring dozens and dozens of actors, singers and dancers. The show, which begins at 6 p.m.. tells the history of Mexico through colourful pageants from the early beginnings of the Mayan people on through the coming of the Spanish conquistadors, the missionaries and up to late 1800's. It depicts the culture and customs of the different areas of Mexico. A day at Xcaret is very full with activities, things to see such as the butterfly pavilion and on and on and on. So many of the activities are included in the entrance price. You do not have to buy tickets for other activities but if you so desire the option is there. Go early in the day and take advantage of the second free day. A taxi ride from Playa del Carmen to Xcaret will cost approximately $12.00 and when the evening stage show is over there are dozens of taxis waiting to take you back to your hotel. If you are staying in Cancun or even in Playa del Carmen or down the Mayan Riviera you can take a bus tour to the complex, spend the entire day and the buses return you to your hotel at the end of the day. For those people like myself who carry a lot of camera gear there are secure lockers which you can use while swimming at the beach or swimming in the underground rivers and cenotes. The management and staff at Xcaret have thought of everything that will make your day a enjoyable experience. Xcaret is a wonderful way to spend time while in Mexico. You will not be disappointed with this wonderful family attraction. There is something for people of all ages and so many lovely places to just sit and relax and enjoy the wonders of nature around you.

Amazing! I do it again tomorrow if I could!. A bucketlist staple for many, you may go into this with a 'once in a lifetime' attitude, and you may be right, but I'd do it again if I ever get the chance. Experiencing the dolphins up close is a fantastic experience.You get briefed first, and then introduced to the dolphins in the water. We had an hour booked in the middle of the day, but you can't wear sunscreen in the water with them, so if you are fair you may want to avoid the midday slots. They seem to separate you into language groups, rather than have to say everything in 10 different languages all the way through I guess, and it's usually six people per group, but it was only us and one other English lady there so we were a group of three. This meant we got through everything quickly, so they took us to one side to talk to us about the dolphins and show us how they care for them, which was really interesting. The trainers are really passionate about it and it was lovely to see.We got to do the foot push, they jumped over us, swam around us, the dominant male demonstrated his power by soaking us with a slam of his body in a rush of speed, we played with them - throwing toys etc as well as photogenic activities like the kiss and dance poses.The photos are expensive, $39 for a 10x8" print, and we got the usb stick with 68 photos on between the two of us which cam with a dvd. This option was $198. The photos were really good though, the photographers know their stuff and are continually snapping away. The dvd was less good, there was a lot of us in the water with the dolphins at the beginning and then the rest was a bit rushed at the end, but we weren't that interested in the dvd, we just got it because there was no package with just the photos on a usb alone.Was it expensive? Sure, but it was worth every penny. :D

Great place for the family. We took our daughter and grandson and everyone had a wonderful experience. The tickets were a little steep but it included just about everything. We spent the entire day and left completely exhausted. Our six year old grandson came home with great stories to tell his 1st grade class. I would highly recommend for anyone with children up to and including teenagers.People in wheel chairs and walkers won't have that much fun since there is lots of walking involved. The exhibits are all very professional and the park personnel are all very informed and helpful. It's hard to get too lost since there are so many people to point you in the right direction. Don't miss the photo op with the parrots. It was a big hit with our grandson.

interesting experience. Was a good experience, I was a little scared by the size of the dolphins but they seemed very docile so it was ok,We swam in Riviera Facility. I especially loved seeing the reproduction part. Was amazing to see dolphin calves, was trying to remember how many calves there were to tell my family.They are going next year and they have to visit Xcaret!The photos were a little pricey but I had read reviews before so I knew what to expect. We bought the photos as it was a one off experience. It's not everyday your so close to a wild animals.Fantastic.

Wonderful experience. Booked through hotel travel agent but paid extra when we arrived for the couples experience which got us at shirt , me & husband with just the trainer and 5 dolphins ! I loved every minute and the trainers were so good and very funny :) only fault very expensive for the photos and videos :( would I go back ? Big yes :))

Great experience, such a shame the photos are so expensive. As swimming with dolphins was on my bucket list we decided that this would be a great opportunity to fulfil this.We booked onto the 4 person experience which was fantastic and gave you a lot of time to interact with the dolphins and to experience the foot push which was great. The dolphins were amazing and you got to stroke them and complete a lot of activities with them.The only downside of the experience is the cost of the photos, I know a lot of people on here have said the same thing so just be warned if like me you want to be able to take home something to remember the experience you should be expecting to pay about the same price as the experience to get a cd of the photos that were taken and the dvd which was shot. The options on photos seemed limited it seemed to be all or nothing which is a real shame.
