swimming with dolphins. just got back from swimming with dolphins , it was fine, i must admit though after i thought about it i felt quite sad for them , same thing every day in quite small pens , not saying there not loved but felt for them . it cost $169 each but you got a voucher for $40 dollars for another excursion. the rip of part for me were the photos , $40 for one photo , $170 for appx 12 pictures , and $289 for the memory stick and dvd i didnt see many people buying and the other person in our group brought 1 photo of his son, he said the same as us , if they were to use common sense im sure they would make so much more money , i felt they play on sentiment you fall in love with dolphins then buy pictures well sorry didnt work with me ..

A pricey Wonderful experience. My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday as it's something I've talked about doing. It wasn't planned enough in advance for us to look on here and hear that the photo's would double the price of the experience. I think if I'd known that ahead of time I would have been better prepared...or I fear I wouldn't have done it. It was such an amazing highlight of our trip, the trainers are so wonderful and the dolphins are well taken care of. The water you are in is actually ocean water--so it might not look nice but it's preferred to the dolphins. When we told the trainer it was my birthday everyone sang me happy birthday in Spanish while the dolphin made musical sounds to go along with it! How can you put a price on that? Well they can--we received 58 photos and a dvd for $198USD. They got us when we were all happy and elated from being in the water, no where before hand do they let you know the prices. We paid because we didn't want to regret not having them. If you're going to do it, get the photos--they are great. Just know ahead of time that you'll pay.

Great day out!. This was a famntastic experience in a beautiful park. So much to do and the shows were amazing. We loved every minute of it especially the snorkelling in the rivers. We would definitely come again next year to this [park. The show at the end was in Spanish but that is the only criticism sas it was so musical and colourful.

Loved dancing with Melissa. It was very exciting to dance with Melissa, a dolphin rescued and trained there. We bought the tickets for Delphinus and scheduled for our adventure when we arrived to xcaret. Can't miss it!
Enjoyable experience. We booked the excursion for 4 people. We interacted with the dolphins for about an hour and had a lot of fun. If you want pictures be prepared to pay!

Best experience!. We loved the dolphin swim. We booked the one with a group of 4. The best part was when 2 dolphins put their noses on your feet and push you through the water. We ended up buying the DVD and all of the pictures. So much fun!

Swim with dolphins, well pet a lot of dolphins. My sons and I booked the 90 minute session. Nice facility and wonderful dolphin handlers. The program starts out fine. You pet dolphins, have then push you by your feet, shake hands. Then you take a twenty minute break. Back in the pool for another session. This time you are "snorkeling" with the dolphins. In reality, they hand you a mask without a snorkel and you tread water while the dolphin passes you by. You reach out and touch them as they go by. It is not snorkeling. That part was disappointing to me, but it is completely understandable. The dolphins are under the control of the trainer at all times. Out of the pool again for another 20m and then back in for a third session. Our third session was ride the dolphin and then a lot of line up and pet her as she swam by. So in a nut shell you really don't swim or snorkel with dolphins, you just interact with them under controlled scenarios. Happy we did it, just calibrate your expectations. They sell VERY EXPENSIVE pictures at the end. They do sell food there. The hamburgers and hot dogs cost $10 each.

Dream Experience. My boyfriend made my childhood dream come true to swim with dolphins with this company. I had a blast! I do warn that the staff are the only ones allowed to take pictures, which they will then sell to you (a package of pictures and a video). Get your wallet ready!

One tick for the bucket list!. Such an amazing experience swimming and snorkelling with such beautiful animals!! First swim included the foot push, kiss, cuddle, shake, rub down and it was amazing! got some beautiful photos as well! The second swim allowed us to snorkel with them, watchign them eat fish and then try out some really cool tricks like jumping, spinning, singing, etc.Price was a bit steep, cost us $209 for the 2 swims and access to xel-ha all day and the transfers. Then to get the pictures it was a further cost, tad expensive but for a once in a lifetime thing we thought why not. Cost us $130 for 10 pictures on a cd. Truly was an amazing day!!

Trainer for the Day-issue with photos. This is our fourth dolphin adventure, 3rd with Delphinus and 2nd at Xcaret. We brought our friends back here after having several of our own great experiences.We loved the dolphins and the trainers. They were excellent.We already knew about the pricey picture and had warned our friends. We choose not to purchase any and we had some from our previous trips.While viewing the pictures my friends were told one price-after viewing and going to checkout they were told a much higher price. Apparently the person who reviewed our photos told us the prices for someone who has done a smaller dolphin swim. The price difference was hundreds of dollars. I can understand a change in price due to the number of photos but upon check out the cashier told our friend there was not a photo package priced for what she was told.While this was not true we say it on there laminated price list, while reviewing the photos. My husband requested to speak with a manager and was initially told there was not anyone to speak with. My husband was very persistent and finally spoke with a manger. They came to a comprise of sorts so our friends were able to get a few of their photos.I hope the photo staff has better training being told one price and then it being changed is very shady appearing even if it was a mistake.

CRAZY price for photos. Such a fantastic experience!! Really a must! I wasn't too keen at first but my other half was, but after swimming with them we both agreed it was the best activity wed done ever in any country!We did the Primax package which meant there was 4 of us in a group - mostly us as a couple and one other, which was really nice.. perfect! The staff are friendly and speak English well. They provide towels and lockers. TIP We booked with 'Excursion' at our hotel just next door- Xcaret Occidental, and they gave us a voucher each for 40 US dollars money back (we paid in peso so they gave us the equivalent in peso back) !! Which made the activity reasonable, giving that no matter where you are in the world swimming with dolphins is expensive.Plenty of time in the water! you did I believe 21 different tricks- all with picture opportunity, including kiss, hug, foot push, sing, dance etc.All dolphins looked happy, healthy and well looked after.The worst thing about the experience is if you want a picture to remember you experience it was about 45 UK Pound equivalent for just 1 photo!! And they took soooo many lovely pictures of you then they tell you the price your mouth just drops! There is also CDs to purchase of the experience of course extort once again. And your own cameras are strictly not allowed, however we saw other people who weren't participating in the activity but friends who came with being let in to take pictures. Its such a shame we don't have pictures to remember the experience :( but it was still worth doing.

Outrageous price for photos with the Dolphins. Our family had a great time at Xcaret, and loved swimming with the Dolphins. As we were not allowed to bring our camera to the activity and realized that we'd have no choice but to purchase the photos taken by the place's photographers.The park is not inexpensive, but nonetheless we were willing to pay for the pictures, to capture this once in a lifetime experience for us and the kids.To our astonishment, we were asked for 200$ (!) for a set of digital pictures and a short video, which we found outrageous. We surrendered and paid, but not without a very bitter taste in our mouth, feeling ripped off and take advantage off.For this reason, we'd encourage people to experience swimming with Dolphins, but not in Xcaret, find a differnt place for it where you'd treated fairly and honestly.

Quality dolphin time. We got the Primax package which meant we were in the water for 60 mins+ and only had one other couple in our group. We spent so much time with the dolphins, it was unbelievable! The dolphins did tricks with us, and were very friendly. The staff were fun too (and spoke multiple languages). Disliked: nothing.

Second best day of life. Omg this was outstanding. ..dolphins were in own environment and very happy and well looked after..the whole experience from start to finish blew my mind!!! Highly recommend it very professional.. it was one of my bucket list xx

Top notch. Great place, go for the upgrade, well worth the $30 each. thsirt isn't but the experience will be. Photos and video are not cheap but worth it if this will be a once in a lifetime experience

Delphinitly fun!. It was my first time ever swimming with dolphins and where better to do so, but in Cancun! The trainers were funny and you get a satisfyingly amount of playing time with the dolphins, but the only disappointment was that my group didn't get to hold on to the dolphins' dorsal fins as the dolphins swam as depicted in the advertisement. One word of advice I have for ladies is to wear swim boardshorts or running shorts over your bikini bottom because when the dolphins launch you into the air, you'll have to hold on to your bikini bottom to make sure the resistance from the water as you surface doesn't pull them down. Also, standing in the middle of the group during the times that the dolphins swim by for you to pet them will get you the most opportunities to pet them because being in the center allows you to pet the dolphins from all sides when they make their way toward the others in your group. Overall, the experience was quite enjoyable, I thought it was cool that Lionel Messi had visited this same attraction!

outstanding but pricey. this place is awesome and the dolphins are amazing they were playing,singing,talking,jumping and jumping over us even if your a wee bit scared they make you feel at ease it was a trip of a life time the only bad thing is the price of the pics and videos i thought it was a bit extreme but im not going to do it again so it was worth it.The highlite for me was the toe push being pushed out of the water by a dolphin is an experience i will never forget.

Dolphin torture at its worst! Sad reality........ Me and the wife got married in Mexico and decided to take a day out to Xcaret...... I must say i was amazed at how badly these animals- Mammals are kept.... Truly shocking. If you truly cared about these creatures you wouldnt go to here. Very Small pens, the manatees we seen were stuck in a pen probably 10ft long and wide the manatee was probably 7ft long along. This is shocking. I will never go back, i care for animals and think this is barbaric. Please try and stay clear.They had sharks in a tank that was overloaded about 8 sharks in a tank worthy of 2 at best...........
Dolphin Swim. One of the greatest experiences in my entire life of 52 years! Highly Recommend! The staff were wonderful and the dolphins were so sweet and gentle. Loved them!
Great time. Really enjoyed our time with the dolphins the photos and dvd was pretty pricey but im glad we paid the price as its nice to keepsake the memory.

WONDERFUL. My only swim with the dolphins experience, but we had only the two of us matched with a nine year old male (and dad to be) dolphin named Box, pronounced Bosh, which means Black. We spent 45 minutes petting Box, playing with him, learning his tricks, getting kisses, dancing, having him jump over us and last but not least - the foot push where two dolphins push you across their pen. VERY COOL because of the one on one interaction. The trainer we had spoke English beautifully and I learned a lot in Q&A. We did pay more for this particiular experience than another dolphin experience in the same park, but we didn't have to compete with other people - it was just us and Box in the water. It was GREAT!!! They took professional photos from the dock, under the water, and video taped our entire experience...though we only purchased a couple of photos because of the cost. Loved this though - would recommend it to everyone and anyone who would like to get up close and personal with a dolphin.

Swim with dolphins. Well what can I say an experience not to be missed worth every peso paid something that you just have to do once in your life at least we did the foot push and the full package well worth it and bought the full package in the photos USB and DVD an experience I will never forget what loving gentle creatures they are
Swimming with dolphins. It was a one in a lifetime experience for me and my family, it was basic but next time I want to do a different dolphin experience.

Great fun and the dolphins are well looked after. Although this was a 'commercial' experience - I felt that the dolphins were in good condition and well looked after.The well being of the dolphins was always the primary consideration. I would have preferred larger pools for the dolphins though (but heard that they have a very successful breeding programme and I guess they would not breed if they were not happy in their environment)

Be careful...... We had been planning a dolphin swim with our daughter for many years and finally got the opportunity while we were on holiday at the Xcaret Grand hotel next door to the park. We chose the Primax 4 package which was very expensive but ensured good time in the water with just 4 people. My daughter and I took part, and to keep the cost down my husband went as a spectator. He had done it years ago in Florida. We knew there was a photograph package....that they would try quite hard to sell it to us....and that it would be expensive - we accepted that was part of the deal and that we would, in fact, buy the photos because they would be good quality close ups and my husband, who was carrying a camera around his neck, would not be able to take good shots from where he was.What actually happened once we were herded off to our pool was someone asked my husband which party he was with and directed him to an area as far away as it was possible to be - he could not watch our swim with the dolphins - he was at least a hundred yards away behind a barrier that blocked good viewing. There were other spectators much closer to us with good views of the fun we were having.He asked to be moved to the area that was closer and was told it was too difficult. He asked again and was given directions that took him out of the park altogether! He asked a third time and finally was directed to the right viewing area just in time for us to finish.He was very, very upset. It was a big deal for us to finally take her to swim with the dolphins - we actually chose a Mexico holiday because of this fact, otherwise we would have gone to Greece! He is convinced that he was kept away from us because he had a DSLR around his neck and therefore we may not have purchased their photos. Other spectators were taking photos but had perhaps been wiser in keeping their cameras in their bags - we obviously didn't know to be wary.From our angle as participants - we were led up from the pools after our swim and ushered into a very slick area with lots of sales people ready for us with our photos on screen. This area was air conditioned to the point of freezing and this was before we were given a towel - COLD and WET. The towels were actually in there. I presume to draw you in. I refused as it was just too cold and said I would come back when dry. I was happy too. We'd always intended to buy.The price was phenomenol....we'd excpected expensive...they outdid Disney!! I wish I could tell you the exact price, but I can't remember. But it was something like $240-260 for the DVD and a CD of 44 photos. We asked if there was a cheaper package and ended up buying just the photos for around $170 - absolutely mad!!When we got out and were talking to the other poor punters who had been equally shocked at the price we found we could have bought individual pics at $20 each - still a sting. In conclusion...the dolphin swim was lovely - we paid what we expected to pay - didn't feel ripped off in any way 10/10.But beware if you choose to use this facility - HIDE YOUR CAMERA!!!I appologise to Xcaret if I have quoted your prices incorrectly - they are ball park guesses - but very close.

Thoroughly enjoyed.... We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Delphinus. Neither of us had swum with dolphins before and we loved the experience. Our guide was extremely friendly and informative (I forget his name otherwise I would recommend him).We did the 'primax 4' package which means that there are only 4 of you in the pool as opposed to the usual 12-13, but as we booked the first slot at 8 / 8.30am, we had the dolphins to ourselves which was a huge bonus. The photos are an absolute rip-off - $45 for one photo, $180 for the cd of photos and a dvd (12mins) of your time with the dolphins (although we managed to barter down to $160) etc etc. HOWEVER, both the photos and the dvd are amazing and we don't regret spending the $160 whatsoever. There were a couple of activities we didn't get to do which we were a bit disappointed with, but we did get to do the foot push which is pretty much what everyone goes to do as well as the kiss, the dancing and having them jump over our heads.We had a fantastic experience, but maybe shop around a bit before you choose Delphinus (although if you do end up here you won't be disappointed).

Excellent Time and Swim with the Dolphins. There are many many Dolphin parks in Playa del Carmen area, and we were advised to go to this by our tour rep over the much nearer Dolphin Discovery Centre (DDC) in Peuto Adventuras. The reason for this being the group size is restricted to four and you get a full hour with the Dolphin. Other parks have groups of ten and 30 to 45 minutes for the same money. We were picked up from our hotel by the Delphinus bus and driven the 15 minutes to the park. We were given complementary tee shirts and furnished with floatation vest, had a safety talk and we were taken straight to the Dolphin pool. TBH it's wasn't the largest I'd seen, but it was right beside the sea, protected only by a stone breakwater so the water was freshly changed . I thought this was important because the DDC is set at the end of a large and complex marina were the tide and sea water changes must be much less. I'd also heard of other parks which are out in the sea on pontoons and is at the mercy of the sea conditions sea which can get quite choppy in the afternoon and the last thing you want is to be fighting the sea when you are in the pool.We had a great time with the Dolphin with constant interaction, topped off by the "two foot push" were you float on your front on the water with your legs straight behind you and your arms out to the sides. Two Dolphins then swim up behind you and put their snouts on the soles of your feet, they then push you forward and up out of the water until you bend your knees when they stop - great fun especially as I'm topping 280lbs.As with all this type of attraction they want to make more money from you on the photos and videos, as obviously you can't take your own and they keep any non swimming members of your party who may want to take pictures a long way away. The packages have varyingly prices and as this was on my "bucket list" we got the lot at a negotiated cost of about £100, yes they will haggle on the price. My only complaint is the video quality which a SD and a not very good quality, they should be shooting full HD.All in all an expensive but an excellent "once in a lifetime" experience.

Dreams do come true!. We booked the package for 4 and we swam with 2 dolphins, which was a great experience and lots of time with those great mammals. It was very expensive, as almost $450 for a family of 3, but we decided to do it, even if for the first and last time in our lives. My son of 4 was with us and he loved the experience. Our trainer was so good, that since my son was too young to do the foot push he let him hold the dolphin’s fin and be pulled along. We did buy the photos afterwards, but ouch! that was painful, although we did manage to negotiate the price down by about a third. They wouldn’t budge at first, but we negotiated hard and the lady selling us those pictures, took a piece of paper from her drawer and checked (I presume) how much she can offer us and for what (we didn’t take the video) and agreed on a certain price.

Swim with dolfins. We booked the trainer for à day programme. We spent 5 hours in the water with the dolfins. The park provides all necessary equipment and your guide spends the day with you. Our guide was very friendly. His name is Agustin. Food was very good at mexican main restaurant.

Great experience slightly marred by money grabbing techniques... This is a great thing to do and we really enjoyed it. The worst part was afterwards when we were given the price for the photos and videos that the staff took. For the complete package we were asked for initially for US$350!! it dropped to US$250 after some negotiation by still a ludicrous amount. In the end we were offered the videos clips and one photo for $110 US dollars. Given that it cost US$100 plus each to get in then the photo charge was almost criminal. Lots of people just walked away when they saw the price
Once in a lifetime. Had an amazing time with the dolphins. Got a good hour with them. Photos are very expensive haggle and they may put the price down a touch.

Swim with dolphins. Trainers were excellent. Make sure you push for a discount with whomever sets up the package. We got a promo for $40 back each. WATCH OUT for the photo scam at the end! They of course do NOT let you take your own camera in and take all the photos and video of your time. Then try to get you to spend $240 USD for the biggest package. Of course the video doesn't have the photos and the photo CD doesn't have the video. Total scam! Interesting thing happened though because I told the sales guy that I only had $80 USD with me and the video alone suddenly went on sale for $79 so don't be timid about bargaining with them. Be prepared to have only your memories unless you want to get ripped off with the photo deal!

Swimming with the Dolphins. Great time was had by the family. It is a very nice facility. The dolphins are well trained and seem to be taken care of very well. Sticker shock when you go for the photo's. 1 photo is $29 USD.

Loved it. As someone who has never really seen the attraction of swimming with dolphins, I loved it. My husband and I did the Silver package which meant we were in the water for about an hour with the dolphins. We were paired up with another couple and one instructor/trainer. We got the safety briefing then it was straight in the water. One of our group was a non-swimmer but this didn't affect him as we all had nice tight life jackets on. Our trainer was very experienced and knowledgeable and we got to tickle and stroke the dolphin. The foot push was brilliant although one shot was not enough! Dolphins are truly amazing and the hour long experience was perfect.However, to purchase any of the photos it was a bit expensive to say the least. One photo was $29! There were deals to buy all the photos they had taken, buy the DVD with all the photos and the video but at near enough $300, the memories had to be enough for us. We did however get a free t-shirt.I would recommend the half day experience, definitely.

Foot push. We had a brilliant morning swimming with dolphins and the foot push was excellent too. It is in small groups and the dolphins are so friendly. Would have loved it to have been longer, but will book for a day next time. yes will do it again so worth it.

Lifetime Experience. Delpinus was a great experience. They picked us up & dropped us off right from our resort. Did the 3 for 1 experience good deal, better than the states! Foot push, belly ride and snorkeling. They divide you up in groups which was fine. Loved the Foot push the best! Belly ride 2nd and snorkeling wasnt really snorkeling you put a mask on and the dolphin swims by and you pet it. I really wished we could of really snorkeled with them. Had breaks in between activities which was perfect. Big disappointment was buying the pictures, rip off $390 for 6 pictures that is crazy!! Cant even buy 1 picture. They would make more money if they sold them for less. Otherwise, overall experience was worth going!!

Came away feeling conned. I booked for my husband and daughter to do the Primax dolphin swim , It was marketed as being very personal as only 6 people in the group. There were 8 people in their group and what was not mentioned anywhere was the fact there could be 2 groups in the pool sharing the dolphins at the same time. This meant the time they spent with the dolphins was drastically cut. I did the swim at Xcaret 12 years ago and it was lovely, now it is just a commercial opportunity to make money. I would advise anyone to do lots of homework before you go, there were various places to swim with dolphins that would have been better than here. Xcaret eco park is a fantastic day out, book with mastercard and get 2nd day free,

Amazing!!!. This was an amazing experience!! We went in with 2 dolphins, unfortunately one of our dolphins was unwell, they think this was due to someone wearing suncream in the lagoon, this is toxic to them and they thought the dolphin had breathed it in. This however really showed how great the staff were, they gave him medication while we were there and told us they were coming in through the night every 2 hours to make sure he was ok. You could really see how much they truly cared for these animals. The experience was amazing, from the kiss to the hug and the footpush was amazing even with just one dolphin, truly a once in a life time experience!! enjoy!!! xx
magical, for adults and children alike. Up close and personal with these majestic beasts, staff treat these animals like their own children,
Absolutely Amazing. It was absolutely amazing. I am a non-swimmer and I had a fantastic time. The staff are great and it's well worth the money.

Fantastic Experience !!!. This was something I wanted to do all my life so my parter took me to the dolphins on my birthday. This was certainly a really nice birthday gift. I was scared at first because the dolphins are very big, but then i felt confortable because they started to swim around me slow and calm like saying i won't harm you. The dolphins are very smart they do a lot of tricks like clapping,singing and dancing. unfortunately everything only last one hour , when you are there the time passes really fast. I also noticed that the dolphins look welled fed and treated very nice and they are in natural water not in pool water that has lot of chemicals which is good. I defenetly would recomend this place although its a little expensive. The most expensive is the dvd and the pictures its just a ridiculous price . I purchased the usb i thought it was better and the pictures are good quality.

Foot Push. My husband and I both swam with the dolphins while on our trip to Mexico and had a blast while doing it! We paid a little more money to have fewer people with us and more activities. We found it was well worth the dollars. We spent our entire time in the water with the dolphins and enjoyed the experience we will not often be given. The foot push is by far the most fun and being kissed was a treat! I like that they have a videographer and photographer taking all the best shots. The only downside is the price for all the pictures, but as I say you never come home wishing for the money back only that you had purchased the overly priced pictures when you had the chance ;)

Dolphin treat. Something we've always wanted to do, so we did on our 30th wedding anniversary. An absolute brilliant treat which lasted about an hour. The instructor was very good (John) and had the dolphin and us doing tricks together finishing with the foot push which we all managed to do successfully, recommended.

Moneymaking throwing shade on an otherwise good experience. The swim with the dolphins was good, the trainer was so-and-so, but the girls filming and photographing us seemed like someone was torturing them.The bad surprise came afterwards, when we were asked to buy a cd with couple of pictures for $150!!! It is a shame to try and sell the memories from that place for that price, especially when the price of the admission is not low at all.And in the end, you end up going home feeling like someone just wanted to make money off of you and in the very aggressive way - it's shameful that it is the last impression... Thumbs down for politics of that place...

beautiful animals, wonderful trip. of all the excursions we did whilst in mexico this is the one that stands out for me. it was everything we wanted and so much more. we were first asked to watch a short 15min video about the dolphins and what they do and dont like. we then got to spend a mezmerising 75minutes in the water with them. i was worried as im not a good swimmer but it really didnt matter as everyone had life jackets on which were comfortable and secure. we were only in groups of 4 so we really got alot of time with the dolphins and got to do so much! singing, dancing, free interactive time, bar jump, whirlpool and the famous foot push which was just unbelievable! i loved this excursion and would urge anyone who gets the chance to go. the trainers are fantastic and all the staff and friendly and easy to talk to. the photos are expensive but so worth it. an absolutely perfect day out.
Wonderful time. Everyone should experience swimming with the dolphins, it was fun.You really get what you pay for, we swam four different activites and were there for over 4 hours.
Swimming with the dolphins. This was a 30 minute drive and a great experience. Choose the 1 hour option as opposed to the 30 minute swim.

Amazing experience!. When we came to check different places to swim with dolphins in Mexico,We looked for a place that is human toward those amazing animals, and we found this place - Delphinus - which let you swim in a very intimate and fun way - only 4 people in a group with 2 dolphins! (In many places they let a group of 10-14 people swim with 2 dolphins, which seems very crowdy and tiring experience to the dolphins...)The staff was very friendly and professional and we had a great time!!The only matter that causes us to rate it 4 stars and not 5 - Is the high prices. Each one of us had to pay 160 US $ for this experience, as well as 30$ per picture (we could buy the whole pictures on CD for 140$...)It's important to mention that those are generally the prices of the swimming with the doplhins in all the other nearby places, but it's not an exuse....

Swimming with dolphins. Swimming with dolphins is a very special experience. However, it is costly for a short time dolphins. Different formula's are possible. Pictures are not allowed, but are being taken so you can buy them afterwards. Some of the interactions are also being filmed and available on DVD. The DVD + a USB dtick with &# pictures cost us 180 USD.
WOW!!. Must see place for anybody with children. Its a once in a lifetime opportunity!! Expensive but worth every penny!!

Great experience. Really good experience. Quite expensive but you need to account for the facilities and also the fact that admission helps pay for disabled children and adults to swim with the dolphins for free. Very expensive to buy photos afterwards ($40 a photo!) so would recommend taking along someone who isn't bothered about doing the activity so that they can take photos for you!

Most memorable time!!!. Amazing experience worth the cost! Booked our dolphin activity directly through Xcaret's website and received a 10 % discount for bundling park entrance and activities. Payed 98 each for dolphin experience.Swimming with Dolphins was in my wife's bucket list so I surprised her with this great activity when we arrived to the park. It is a magical experience, totally recommend doing it. Trainers were very accommodating to all guests and gave all group the opportunity to spend good time with the dolphins.One thing we did not like was the cost of the pictures and video they sell after the experience. They really charge you for them. 139 for all pictures and a cd with the video or if you want to buy single they are 29 dlls each.

Wonderful attraction, watch out for booking agent. My wife and I spent 75 minutes swimming with the dolphins in a great facility with a wonderful instructor. We got to do the "push-push" twice whereby 2 dolphins push you one at each foot at high speed across the pen. Fabulous. There was lots of petting and dancing with these creatures who seemed very well loved and cared for. We stayed at Secrets Capris Riviera booked through Apple vacation and the on site Apple rep booked the outing and sold us on doing the rest of the park with the enticement of getting $80 dollars off of the dolphins if we brought back coupons from the attraction, which we did. They had charged our Mastercard account but instead of crediting the account they gave us a MC receipt which is useless. We booked through AAA and they helped us make a claim to Apple Travel, to no avail. Essentially, Apple ripped us off for $80 after we had spent $4000 for the trip. Now we will never use them again. And I am writing this review. Penny wise and pound foolish.

Amazing experience - worth the cost. we did this with our 5 year old daughter, we did the interax programme. I was quite worried as I don't swim and have a fear of water but I didn't want to miss out on this experience. For any non swimmers - yes its deep but the life jackets hold you up, my only problem was my fear of water so I couldn't relax so the instructor told me stay on the platform with another lady who didn't swim, the instructor was lovely and said it was more important to enjoy the experience than to actually swim with them. been on the platform I didn't miss out on anything really that the others did, i got to stroke, kiss, high five, get a kiss on the cheek from our dolphin and we all stood on the platform to instruct her to do tricks. My daughter who can't really swim clung to her dad and was out in the water doing her kiss etc and she loved it, she was amazed by the dolphins. The time went so quickly. afterwards we could go and look at the photos or video to purchase if we wanted, many people had reviewed saying how expensive they are - yes they are but worth it, we got a good deal - we took quite a bit of time after the swim drying off and talking to another family so we were one of the last in there to get the photos, we were just going to buy 3 which worked out about $90 but then the guys there were talking to each other and then we thought we'd get a 4th which would have been about $120 odd as we were about to ask for a fourth they said we can offer you all 54 photos on a disc for $123! so we went for that, don't know if it was because we were the last there or what but what a deal! we went back to pay for the disc after 15 mins (developing time) and they put it in their computer and show you to check its all gone on the disc ok. disc worked fine on home laptop. overall an unforgettable experience.only negative was we think the dolphin area should have its own locker area, we put our stuff in a locker very close to the dolphin area but then we had to leave our shoes and xcaret towels (which if lost was charged) on a step in there, you need towels to dry off after especially with a child who was cold, so maybe lockers would be a good idea but certainly didn't affect our experience.

Dolphins AMAZING.. direction not so much!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and swimming with the dolphins was something I always wanted to do so we decided to book it through our hotel. It was 159.00 pp for a 60 minute dolphin adventure including transportation from Playa Del Carmen and a group of 4 people MAX. Our shuttle was on time and the shuttle driver funny and spoke good English... when we got there it was slow to check in taking about 10 minutes per person and only 2 people checking in. We got into our suits and then got sat in a room to watch a movie about dolphins for about 25 minutes. When they came to split us into groups it was confusing and not well organized... basically giving every group a number between 1-9 and you had to remember your number as that is where you are to go but they would forgot which group had which number so it took a lot longer then it had to and I think this could have been organized way better. We got to our group and got in the water with our dolphin and it was great! Dolphins are well behaved and very well treated and trained. We got to touch her, got kiss, danced, she jumped over us with another dolphin, we got to do the foot push, splashed, she sang songs... it was AMAZING to spend time with such an amazing mammal. However the directions from the trainers was less then ideal.... there was one big area that was split into 6 sections and you are constantly having to move from one plat form to another. During the foot push you are working with 2 trainers on either side of you on the dock and 2 dolphins and one trainer is telling you one thing and another trainer telling you different and its hard to hear because of this I almost didn't get to do the dolphin push-- it's very confusing. All in all the dolphins were a 5 star and the staff about a 2.5-3 star. Oh and the photo's were so over priced.1 8x10 photo which is the smallest you can get is 30.00 or all photos on disk for 130.00!!!!
Great trainers great interactions. Says it all in the title, felt that this was better than dolphinaris you get to spend the whole time with the dolphins and the groups were smaller which was a plus.

A great day out and the magic of the dolphins. Xcaret is a must-visit place generally but specifically for the wonderful experience of swimming with the dolphins. We were in a group that was exclusively our family of four and were fortunate enough to be with Jon and two of his personally trained dolphins. The rapport that Jon has with his dolphins and that he created with us made it very special and a highlight of our time in Mexico. It is good to know that the money that we spent is being used to allow Jon and his colleagues to continue their wonderful work with these amazing and beautiful creatures. When you are ready to take lunch, my recommendation would be the seafood restaurant. It is a very good buffet and the staff are excellent.

not worth the money. We swam with the dolphins and the experience was good, but it felt like we were just posing for pictures. Our trainer was talking to so many other people that it was hard to figure out what we were supposed to do. I'm glad we experienced it, however it was a lot of money ($160per person). We could not bring our cameras and that was also disappointing.
So Worth IT!!!. Buffets sucked. But everything else was amazing!! Definitely swim with the dolphins and try the underground river

Magical - a dream fulfulled. For a very, very long time, I have wanted to swim with Dolphins and my dream came true last week.Along with my husband, we booked the 'Trainer for the Day' package which cost (with discount) about £300. The agent (through British Airways) did a good marketing job. What I would say is that, although 'meals and drinks' are included in the price, you actually receive throughout the day 3 carbonated cans of drink (or water) and a hamburger or steak/chicken/ham baguette with some salad.There will be periods of time where you are waiting around for the next session to start which ranged from 25 minutes to 55 minutes!You are not supposed to wear sun screen lotion so be careful out in the sun. If possible, where a long sleeved T-shirt under your flotation vest.Although I just couldn't do the foot push :( I did get the opportunity to grab onto two dolphins dorsal fins and they pulled me through the water.I chose Delphinus as it was 'next door' to the Occidental Xcaret where we were staying for the week. I also did my homework beforehand - using Tripadvisor - and was very impressed by the reviews and realised that they really care about the welfare of the dolphins.If you have ever wanted to swim with dolphins - DO IT....... they have packages for all pockets but if you really want to fulfil your dream then go for broke and buy one of the more expensive packages!! You know it's worth it!!

swimming with the dolphins. The experience was fantastic and I was really nervous. It was great and totally worth it. The only bad thing was at the end, we picked a picture each, but the system to pay and pick up photos was so flawed that we never got the pics. We waited about 30 mins, but we were afraid we'd miss our ride. We realized that don't think we would've, but we didn't know, so we just left without them.

Best one ever!. Much better than the one we did in the Domincan. You get 4 people per dolphin and we had two for large parts of it.you get to do the footpush which is cool and spend an hour with them in the water doing all sorts of stuff amazing fun great experience!only downside is they take all the photo's and video's because you are in the water and then it's $30USD for one printed photo or £120 for the basic all photo's and video package with 4 prints so yes when booking make sure you add that cost as you'll want memories. There is a viewing gallery it won't cover all areas of the pools and is quite far awayOther than that super day out!

Great experience!. I got to swim with a dolphin. I wasn't really interested in the tricks that they had the dolphin perform with us. I was more than happy to just be in the water and touch the dolphin.

Dream of a lifetime!. Booked to swim with the dolphins through our Thomsons rep at the Ocean Maya. Cost was approx £100 per person and this was for the silver package. We were picked up on the morning by a representative from Delphinus. Quick journey took us to the park where we were taken to the dolphins. You hand over your ticket and in return you get a locker key, ticket and our package meant we got a free t-shirt. Off to the changing rooms next where you put all your stuff in a locker and go to a briefing where you are put in groups depending on your ticket. You get a quick briefing about the dolphins and where you can touch them and then you are taking by your trainer to the part of the pool your dolphin is in. Our dolphin was called Kak and we were with one other couple. Experience was intimate with only 4 people and we got to do loads of things. This included a foot push (totally amazing), a kiss, stroking the dolphin and lots more. Totally recommend this and great value for money. Total time in the pool was an hour. Be aware.....at the pool side they have a rep taking a video and pictures of your experience. Once they take you to see them it is hard to resist. A single picture is $28 US dollars and to buy all your pictures on a disk $128 US dollars. They have packages which we purchased and for $173 US dollars you get all your pictures, CD if your experience and 4 printed pictures. A bit pricey but good quality. Just take plenty of cash!!!

Wonderful experience. Had the most wonderful birthday ever swimming with the dolphins. We upgraded our package and had lots of interaction my brother & his wife were brave enough to do the dolphin push I wasn't,My husband can't swim and they were very patient and helpful so he enjoyed it as much as we did.Would recommend this to anyone fantastic time.Something I've always hoped I would do.
Swam with Dolphins. Did the foot push excursion options where two dolphins push your feet out of the water and you are skimming along the top of the water. Totally awesome!!!

Best day ever!. Came here with my husband, 2 children age 12 and 14 and my uncle (aunty watched) my husband and i swam with dolphins with another company in Mexico 3 years before but this company was so much better! Cheaper, better service, longer time with the dolphins and not so much waiting around! I would definately recommend this company, you won't be dissapointed!!

Magical - a Dream Fulfilled. For a very, very long time, I have wanted to swim with Dolphins and my dream came true last week. Along with my husband, we booked the 'Trainer for the Day' package which cost (with discount) about £300. The agent (through British Airways) did a good marketing job. What I would say is that, although 'meals and drinks' are included in the price, you actually receive throughout the day 3 carbonated cans of drink (or water) and a hamburger or steak/chicken/ham baguette with some salad. There will be periods of time where you are waiting around for the next session to start which ranged from 25 minutes to 55 minutes!You are not supposed to wear sun screen lotion so be careful out in the sun. If possible, where a long sleeved T-shirt under your flotation vest.Although I just couldn't do the foot push :( I did get the opportunity to grab onto two dolphins dorsal fins and they pulled me through the water.I chose Delphinus as it was 'next door' to the Occidental Xcaret where we were staying for the week. I also did my homework beforehand - using Tripadvisor - and was very impressed by the reviews and realised that they really care about the welfare of the dolphins.If you have ever wanted to swim with dolphins - DO IT....... they have packages for all pockets but if you really want to fulfil your dream then go for broke and buy one of the more expensive packages!! You know it's worth it!!

Awesome experience. My second swim with dolphins. We spent more time with the dolphins at Delphinus and were in a smaller group. So pretty worthwhile to do. My only concern is that with activities like this, that we are not exploiting the animals or causing any harm to them inadvertently. That they seek out human interaction in the wild seems to speak to hopefully the fact that they enjoy the people encounters as much as we enjoy ours with them.

Bring your wallet. The swimming with the Dolphins was great and my kids loved it, but it was VERY pricey! It cost over $600 USD to go to for a 1 hour swim and you are not allowed to bring in your own camera as they take pictures and video of your entire experience and then sell you all of it back! An individual picture was $29 USD each. If you wanted just the CD of your medium resolution pictures it was $163.00 USD. And if you wanted video and CD then it was almost $300 USD. We thought we'd use the Gopro camera so we didn't bring any extra money and found out that we didn't have enough money to get much. They will bring the video/CD to your hotel afterwards, but there is a charge and then it is cash only (no credit card) so we were out of luck as we didn't bring much cash to Mexico with us. We managed to purchase 2 pictures (1 of each of our kids) and that was it. Plus they didn't take any "group" family shots just individual. So it's not like you could have 1 picture to remember the day. So be prepared to drop $1000 on this excursion and take your wallet with you.

Exceptional experience. Hard to explain, but for those in the water with the dolphins, their only presence close by is enough to fill you with a great energy and feel instantly happy. Being able to touch these wonderful creatures is priceless. For those accompanying, bring a real camera with at least a 300 zoom with fast auto focus with a bucket load of patience, Xcaret crew are taking pictures and videos to sell after so they will get in your way for all the good shots while you stand in the back. Its understandable and fair business, but still frustrating. But don't let thins last comment cloud your judgement, the only thing tat matters is what is happening in the water and the crew is very good with the dolphins and the participants.

worth a visit. we spent the day as a trainer for the day and it was a long day if not too long the animals seem happy and cared for which was great we did enjoy the day but there was too much waiting around ! pictures where way too expensive 150 for the full package !

Wonderful experience!. We did the one hour "primax" swim in the Delphinus just outside of the Xcaret park (it's a bit confusing - I beleive there's one inside the part as well...). We booked online and there were no issues. The facilities were great - very natural. The hour we had with the dolphins was incredible - the trainers are extremely professional and you can tell they really love their job. Overall there was a lot of respect for the dolphins, it had an educational focus, the facility was very proud of its research and also its work with local charities, which was nice. You can choose to buy photos and video after the fact - pricey, but well done. It was a once in a lifetime experience for us (family with one 8 year old) it was the highlight of our trip to the Mayan Riviera.
Good Experience. Very Good service the Photos have more cost than the ticket, I recommend this beautiful experience.The time is ok the attention good but only the lockers are not informed good

Amazing Experience. 10 January 2013I was very impressed with this experience. Before we entered the water we were briefed on a few safety issues and watched a short video filmed at Delphinus of a Dolphin being born, an amazing thing to see.We were in the water for 1 hour which was much longer than expected and the whole thing was breathtaking, being so close to such beautiful creatures. The trainers appeared to have a wonderful relationship with the dolphins. I loved every minute of it and would not hesitate to recommend.

Awesome experience!. My husband and I did the 1 hour couple's package. We were matched with 2 dolphins. Our trainer, Fernando, was patient, funny and very informative. The park is clean, the staff is very attentive and nice. We had a blast! The actual time spent with the dolphins was magical. Petting them was the best! I would highly recommend this attraction.
Xcaret delphinus. We had a blast swimming with ICK dolphin , great trainer ....loved every minute , amust do attraction and worth every dime

Trainer for the day, swimming with dolphins. Wow. What a great day. Just got back to the hotel from Delphinus having been a "trainer for the day" the strange thing is this doesn't get promoted much as an option. We only knew about it from the reviews on trip advisor. You do pay a bit more ($199.00) but you have 5 sessions and spend close to 3 hours with the dolphins. You do all of the main activities and a whole lot more. The foot push, fin pull, kiss and dance etc. You also learn a whole lot about the facility and the research they do. There was a small group of us, only 4 so we had loads of time with each activity. This is a long day that starts at 7.00am with the pickup from the hotel and you get picked up from the centre to go back at 5.00pm but it flies by. We did a few extras too. A push with a boogie board and the foot push twice. It was better the second time. You will see from the reviews that the photo's are expensive but if you go it won't come as a surprise. We bought the photo package for $123.00 but we got 110 photos on a cd for that rather than $29.00 each. I would do this again in a heartbeat. The staff are all brilliant and really love the dolphins and they are looked after really well. Jon was excellent and funny too. A day to remember.

Best thing we did on our trip. Most interactive dolphin experience ever. Close to our hotel. Was pricey but worth it. Our Lomas rep(funjet vacation) tried to talk us out of this one and wanted us to go to one farther away. So glad we didnt listen on this one. The one excursion he did we were very unhappy.

Extremely well looked after dolphins. We both had a fantstic time with the dolphins. My wife was extremely nervous, but within ten minutes of being in the pool was chilled and happy! Ther were four in our group; three adults and one child and we had loads of time. The 'toe push' was out of this world!

Excellent overall experience, not cheap and hated being charged for pictures and videos. Very good overall experience (would be excellent if the photos and videos thing didn't happen).Hated being charged for pictures and videos at the end, and still wet after the swim, being thrown inside a room with A/C below 20º to review pictures/videos and buy them eventually (be aware you cannot take pictures nor videos inside,during the visit)!Beside this, everything was really excellent and a lifetime experience.We spent over 700 USD at Xcaret during one day (two persons) and spent a full day there.The dolphins itself i think it's about 30minutes.Be aware, this place (xcaret) is one of the most touristic places in the area, so it can be crowded. Although, the area is big enough. I think we did everything we could in here.The cenotes, the snorkeling along the coast, the dolphins experience, the night show with dinner, and much more.Worth for the experience and would not regret any of the options we took.Being said that, the pictures and videos should be a gift/offer to their visitors, and not charge a large amount of dolars for having it it (i don't remember exactly for for sure more than $70 usd for a CD with everything). After paying $175 each person for swimming with dolphins, i don't think it's acceptable doing this.

Go for trainer for a day. I did not know it was so much fun, its a cliche, but the dolphins instantly make you smile! You get soo much out of the day, instead of 1 hr. book online, much cheaper! The facilities are really well maintained as compared to other dolphin resorts i have seen.

swim with dolphins. Looked the experience however disappointed with the cost to purchase the photos or dvd. They provided everything needed and had us watch a videotape before proceeding with the activities. Everything was explained thoroughly in English so I felt very safe and confident with the trainer. The experience was well worth the money spent for the program we purchased. We completed every activity indicated and when we were done they took into the giftshop to view our Dvd and then the photos. At the cost of the photos it was more cost effective to purchase the Cd with our 43 photos however the Dvd cort of $169 I thought was way to pricey after agreeing to pay $123 for the Cd of photos not to mention I was not prepared to spend that kind of money since I did not have my credit card with me and did not feel safe carrying too much cash in a foreign country.
swimming with dolphins. This was a real treat for our grandchildren. They especially enjoyed touching the teeth of the dolphin, and being pushed to a standing position in the water by two dolphins.

Wow. What a great experience! Small groups and plenty of time in the water with the dolphins...the only bad was how expensive the photos and videos are after (and the won't let you bring your own camera in).
Wow. I swam with dolphins (best experience ever!!)I watched turtles hatching out of their shells.I swam down the underground riverI watched a fantastic show

Loved it. I have always wanted to swim with dolphins, This place was perfect. We looked at various other dolphin parks locally and the facilities here were second to none for the dolphins and for us! Highly recommended.

Xcaret Park "Xplor" Adventure. Our family which included 11 people total just visited XPLOR as part of our Cancun Mexico trip in October during the Dia De los Muerte celebration. We had a great time and I have to say this was the highlight of my entire week in Mexico!We didn't have to wait too long in the lines for any of the circuits, including ziplines, atv drive, cave river swim or cave rafting. It was nice because everything you could do the Half version or the longer version...I personally was done with the ziplines after the first 7, but thats just because i was hungry and stairclimbing on an empty stomach was rough! You could fit the longer version of each little adventure in and still be able to do them all AND eat lunch and have some down time. There wasn't any set schedule either, so you could do what you wanted when you wanted.I enjoyed the fact that the food was buffet style and you could eat all day at your leisure. It was also very nice to have little beverage cafes spread out between the activities to rehydrate with tropical shakes, juices and cookies and coffee. Some things I would be sure to bring that are absolute musts...Sunscreen, water bottle, watersocks, dry clothes, cell phone (just in case....transportation was iffy) Sunglasses are a hassle and can get lost everywhere, you are in caves half the time anyway and wont need them... same with a hat.As for the transportation provided by xcaret, the bus driver was very friendly....however make sure that you are 100% clear on what time to be back to the bus before they leave the park. They said this information in Spanish and forgot to mention in english so some of our family almost missed the bus and were a little hesitant to wait for them. Im glad we did wait an extra 15 minutes because sure enought they were still in the park and did not catch a different bus like the xcaret workers suggested. This was a day i wish I knew spanish. Besides this, most of the workers within the park knew enough english to make sure you knew where to go and felt safe on the activities. This was a pricey day but well worth the money we spent! We didn't come to mexico to cheap out....and the experiences in the caves were AMAZING and you get so much freedom down there to play...I will NEVER forget the cave swim...the one romantic moment my husband and i got away from our huge family! I absolutely would come back here and enjoy another day like this next time we come back!p.s. bring a cheapy waterproof disposable camera! You'll be glad you did because the pics the park take are cool, but too overpriced for me!

Experience of a lifetime. We decided to do this and spent the extra money to do the couples swim. We figured it was a once in a lifetime opportunity and it was worth the extra money. We got to interact directly with the dolphin without other people being in our group. We were also in the water with the dolphins longer and got to do more things then other groups did.You can't take pictures of your own and they charge a lot for them but it was still worth it to get two pictures. Only a few of them out of the 50+ pictures were actually goodOur favorite parts were the dolphin push where two dolphins push you through the water using your feet and the dorsel fin pull (whatever it's called) where you hold on to the dorsel fin of a dolphin and they pull you through the water

Amazing experience with the dolphins. We upgraded to the couple swim the two dolphins instead of the group swim with one Delphinus and I am so glad we did that because the upgrade really made our experience special and truly memorable.the Delphinus were amazing and we gotta to do all the tricks and activities with them overall we spent about 50-60 mins with them... which was very enjoyable. My only disappointment was the staff our photographer took rubbish pictures like an armature my sister would have taken better pictures and the lady who was telling us what to do was from Italy therefore she hardly understood what we were saying and nor could we understand her.
Loved it. Experience of a lifetime. Be warned, no photos allowed and u have to pay quite a bit for the ones the staff take of you. But so worth it!

Great swim with the dolphins. This was my first ever experience with Dolphins and my partner's second. We were pleased that we got some one on one time with not one but two dolphins who were very friendly and enjoyed the attention. We went for the silver package which was an hour in with the Dolphins and the "FOOT PUSH". If nothing else the foot push was an amazing experience and had us both smiling from ear to ear. We were filmed and photographed throughout and at the end were shown the results. We were both disappointed with the quality of the 52 pictures taken of us - most of which showed no dolphins at all. The film of us was also lacklustre and not professional. To buy a CD of the pictures and film was priced at $130 so around £100 - way out of our budget and that of the others who were around us. In the end we brought two photos that worked out at £30 for the 2. The trainer we had hardly spoke english which made understanding his instructions tricky although he had devised suitable sign language. Compared to a female instructor who spoke fluent english our instructor did not give any information besides the name and age of the doplhins whereas her group were fully informed - this was no doubt due to the language barrier.This was an amazing experience but be prepared to bring a lot of money if you want to evidence your swim.

Amazing Experience. Our first time swimming with the dolphins. I will definitely be back! It was incredible! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They took great pictures...we bought them to remember our great experience - although they were a little on the pricey side.
amazing. it was amazing. dolphines where unbelievably soft and so very smart. i didnt want to leave because we had a fantastic day

Swimming with dolphins. what an experience to swim with dolphins id booked to do this in Egypt but backed out at last minute but this was amazing we went with friends and there was only us 4 in with them when they lift you up by your feet you feel like superman

SO cute. what an experience. Really loved it. only negative thing is, where we were located on the grounds, viewers were not allowed to sit to watch. They had to stay standing in a restrained place in direct sun.

Great experience, but expensive. Upon arriving to xcaret our tour guide offered the tickets to swim with dolphinsat $100 per person. Once we got to Delphinus, we were greeted, registered and went to prepare. They have lockers with showers. Then we went to a meeting room were they have us instructions and assigned us according to the package that you buy. We got to the pier and in the water. Our guide, Fernanfo was very knowledgeable and was able to answer many questions an made it very entertaining. We first did some simple tricks with dolphin Maya and then the most advanced. There was a 3 year old girl in our group which he accommodated and she truly was having a great time.Once you finish you go upstairs to see te pictures. They show you them and the video. $29 per photo and $59 per video is outrageous!!!! They offered an 8x10. It would be nice if they could offer a smaller size at less pice so that you would not miss the opportunity to bring something home to remember.

Dolphin Trainer for the Day. WOW is all i can say one of the best days of my life, worth the $200 for the day. You really do get to spend a lot of time in the water with them and its was soo much fun. Be warmed some of the staff are really not fun. They have a look of why am i here and everything is about selling very expensive photo's if you are doing trainer for the day you can bring a camera -DO NOT LET THEM TELL YOU CAN NOT - this is crap,

Foot pushed around. What a good time. After a 10 minute briefing you get to jump in with the dolphins. it was very educational and hands on. Being pushed by the dolphins and almost feeling as you're walking on water. It was something I'll never forget. The photo package they will try to sell you is very expensive. Other than that,it was great.
Awesome!!. swam with a dolphin named Marisa,,,,the manitees, underground caves and aquarium, everything,,,,,food was great too!! we would go back

Swim with dolphins. Excellent, swam with dolphins, touched them, stroked them, got pushed and pulled by them. Excellent day, my daughter loved it. Maximum 10 people per group, rotate around several activities. Beware of the expensive and limited food and you can't wear sunblock hats, watches etc so take something to keep the sun off. Beware also the extortionate costs for photos afterwards, unfortunately that felt like a horrid rip-off and left a slight bad feeling. Forgetting that, an excellent experience that I would recommend.

A Must Do. My wife and I went to this. It was sorta spendy, but our tour company that we had our vacation through recommended it. It was one of the best and relaxing times we had. My wife doesn't swim well, but with a smaller area to work with and the life jackets all was great. She even did awsome at the foot push. (Where 2 dolphins push you). The CD is priced high as well at $160, however we did get the video and 57 pictures. They do not allow underwater cameras, I am sure it is because they want the photo money, however with the type of interaction you do with the dolphins, the camera would have been a hassle anyway.

So much fun but watch the hidden costs!. The dolphins were AMAZING and this was truly a highlight of our vacation. Just a couple things to note - when we booked this at our hotel, they did not explain that we were only paying to swim with the dolphins. Once you arrive, they will try to up-sell you to have fewer people in the pool during your experience and to have the dolphins push you out of the water by your feet. We opted to pay the extra (can't remember the amount but it wasn't cheap) and were glad we did. Just know that you can only pay for that part of the experience at Xcaret. They also really get you with the photos. You are not allowed to take your own camera. For a disk that included the pics of our family of 4, they wanted $213. Train robbery if you ask me. Since my hubby and I had done this before, we had them delete the pics of us and then we paid $123 for the pics of just our girls.

Magical. I am a non swimmer but I did this with my family who all really wanted to do it. This is such a fabulous experience and I was pleased I'd done it and shared such magic with my family. You have a short video and instruction from one of the trainers before getting into the water with the Dolhpins. This is where you spend the next 30 or 45 minutes (whichever package you've bought). There are photographers and a guy taking a video during your session - you are not allowed to take cameras etc. Straight after getting out of the water you are taken to a room to view the DVD and pictures, They do indvidual photgraphs at USD 29, the DVD at USD 59 or all of your photos on a USB stick, the DVD and a memory book containing 28 photos for USD 278 so take some additonal money as I can guarantee you will want to purchase some of the memories.

Awesome time!. This was definitely the best part of Xcaret! This was my first time swimming with dolphins and I'd love to do it again! Only disappointment was my friends and I spend $160 for a disk of all the pictures they took of us and when we got home we realized that many of the pictures were missing. A little annoying/frustrating after spending all that money and time on line!

Swimming with Dolphines. Well the thing to swim with dolphins is amazing! I recommend to everyone to try this experience in life! Those creatures are fantastic, me and my girlfriend we love them a lot :)However, swimming with dolphins in Xcaret is very good, only problem is the price. There are much more cheaper Dolphinarius places near Playa Del Carmen in Yucatan, Mexico. They charge extremely a lot for photos, videos and so on. Also the swimming with dolphins is much more expensive than other places and you get the same time and exercises with them, So if you dont have time to go to other Dolphinarius than this one would be great :)Also small problem is that there is no locker at Dolphinarius, so you leave your stuff together with all other dolphin swimmers. There is locker at the Xcaret-plus wardrobe, but that one is like 15 minutes walk from the place where you swim with the dolphins.Wish You all to have fun at Xcaret, the most amazing park in the world :)

got to go to xcaret park. If you are looking for some familly fun with lots to see this is it. We have been there twice once with and without kids. Both times were fabulous. You can take a planned trip or go on your own parking is easy and so is getting there. Snorkling underground was very unique, swimming with dolphins, manatese and many more animals. The night show is about the history of the country from the mayans to the evasion of the white man and christianity. It is a lively musical with lots to look at. You can bring your own snacks but there are resturants that are not to expensive no more than attraction anywhere else. The kids had a great time but it was difficult for them to stay up for the entire show. Get there early and stay late, would definately go back to Xcaret

Not what we were told. Pick up was more than 30 minutes late, when we arrived at Xcaret there were too many people in one place, no order, staff smashed our camera, the evening show is meant to be one of the best attractions it started off really well but half way through we left, not at all what people told us it would be thank god we didnt pay the extra $50 to have a meal during the show. Its a very long and hot day we arrived at Xcaret at 10am and finally got back to our hotel at 9:30pm many smaller children were asleep at the show as its all alittle much for one day maybe better to do it over two days if you want to go.

An amazing experience.. A natural environment in which to swim with dolphins. We swam with them as a couple just with another couple so it was nice not being in a large group. The swim we did was around 50 minutes long and we got to do lots of different things with the dolphins. The trainers were all very friendly and made you feel very at ease. Well worth the money.

Beautiful. We went to Xcaret the first week of August 2012. I was very excited to go here because I had heard such great things. I must admit that the park is absolutely beautiful. But there were some things I was somewhat disappointed in; first off, it was really crowded in the underground river and the park in general. Also, I expected to see fish and clearer water in the underground river, but I didn’t really see any. Nevertheless, I did enjoy looking at the caves, underground rocks and the cool water was very refreshing. I also enjoyed the beach, relaxing in the hammocks and looking at the sharks, dolphins and other animals. The food at the buffet was delicious, and the night show was spectacular! It’s a true testament to the Mexican culture and makes one feel proud of their heritage. The park is large so plan accordingly. We probably just saw half the park, so I suggest you look at your map and plan out what you really want to see. Wear your swim suite and a cover up… no need for extra clothes. Take sun block and bug spray. It’s a lovely, but very tiring trip.

Expensive - but a once in a lifetime experience.. Six of us went in a group and and had our own private hour with the dolphins. I'm 50 and a bit of a Victor Meldrew but thouroughly enjoyed it. However, my wife, 20 odd year old sons and their girlfriends had a fantastic time. I'm glad I did it but at £100 a head its not cheap. Bus picked us up at the hotel on time and delivered us back afterwards. As I said we had a great morning but we should have for £600.

Amazing Experience... Until you want pictures. Never swam with Dolphins and wanted to give to kids the experience. Booked the dolphin ride package, in the water about 30mins, great fun. When you get out your pictures are available to view and purchase. $30 for an 8x10 photo is steep. $400 for the package on a DVD is robbery.

AMAZING!!!!!. If you love dolphins, this is perfect. We were a family of 4 and spent an hour with the beautiful dolphins. They are so loved by all who take care of them and it was great to see them have so much fun but still within their natural habitat.

ok attraction but do not book the dolphin ride through xcaret. My daughter wanted to swim with the dolphins so when I saw that delphinus was at xcaret I felt this would be the perfect time to experience this. I contacted delphinus because we were interested in the dolphin ride but did not see it listed on the delphinus website for xcaret. They told me that I can book the dolphin ride at xcaret but this had to be done through the xcaret website. She even sent me a video showing me of the dolphin ride which is exactly what we were interested in. I booked it through xcaret. Well first this way only gives you a voucher which you have to redeem at xcaret. We waited for almost an hour in the heat to do this. Ok no problem. I can deal with that. Then when we went to our swim, they put us in an interax swim which is cheaper than the dolphin ride. I couldn't believe it when it was over and we paid more money to get the dolphin ride and did not receive it. Afterwards we complained and we demanded the difference in our money back. They refused but brought us back into the water but told us that they do not do the dolphin ride anymore. There was no great explanation as to why this was the case. When I asked as to why it is listed on the xcaret website and the delphinus salesman said it can be done, they had no answer. They did the foot push for me and after trying to do it for my daughter two times they gave up as she was too little for the foot push. They finally gave in and did the dolphin ride for her. I can say that looking back I would not likely do another dolphin event especially with delphinus. I felt like they were human slaves and had no where to swim.

Once in a lifetime :). We had a fantastic time at Delphinus, we had previously swam with dolphins and didn't think it would be as good second time round but to our surprise it was even better. The pools the dolphins were kept in were bigger and more like their natural habitat and the trainers did everything up they could to ensure you had a good time. The only criticism we had was that the photos and DVDs offered were way too expensive

Expensive, Beautiful. This place had so much to do but we didn't get to do half of because my husband was sick and everyone else on the trip didn't want to waste money on Xcaret anyway. I ended up making the best of it and walked around by myself for a long time taking in the scenery. It was beautiful! I hope I can go back sometime and take the time to enjoy it and not worry about everyone else. I really enjoyed all the Parrots, they were awesome! Our eight year old wants to go back as well, so hopefully we can! I really wish I would have gotten in the river though....no one else wanted to, and now looking back I wish I would've just done it.

The most dis organised day ever. A glorified day of orienteering and it cost me for the pleasure too much walking for kids food rubbish not enough time if you are on a tripThis trip wasted half of my spending money for a two week holiday ??? Please don't go

Very good ecological park!!. I spent a day at Xcaret and it was a very good day. It was like a cross between a zoo, waterpark and exhibits. I wish I'd have had time to do everything, some stand out attractions included tropical birds, Paradise River boat trip (6-plumed Bird of Paradise!), all you can eat buffet, underground river (although sadly i did not get time to do this!), beach areas, pools (stingrays, dolphins, sharks, giant sea turtles), tropical rainforest walk & mushroom farm, butterfly pavillion and Mexican cemetry. The night show also had plenty to offer. I gave it 4* as opposed to 5 because I'm not sure about it's treatment of animals; some of the enclosures could have been a bit larger and I'm not sure about how the animals felt as in some parts they were close to very loud noise, some parrots and horses were forced to participate in the night show which was extremely noisy (booming stage speakers and 1000s of spectators cheering and hooting). Also the baby parrots being bred were shoved in tiny spaces and looked miserable. However cant make proper judgments as this might have been neccessary for their development etc. Also, felt like the whole thing was a bit overpriced.

amazing!!. Wow, best thing I have ever done! Scary at first but relax into it. In the water for the full hour with the dolphins constantly interacting with the group of 4 and trainer. Trainer was very informative and puts you at ease.

A Beautiful Day of Fun. You will never get bored at Xcaret. There were so many things that we wanted to do but didn't possibly have the time. This is one of the most beautiful places in the Tulum/Playa area. Fishing is magnificent in the azure waters. We did the snuba adventure during the morning and had a fabulous time. In the afternoon, we swam the underground river and played in the cenotes. There is one particular room at a point on the river that is spooky and haunting. It has beautiful tile walls and ceilings. When you speak, your voice echoes...yet, it is so amazingly quiet all at the same time. Enter the spooky...not to mention there are dark places that can freak a person out if they are not the adventure-seeking type. The night dinner and show are fantastic. Very entertaining and educational. We had a great time and were pooped when we got back to our resort. Well worth the money and the long day!

Amazing place.... We were a group of 4, all in our 50's and 60's....We took a quick inexpensive cab ride from Playa del Carmen to this attraction. We bought our return cab voucher before we entered the park so when we left we were ready to get a cab no wait.This park was amazing, we enjoyed navigating through the cenote river very much, the water was so cool and it was a bit of an adventure. I personally, loved the horse show. I am a horse lover and the horses were beautiful. The riders sported colorful Mexican style outfits and the ladies rode side saddle. The night show was amazing, you have to see it and experience it. The audience was so exuberant....this was quite a day we had.....remember to swing in the hammocks overlooking the ocean, sooooo nice :)
Bets tour. Have to visit and attend folklore show at night. Try the river at lunch time so you can cool off. Pay attention to details cause there is a lot to see.
Not worth the money. Trainer was very rude - I didn't realise I would be in a group of 10 people. Photos were a rip off!
Unforgettable experience. Swimming with the dolphins is a great experience.The only disadvantage is the price of the photos that were made.

As expected.
