The wife and myself thought it would be a fantastic day out with the grandchildren,we took the xcaret plus package which included towel and snorkel hire,lockers and food.What can i say,the underground river was enjoyed by my wife and the children,the food was lower than average,the beach was good,anything you wanted to buy was overpriced and the staff were good.Swam with the sharks and the rays (but it was extra) and that was great.Overall I think it is overpriced but I am glad that we went and thenchildren did enjoy it,Would i go again?Probably yes but i would plan it a little better and maybe not pay the extras.

Great Day!. Great day tubing and snorkeling at Xcaret. All-inclusive restaurant is pretty good but great place to cool off with a drink and an ice cream. Kids loved the cenote and swimming with hundreds and hundreds of bright, colorful fish. Beautiful day and the price was right.Tip - if you are considering Xel-Ha or Xplor, they offer multi-day packages at discounted rates.

Xcaret is Xcellent!. I am always amazed by some of the subjective negative reviews around here. The level of negativity reflects the negativity in their personality and nothing else. Xcaret is an amazing and adventurous place to visit. I snorkeled with my wife and 5 year old son in the river. It is one of the most relaxing things I have done in a while. My son got to swim with the Dolphins and had a wonderful time. The trainers are very professional and make sure every patron gets individual attention from the dolphins. The service was immaculate as is the norm for that area. The Xcaret Plus package we got came with lockers, towels, and an extensive buffet. We will definitely be going back.

Unless you do it for the kids, skip this one. My wife and I got tickets to Xcaret, for free, though our hotel, Le Blanc, in Cancun. We chose to go the Xcaret because of the advertised snorkeling and underground river. What we found was far from impressive.Underground river: The underground river was more of a concrete tube ride. Very little natural formation was visible, and tool marks were visible on the walls at almost any point. Live vests, mask, and snorkel are all part of the deal, but you could skip the mask and snorkel for this ride. There is nothing to see in the dark, either above water, or below. Would definitely not do again.Snorkeling in the ocean: Snorkeling was unfortunately boring. The water at Xcaret was so murky and devoid of fish that I can't imagine how they got the pictures in the literature. We were grateful we jumped in with our mask and fins before paying an exorbitant sum to snooba or use one of the underwater diving helmets. I swam along side one of the poor souls who paid for the diving helmet, and, besides an introduced anchor and statue, there was nothing at all to see.Food: Our tickets allowed us to get a free lunch at one of the restaurants in the park. While there are several to choose from, we went to the Mexican restaurant, in the hope that the food would be of better quality. While the meal wasn't horrible, the food was far from great. With grilled chicken, hot dogs, and hamburgers the hot items, it was clear the focus of the menu was American tourists.The best part was the zoo. However, even that was far from impressive. Next time we'll pay to take a snorkel or dive trip. We cut off our park trip early and headed back to our resort for some great food and relaxation.

Pictures are a rip off. great experience to swim with the dophins and interactive with them. loads of one on one time with the dophins as maximum in the group is four! only down side is the pictures are a fortune!! it was more expensive to buy the pictures than it was to do the swim
Tons of Activities, Spectacular Night Show. Lots of activities for everyone, night show is a great way to learn about the Mexican Culture.
The price was too high!. This is an iteresting atraction since you get to swim with dolphins, but honestly the price is not worth the time that you are given to swim with the dolphins!

A family day out in Cancun. We booked an all inclusive day at Xcaret (usually over $100 usd per person). Transport to and from the park from the hotel was included and also entry into the Park and Food. (Food was lunch at one of the 5/6 restaurants which all open at Noon but dinner is not included). The day started with 7am pickup(be advised to take your own food drinks or you end up paying over $2 (usd) for drinks like pepsi and crisps as there was not much else except in the cafe at the entrance). Journey time from the park were were taken to pick other traveller made it over an hour so we arrive nearer 10am. At first looking at the map i felt overwhelmed with the number of opportunities and activities we could explore...parrots, tapir, monkeys, deer, flamingos, cougars....please note that i was deeply disappointed to find that there were very very few animals to be seen except for the abundance of parrot and flamingos....we only spotted a single spider monkey all day and there was 1 lonely tarpir and 2 even lonelier deer...so this is not a zoo. As far as activities are concerned, as part of the all inclusive you will get the opportunity to swim/snorkel the underground river (sadly i didn't do this so can only comment that it seemed interesting but went on for several miles) but there was not a whole lot more to be done if you were not doing this other than attend the various show on at different times in the day. We decided to go to the 'beach' after we had walked around exploring the animals (the one or two we could find). The beach is not so much a beach than an enclosure of water that had been carved out of the sea....it was nice enough and cooling off in the extremely hot weather made a huge difference. In the hours after lunch we caught the flying Mayans show at 3pm and did some more walking (you will walk a lot!! in the heat) and got a great view of the park from the viewing tower. We had committed at the start of the day to see the evening show....be warned this costs and extra $75 usd for 2 people but you can still see the show for free without having to eat dinner. this kicked of around 6.30pm so we had showers again and set off to watch what turned out to be a very very great show. It ended at about 9pm and we all got back to our coaches to be ferried to bed exhausted. So we started at 7am in the lobby and were dropped off just after 11pm!! Please be warned about people trying to snare you to buy cheap show tickets at the airport as this is a con to visit a time share hotel. We bought our xcaret tickets at the airport from a uniformed agent but he turned out to be one of the time share reps and sold us cheap tickets which were not all inclusive as we found out on the day after having trouble when we went to have lunch. it all ended happily so cant complain more.
Awesome fun. We had a great time here- lots to do and great fun

My visit today, July 11th 2012. There are many vendors in Playa del Carmen Mexico selling tickets to many types of family type recreational and educational theme parks and attractions. Xcaret is one park that combines both. The major theme of the park is based on ancient and contemporary Mayan history and culture. The park has several authentic Mayan architectural structures scattered about the 80 acre park, ranging in ages from greater than 800 years to some older than 1200 years, but still somewhat young to even much older Mayan cultural relics found throughout Mexico. The park also promotes sound ecosystems for widelife found in the region, including turtles, butterflies, certain types of monkeys, pumas, etc. There are also opportunities to swim with nurse sharks and dolphins, very entertaining to kids and their parents and extended family members (but there are those who would say this is exploiting the animals.) But, all in all a fun time, with a great deal of walking for exercise, and my very favorite, swimming for over 1/2 mile with a life vest securely in place. I paid for the "plus" ticket which included a good buffet lunch, a free towel, free access to the cave river swim (yes, intermittent caves, all very safe,) and snorkeling mask, snorkle and fins, all for U.S. $109. I paid another $10 U.S. for transportation to the park and back. There is alot for an individual or entire family to do at Xcaret, and I recommend the experience.

Best day ever!. It started when we walked into the park and were greeted by flamingos and parrots. Very unique place. Nothing like it in the US. BTW - you are not allowed to bring in suntan oil that is not compatible with the environment. So leave it at home. They will give you little packets of oil that won't hurt the fish or reefs (SPF 20). We went straight for the underground river, and snorkeled our way through the park. Beautiful, colorful fish! I have never snorkeled before - but even as a smoker I was able to do it! The water is a bit cold at first - only 75 degrees - but you get used to it, and it's well worth it!We then went to lunch at the Mexican buffet and listened to a live mariachi band. Food was superb! We spent the rest of the afternoon walking around. We went to the butterfly pavilion (beautiful, of course) and then to the Mayan village and ruins. We spent a lot of time in the natural pools and lagoons with their little huts (palavas) all around for shade. All in all a very, very nice day. We opted to come home on the 4:30 bus, so didn't experience the show that starts around 8. I'm saddened by this, because it has 300 people in it - I really wanted to see it, Maybe next time?The expense is worth it. We paid $79 US each, but that included a round trip ride from our hotel, which was in Cancun (45 minutes away), with all you can eat lunch; sodas and 1 beer per person. We used Best Day Travel. For a whole day of being entertained, it was definitely worth it!
Amazing experience. Brilliant! Took part in the primax experience, got to spend an hour in the water with the dolphins in groups of 4. Wonderful experience would do again next time we visit!
Expensive but good. Expensive but good. particuarly if you like dolphins or snokelling!

Touristy, but teenage kids liked it. We went to Xcaret the first week of July, 2012. Our 15 year old twin boys liked it. My wife and I thought it was overrated and too long. You leave the Cancun hotel zone at 7:30 am and get back at 10:30 pm if you stay for the show. You start out by snorkling in the underground river (people with health issues are warned not to go). Not much to see until you exit the river and see fish, other than a few bats and a stained glass ceiling. The park is huge and is more like a zoo/aquarium. The kids loved the butterfly exhibitBack side of park has a beach area with hammocks. The Xcaret Plus program lets you eat at one of the four buffets. Buffets were average and crowded, but eat about 2:00 because they stop refilling some of the food about 3:30. The show is professionally done, and goes from 7:00 until 9:00. It is so hot and humid in the outdoor theater, you had better bring a fan. The kids swam with the dolphins at Isla Mujeres rather than at Xcaret. We let the boys go to Xplore the following day and my wife and I did not go on that tour. The boys enjoyed the zip lines but were unable to drive the amphibious vehicles due to age.

All-inclusive day trip. Xcaret is a large, beautiful ecological park south of Playa Del Carmen. Plan on spending most of the day there. There are lots of areas for swimming, snorkeling and sunbathing. Food and drinks (including alcoholic drinks) are included in the admission price. You can scuba into the caves (additional cost). We particularly enjoyed the stationary boat with underwater observation windows and the variety of fish we saw. A couple of suggestions if you decide to go:1. Skip the tubing. The "river" has little current and it is difficult to paddle in the tube. Snorkel the river instead.2. You must use biodegradable suntan lotion. They check all lotions and keep any that might harm the sea creatures. They have some for sale for a semi-reasonable price. You may reclaim your lotions at the end of the day.3. The park is BIG. Lots of walking but most of the paths are paved.

Beautiful, but busy. I have been to Xcaret twice. I love it, it is something that is a "must see", but I don't intend to go back the next time I am in Mexico. I LOVED the attractions, like the baby sea turtle rescue program. The butterfly garden is to die for! There is lots to see and do, but both times we went, there were almost so many people that it wasn't pleasant. I know there goal is to make as much money as possible and stuff as many people in the park at once, but if that is the case then they need to add more park, or limit the number of people. We were traveling with our 10 and 13 year old kids. It is a great place for the family, but of the three X parks, Xcaret was the least fun for our family. Our families favorite was Xel Ha.

Excellent. Xcaret was awesome....Nice park and many things to see....The best part was the veracruz flying men and the show at night. Xcaret was a beautiful park, Can't wait to do this again. We took many pictures of the aquarium, the giant turtles, and even crocodiles. Best advice I can give is that it does get very hot and tennis shoes are a must.

A Jungle Disney World. Very touristy but yet have not seen anything like it elsewhere.The place is meticulously planned out with a jungle theme, beach, snorkeling area, animals shows and restaurants.Their main and best attraction are the underground swimming holes. There's a choice of 3: 1 dark and deep, 2 not so dark and deep. You will be required to use a life vest (free). I dont recommend snorkel gear cuz there's not much fish to see. I do recommend wearing fins to help move faster. There are warning signs that you should heed if you have health issues. It's about a 40 min swim without fins and the water is freezing at first but feels refreshing soon after. I saw many families with little kids crying and scared and yet mommy and daddy would carry them along. After a awhile I could see the struggle parents had carrying their kids with their arms clinging to their necks and having to swim this way for almost an hour. I say don't do it, you won't enjoy it and it is a struggle if you're not a strong swimmer.There is no one to bail you out!Although the buffets are enticing and there are many to choose from, if you get this included in your ticket know that you only eat once and when you leave the rest. that's it for $29pp. We decided to go to the ala carte rest. at the entrance. Breakfast for 4 and late lunch for 4 total was $80, so 2 meals kept us full for the day and the food was excellent.The show at the end of the day is 2 hrs! From 7-9. The 1st half was better, great costumes. By the last half hour, my back was killing me and the kids were ready to go, so we slipped out early and headed to our buses which were thankfully running and airconditioned. It was nice to escape without the crowdI do rec. these ices they sell at the show and thru the park. They cost 20pesos or $1.50 so yummy (Love the coconut) so cold and refreshing in a plastic bag.

Dolphin Swim. We swam with the dolphins during our visit to Playa Del Carmen. It was such a fun experience! My only complaint is I wish it could have been longer. Oh and be aware the pictures are very expensive so if you want all of them come with at least $150.
Simply amazing!. Such a great day out, wonderful experience with the dolphins, staff are all really friendly and the park itself offers so much to do. Great value for money.
Lame. Liked: the dolphins. They're very sweet creatures.Disliked: the staff. They aren't trying to give you a good time; they're trying to make money and get rid of you.
A great time.. I loved floating through the man made river and the night time show was amazing.

What an adventure!. We loved it!!! Didn't do the dolphin adventure, but the rest of the park was so much fun! My son got a passport book and we all had so much fun walking around the park looking for the visa stamps and seeing the sights. The food was average but the service, like all of cancun, was outstanding! We bought the upgrade plus package and we were able to snorkel the river and follow the 1200+ ft route. Once I got over the coldness of the water, it was so much fun. The layout while a little crazy but all still fun.
very good. this trip was amazing once we got in the water, however there was a lot of hanging around before anybody even spoke to you
So overpriced, it was ridiculous.... Dolphins were great, but I would have liked to get more for the price paid. Also, the photos were waaaayyy overpriced.
wonders of nature. So excitement,,cant compare,nature meets wilderness,,river meets ocean...fun meets relaxing..a must visit place..

Great Fun!. We went to Delphinus and had a excellent experience. We got a dolphin experience. It was just the right amount of time (about a half hour) and we were able to get it for a great price. We were able to touch the dolphins, kiss them, do tricks with them, and they did a mini show for us with jumps at the end while we were still in the water. The photos and dvd were extremely expensive but you can bargain with them. It was an experience I will never forget. Loved it!

exhileration. I swam with dolphins......wwwwoooowwww!!!! Probably the most exhilerating expierience I have ever had!!!! I will never forget it!!!Not cheap , but what a WOW factor!!!! the park seemed a little run down, but was undergoing alterations, plus it rained a lot but over all what a day!!!!!
Day trip to xcaret. Very good day out lots to see and do and the show at night is brilliant

Swim with Dolphins. I swam with Dolphins, which I've done before in Cancun. My experience at Cancun at La Isla was like being in the pool with the Dolphinns, but just observing them so not really swimming with them. At Xcaret I swam with them, hugged, them, tons of pictures (you have to pay for these of course!), tuched them, danced and singed with them. It was amazing!!!

Unforgettable day. Xcaret is a must visit place around Cancun. This beautiful natural park by the Ocean is pure fun. Indicated for all kinds of visitors, you can snorkel, dive, meet dolphins, watch typical shows, see real marine life or just stay by the beach. Meal option is worth and it gives you one lunch at a choice restaurant. Food was good. If you travel with children under 3 yo do not take the child to the snorkelig at the "river" (canaletas). It's deep and the water may not be so cold sometimes. In general, it was a very nice and pleasant day.

I recomend this to everyone no matter the age!. This park is amazing, you must visit this place and do spend all day, specially stay for the night shows, do pay the all inclusive cause drinks and food can be expensive and are a must, get there early and be ready for an incredible day, so much to do and enjoy, do stay at night for the shows!!

Well worth a visit.. A visit to Xcaret park is well worth it for the wildlife and sights. Plan you route the night before to maximise the time you spend there. Seriously consider the PLUS package as we found it worth the difference. The Evening Show is excellent. Swimming with Dolphins was amazing. Expensive but worth it. If you want a souvenir be prepapred to pay $27 US PER PHOTO or about $160 US for a CD with all photos and videos...

One of my best experiences. Although a lot of people call it "An Archeological Park" I have to be honest with everyone reading this review, Xcaret is more than a Park. When you visit it visitors can enjoy Cultural activities, some archeological places to see (I strongly recommend you do), The natural beauty of the caribbean and get to know more about a great civilization. Take a walk in "The sender tropical", visit the orchids exposition and experience the Xenotes (a underground rival trail).At the end of the day we got to experience a musical, that in my honest opinion, has nothing to envy those in Las vegas. The night show is just a magnificent way to see Mexico's history while dinning and enjoy a really good time
Dolphin Swim. AMAZING!!! Did not take up an entire day and we got to swim with the dolphins which was on my bucket list. Incredible facility. Highly recommend it!
Brilliant. Fantastic time... The dolphins really come all around you and the foot push is incredible. A must when your in Mexico!!

Best experience!!. Words can't describe this! Everyone comes out grinning like cheshire cats! Just be aware that you can't take your own photos so if you want them you have to pay and price will be in US dollars - would recomment bringing a credit card with you!

Got to swim with the dolphins for $89 a person. The dolphin exhibit is clean and the staff is very friendly, the dolphins are amazing to see and touch and be able to swim with. Overall we didn't purchase the pictures because once told where to go see the pictures we sat down at a table and waited for the guy to show us the pictures but insteed he made us get up so he can show another customer (Spanish speaking) I have to say I never though Spanish people were racist against whites but boy was I wrong. Anyways so he tells me to get up so someone else can see their pictures that was behind us, really that's how you treat customers? So we got up and walked out, moments later we passed the place against and noticed the couple didn't even buy photos. Hahaaaaaa I was willing to buy since this was my wife's first time swimming with the dolphins but they lost a sale due to rude and unexperieanced staff worker.

you have to visit it. great place in the nature,funny and adevntouring things to do(as swimming in the underground river), cultural things to see(mayan village, haciendas,acquarium), but also amazing shows representing life in Mexico starting with the mayan people , how they were conquered by the spanish people, and finishing with different traditional dances and music they have in the present. It was fabulous!
Best experience of my life!. You have to do this trip! It is the best experience we have ever done.
Good experience for kids. A staged event, rip off prices for DVD, would go once for experience but never again

Xcaret Cancun Mexico. This is an awesome and extravagant natural adventure. Extremely clean and lots of fun. They thought of just about everything to enjoy the sea...the underground river is fabulous. Stayed at the Westin, but would have prefered staying in Tulum...I highly recommend not going to shop/eat on the "strip" on hotel row..Expensive and loud..Vendors are too pushy and desperate...The Mocambo was ok but service lousy and they include tip on bill, so you have no choice....
family park. It was ok. The underground river snorkeling was kinda dark and we weren't huge fans. It's like a zoo meets theme park. The night show was cool to appreciate the Mayan history.

A victim of it's own success. Went to this park 13 years ago and it was unique & fantastic. Just been very recently and it has lost a lot of it's charm.Everything is overpriced and the Dolphin experience is a bit of a rip off. Be sure you know what you are paying for when you book the Dolphins. The packages are different. The photographs and dvd's of your experience are ridiculously priced and they make it very hard for you to take your own pictures. The staff in the lockers etc are not very helpful. The restaurant however was excellent and the staff fantastic. I wouldn't go back anytime soon though.

Xcaret. This theme park had a variety of animals and activities to do. I enjoyed the Macaw birds and taking pictures with them. It was a lot of walking but the view along the way was worth it. It is a must do and the night show is awesome. I bought a package deal for one day that included all day and night/ 1 buffet meal/ snorkel gear and locker.

Great place to catch some rays and cool off. We went a on a cruise and this was one of the tours available. I had read up about it before hand and even though the prices were a tad higher than other tours it sounded like an interesting and safe place to visit. The whole place is clean especially the restrooms. It was humid and very warm on our visit. We decided to do the underground river tour. It was awesome. The water was really "cold" compared to the air temp but once you got into the water and get used to it, it was awesome. The river takes you from one end of the park to other. The water was refreshing and crystal clear. Once you reclaimed your belongings at the end there are some awesome "natural" pools that are fed by the ocean waves. Ours had some pretty fish in it and the hamocks were nice looking over the ocean as well. We ate at the restuarant by the Dolphin area. It was a buffet style and was very tasty and fresh. It wasn't cheap but the quality was good. Some of the desserts were very interesting and tasty...so tasty we got the names of a few and made them when we got home! The park has a lot of animals and plants. It's a perfect place to explore and spend the day. My brother took his family there after we told him about it and they have an equally good experience. I'd go back if we were in the region again, mainly for the underground river!
Great Time. Lots of walking lot to see cool snorkling river and birds

Nice but expensive. If you are not traveling with your parents credit card then be aware that everything is expensive in this man made "senotes" parc. If you are looking for attraction sight that is practical, beautiful, and has different attraction sights that you rarely find in another place in this world then I recommend a visit to Xcaret. But if you are looking for authentic senotes diving experience or like to snorkel for free, then I recommend hundreds of other places around this place that are for free or has much smaller fee.

Awesome!. We had a wonderful time swimming with the doplhins here who seemed happy and well kept which was really important to us - we had a wonderful experience and would recommend Delphinus Xcaret if you want to swim with Dolphins

the best experience ever. we went to xcaret on may 20 with a group of friends and my husband and me and we loved it!i recommend you purchase a two day pass becasue it worht it and if you stay in cancun is just 1 and half hour away (one way).one thing i also recommend is take enough cash so you can do the extra activities, each pictures is $10 us dollars so make sure you take enoughbut guys this is totally worth it, the park is amaizing and please you Must see the show at 7 pm. get early to the theather so you can reserve your sit, we didnt purchased the dinner packg but nest time we will becasue is worth it, they give you food, drinks, dessert and the staff is amaizing. also is not worth it to buy the cd they sell to you, but take enough pictures !!another thing i recommend is to do the snorkeling activity is the best.we will definitely go back to Xcaret.. one recommendation if you have small kids, take enough food because this can add up and there are lockers eveywhere so you can safetly have your things in there. the price for the lockers are $2-5 dollars US.the Carribean restaurant was the one we chooose, OMG the best guacamole i have ever eaten... I hope you can take advantage of this recommendation but def this is a must do thing if you ever go to Cancun.
awesome time!. we did the dolphin trainer for the day. I would recommend to anyone! Only the photo package prices are very high so try to take your our photos!

Wish we had more time!. We visited Xcaret in late April. We bought a one day ticket with transportation from our hotel. There was a special going on where we could have purchased the second day at 50%, but we had other tours planned, so we only bought the one-day ticket. At the end of the day, we wished we had planned two days. There was so much we missed! Or, we should have taken a taxi and gotten to the park when it opened and stayed a bit later, instead of the arranged bus transportation (see below).The park is large, so planning is important to avoid backtracking. Check the maps ahead of time and decide what’s important to you.  At the entrance, there is a reservations area where we made arrangements for a snuba trip (extra cost). The line was long, but moved quickly and we were through the line in just a few minutes. We then waited in line for lockers, snorkel gear, etc. That also moved pretty quickly, so we were done with all of the lines in about ½ hour. There are two rivers to float/snorkel in. We did the inside river and it was not so good. It was dark most of the time; there was a lot of bumping around with other people, and sharp edges on the walls. We didn’t have time to do the outside river, but it looked much more interesting and easier. We chose the seafood buffet for lunch (included in the ticket price with one small glass of beer and all soft drinks). It was ok. Not the best seafood buffet, but enough to fill you up. The service was also very slow. Someone suggested that the International buffet was much better.We didn’t stay for the dinner show. I understand that the show is very good, but I can’t comment on it. We did purchase the DVD, but it’s not the same sitting on the couch watching it – even with the homemade frozen margueritas!We purchased a snuba tour (not included in the admission price). This was like scuba diving (I think max 15 feet), but the tanks are up above the water on floats and not on your back. No need to be dive certified to do this. We thought this was one of the highlights of our entire trip! The crew on the boat and our dive guide were all fantastic. They were helpful with people that were a little timid. We were split into groups of four and since my husband and I are strong swimmers and snorkel all the time, as well as the other couple with us, we were able to go quite far away from the boat and quite far down. We saw all kinds of beautiful fish and even a sea turtle! There are lots of areas to sit in the shade and just take in the tropical surroundings. There’s a small beach where you can float on inner tubes, and do some snorkeling. There are lots of exotic animals to see, as well. We didn’t get to do those things because we had such a limited amount of time in the park.So, the thing we definitely would have changed would be to arrange our own transportation from Dreams Riviera Cancun. The hotel is only about 30 – 40 minutes away from Xcaret, but because our bus arrived to pick us up about ½ hour later than it was supposed to, and because we had other hotel stops and had to wait for people, we didn’t actually arrive at Xcaret for over 2 hours. We lost valuable time that we could have used to enjoy more things at the park. If using the transportation, I would suggest purchasing that second day ticket. On the way back, we were told to be at the bus stop at 4:30. We arrived around 4:20 and were told that our bus left because it was full, and we would have to catch a bus that would take us to XPlore (sister park) and we could connect to a bus to our hotel from there. After a few mix ups on which bus to take from Xcaret (were told 2 different bus numbers and ended up taking a totally different bus), we finally arrived at XPlore a little after 5pm only to be told that the bus to our hotel was full and we would have to wait for another bus. Xplore was closed and there were no bathroom facilities. One bus driver finally took pity on us and let me sit on the “co-driver seat” and my husband sat on the front stair. Probably illegal, but I just wanted to get back to the hotel at this point. Thankfully, we were the first hotel, but it still took us almost 2 hours to get back from Xcaret! Really, we should have just taken a taxi. We missed so much of the park due to the transportation issues.We would definitely go back to Xcaret again!
Amazing show and river swim. "A tribute to Mexico", show was the highlight in the park. We have enjoyed the snorkeling very much. Food was awesome. A definite entertainment park.
Worth the Trip. Very fun filled day. The floating down the river was wonderful to get out of the 90 degree weather. I would recommend going to Xcaret at least 1 time.
Excellent. Did the Primax swim. 50 mins in the pool in a group of 4 people. Very enjoyable and a definite must.
Beautiful and interesting.. Very peaceful place to spend the day. Can get overcrowded with tourist but all in all a pleasant excursion from busy Cancun

Rip off. I can not understand how people can say this is worth a trip (unless you have money to burn). We bought the basic tickets which was $79 (US) each which is over £50 (GBP) for this all we got was a visit to a zoo, swim in the river and river boat trip. Yes I know there was a big show a 7pm but after reading previous reviews everyone says how much there is to do so we got there early, by midday we had done everthing on our ticket and couldnt wait around for 7hrs doing nothing. Like I said above if you have money to burn this place would be ok but most of the good things cost extra on top of your entry price (swimming with dolphins etc). Considering I could get two advance full adult tickets to alton towers for the same price as one basic entry ticket here on the day I felt completely robbed.
Rewarding. we had a great time swimming with the dolphins and the kids had an educational and memorable experience.
A must see. Xcaret is a must see. My daughter loved the sea turtles and the lazy river. This is our second time there and the show was as amazing as the first time.

Awesome experience. We loved this...it was so much fun, very organized, and professional. It was a once in a life time experience, and well worth the cost. We paid $159 for an hour with the dolphins. I've read alot of complaints about the cost of pictures...we were offered 1 for $29, a CD with all pictures for $69, or all pictures plus the video for $119. My husband swam with the dolphins (his birthday), while I watched. I was allowed to take all the pictures I wanted as well as video. I think if you know what to expect with their pictures, you can put it in perspective. We paid the $69...again, once in a lifetime. It was the ONLY place we went to where they didn't ask for tips:) We loved it and are planning to go back next time. I had fun just watching!

Took my breath away. At first I was a little skeptical about paying the money to go to XCaret but trust me when I tell you, it was worth every cent!! When we arrived we went straight to the underground river. It was so beautiful. I have to admit that I was a little scared at 1st because we were swimming through caves and when you looked down there were very deep caverns but we had on life vests so we just kept going. It was so neat and so different from anything I've ever done. There are several places along the way to get out of the water if you want to rest. Once we got out of the river we went straight for the beach. I have never in my life seen such beautiful, clear water. This place is paradise!! I'm usually scared to be in the ocean but it was like sitting in a bath tub. You could also swim out to the fence where the dolphins are and see them swimming around. They would swim right by you so you were very up close without having to pay for a swim. After we were done swimming we decided to grab lunch at one of the buffets there. Honestly, we didn't like the food. The display was gorgeous but none of the food we had in Mexico please out particular taste (I'm sure it was just us, not them). It was also VERY over priced..but we had to eat! We walked around for a while just trying to see everything. Everywhere you look is a photo opportunity. They had a parrot sitting on a fence for people to take picture but they had to move it because a huge snake was stalking it. It's all natural there with all sorts of wild life walking around.. iguanas, birds, snakes etc. We didn't see even half of the park but we absolutely loved what we did see and probably wouldn't do anything different the next time around. I know some the reviewers were fussing about them not wanting cameras but no one said anything to us..however, we were not at any of the animal attractions. We went purely for the beach area and I dream of the day I can go again.

Worth the money, pictures so expensive though!. Girlfriend and I did an 8 person group with swimming with dolphins. They jumped over us, let us pet them, carried us about 30 feet which was really fun, and a dolphin kiss. Plenty of fun in the water for 30-45 minutes, felt like I got good value out of it honestly and the trainers really seemed interested in their friends. You really dont need to have a smaller group for more price, I like it with 8 so you can see all the interactions with the dolphins. They all have different personalities just like us!Only downside was the cost of the pictures and dvd option. Really unreasonable. I got 1 picture of my girlfriend for $30 because it was too good to pass up. The whole pics & dvd was like $219, and just pictures was $130 or something astronomical. Didnt get to do the dolphin push, which looked fun but for an extra 50 bucks probably not worth it. Still happy we went and glad we did it!

Lots of great attractions for people and children of all ages. My children really enjoyed the aquarium with fish. We spent all day here and watched their amazing evening live show! I would have liked to try more things but my kids were too young

A place for fun and learning!. It´s a mini review of all the parts of Mexico, with many shows and places to go, even for those who don´t want do dive (like me and my husband). I´ve been there on May,2012. It was just a very big surprise, It exceeded my expectations. There are many places to go, to rest and to eat, although it´s very expensive, just like US$ 5,00 a beer. The first part of the show in the evening is reat (the pre-hispanic period), but after the interval it became boring, and We left. It´s two hours for a show, I think it´s too much. But it´s very well done.

One of the most picturesque places. The short version: A fantastic and beautiful way to spend a day in Mexico; but it'll cost ya a bit.My wife and I arrived not long after the park opened and did not have to wait in any lines. I knew from friends and family who'd been before, that a special type of sunblock was required. This being the case, we left our sunblock at the resort and purchased the Xcaret "eco-friendly" sunblock for $16usd. We opted for the Xcaret Plus admission, (2 adults) totaling $218.00. The Plus bracelet includes a locker rental, snorkel gear and a buffet lunch. The buffet was quite good and contained a large selection of various Mexican dishes. If you plan on doing everything anyway, this will save you a little money in the long run. We did not do the swimming with the dolphins/sharks or the Sea Explorer, which all cost extra.The property as a whole is amazing. It is relatively easy to navigate with or without the park map, there are plenty of signs to guide you. There are a total of three "rivers" to snorkel through: Azul, Mayan and Manatee. The only time you will see fish is at the end of each, near the exits. My wife did not care for the long and dark cave portions of the Azul river, which included bats. I thought it was great.Security was not an issue. In addition to the lockers, your shoes, shirts, sandals, etc, are locked in a duffel bag (to which you possess the key) and taken to the exit points to wait for you. The animals and wildlife were incredible. My wife made it a point to hang around for the feeding of the large sea turtles. We did spectate a bit at the dolphin swimming area and it appeared to be a very fun and interactive experience. There is something for everyone here. You can swim the rivers or beach, walk around and see the animals or lay in a hammock overlooking an incredible ocean view. We did a bit of it all and loved it!!

A fabulous entertainment and education for every interest.. The cost of entry is relatively high, but the range of activities, entertainments and attractions are wide and most impressively of a very high quality. This is not the type of tatty theme park we are used to in Europe. Everything is completed to a very high standard. The park includes a wide range of activities and is a fascinating place to learn about Mayan history and Mexican/Mayan culture. I am very anti all-inclusive parks like this, after my Alton Towers, Eurodisney etc experiences, but this is nothing like that. It is full of art and music as well as wild life, examples of local skills and artifacts and exciting physical rides and activities. A complete all round experience: it even has a wine cellar with wine tasting and dining room built into the caves underground. This place is imaginative, classy and absolutely engrossing. You won't be disappointed.

Great day. My daughter and I went to Xcaret in March and loved it, very worth the money to spend a day there. So much to do and such a beautiful location. We swam in unground caverns, saw many different animals, spent some time at the beautiful beach and enjoyed a great luncheon that we purchased in the package.

Zoo. This had so many things to do and enjoy but I must say the one that was tops for me because I got to go swimming with the dolphins all the inter action was great and I did choose a group with only 4 people so I would have more time with them.

Worth the Money. After visiting Cancun 10 previous times I decided to finally try Xcaret with my family. I had always resisted since it is over-marketed and I thought I'd be disappointed. I purchased the XCaret plus package and I'd highly recommend that. It was a great way to spend the day in a beautiful environment. It's like a combination of beach, zoo, aquarium, rivers.... There's a ton to see and it's worth the price.

The evening show was absolutely the best representation of the Mexican/Maya culture.. Xcaret is a nature park with lots of animals, underground caverns for diving, scuba/snuba, etc. If you walk through the zoo area, it gets very hot with the sun reflecting off the concrete. However, head to the underground cavern ride for a cool ride, or head to the beautiful beach to cool off. We went to the evening show and you must not miss this show. A beautiful representation of the Mayan culture with horses, parrots, dancers representing the various Mexican cultures, wonderful Mariachis, solo performances, laso, gorgeous colors...beautiful music....just an absolute fantastic show.

Expensive for Mexico: We got it for free. We were staying in Playa del Carmen and as other had mentioned it's only 10-15 minutes away. We rented a car and it was easy to find as it was clearly labeled. I will begin by saying that we got this excursion for free after listening to the timeshare thing at the Grand Mayan, which last approximately 90 minutes. The Park is pretty big and had lots to see, but I can't imagine paying the price it was for what you get. We had been given the plus which included an all you can eat buffet with free nonalcoholic drinks and a free beer for each person. The food was great, but if you paid the actual price it was 30 bucks and that didn't include the drinks. The secret river was free and walking around is free, but expect to pay lots of additions once inside. I can see how you can spend the entire day here, because it is huge with a lot to see. My fiance LOVED the McCaws. I would recommend going to the park after you have lunch and then eating there for dinner. We didn't stay for the night show, because it felt like a long day and didn't want to drive back to our hotel in the dark. It's a pretty park, but I would have felt ripped-off for the price. The regular ticket would have been sufficient if you don't plan to live there for the day.

Dolphin Swim is Truly Unique. Went with my wife and 14 yr old daughter on April 12th. We had an awsome time and really enjoyed the dolphin swim (which was the main reason for choosing this tour). The dolphin swim is a truly unique experience and I highly recommend paying the extra fee for this feature. We also enjoyed the underground river, the snorkeling, the animal exhibits and the butterfly enclosure (which is unbelievably beautiful). We had a great buffet lunch at a place called La Laguna which had a vast assortment of good quality food and live entertainment. The only place I disagree with most of the other reviews is that we all found the night show boring and long. Enjoy your day but leave around 6pm!P.S. The map is cartoony and mostly useless and we got lost a few times.

Swimming with the Dolphins. Delphinius is located close to the Iberostar Tucan-- so not a long ride. You spend an hour in the water with the dolphins and it's really a neat experience-- especially the "Foot Push" where 2 dolphins come up behind you and push you through the water and your body is lifted out of the water. Really great excursion and worth the cost-- caution-- the pictures and DVD are really expensive-- but you are going to want them. If you bring someone with you it does not cost them anything and they can take some pictures on the side where they are allowed to stand-- bit not as good as the ones you end up purchasing for a couple hundred dollars.

Swimming with Dolphins!. An Incredible experience and one that everyone should do! I swam with my partner and one other couple and would recommend splashing out on a more costly package as you get more time with the dolpins in a smaller group, and it really is worth it as for most of us it is a 'once in a lifetime' thing! Having said that, given the opportunity to do it again, I wouldn't hesitate! The photos/video at the end are fairly pricey but of course optional!
xcaret. Wonderful family adventure. We did the underground river and very easy for all ages from 8 to 65. The buffet was hugh and delicious, something for everyone. A very enjoyable day.

A wonderful day - One day is not enough!. So much to do in a day but luckily you can book a second day for half price.Food buffets are delicious.Snorkelling the underground river way a unique and relaxing experience suitable for all ages.We tried Snuba - a cross between snorkelling and diving - on the reef a 10 min boat ride from the beach)Lots of animals to see and encounter (Parrots, flamingoes, butterflies, turtles, fish, dolphins, sting rays, monkeys, crocs and cats)The night snow is well worth seeing - get there early for a good seat.

Fun in The Sun. My husband and I loved the experience. We were staying in Cozumel and wanted to do something on the mainland and chose Xcaret. We took the ferry over in the morning and caught a bus at the bus station a couple blocks from the ferry landing in Playa del Carmen. It started to rain on the way to the park and I thought we wouldn't have a good time, but it cleared off in 30 minutes. What an experience. One fee for a lazy river, beautiful lagoon, ruins, animals, ocean views, and acts throughout the day. The best was the finale at the end of the day, worth the price of admission. The Mayan Village and show was the best if you time it right. We will definately go back.

Great Family Activity. This was a really fun day for the whole family - my husband, myself, and our two boys, ages 10 and 12. We bought the tour through our Cancun hotel. I guess if we did this again, I would probably forego the tour, and just buy tickets and rent a car service or take a taxi. The bus transportation ended up taking over 2 hours long to get there with all the waiting - advertised as 1 hour. But when we got there it was very fun. We did the Sea Trek and all loved it. We also got to see butterflies, parrots, manatees, sea turtles, dolphins, monkeys and a tapir. Also explored underground caves with life jackets, which was cool and refreshing. Lots of walking, so wear good shoes. Lockers were provided, as were towels. Included food was a huge buffet at any of the restaurants on site, and was very good. We did not end up staying for the show because we were all worn out. Very pretty and so big that lots of times we felt like we were the only ones there. We would go back.
Simply amazing. A wonderful adventure sharing with friendly dolphins. Simply unbelievable. I totally recommend the experience
Wonderland meets the Jungle. Great place lots to see and do. Snorkelled in the inlet, really enjoyed that. Great place to take the kids, like wonderland but in a jungle setting.

expensive and too fabricated for my taste. I don't like places where they charge 5 or more different prices depending on what you want...its confusing. But we did what we were planing to - walk around and swim with dolphins (payed separately). It is a beautiful place for sure but it is a park... like disney...

loved the dolphins. my daughter swam with the dolphins and had a great time. We all enjoyed snorkelling in the lazy river. It was a really long day however, as the bus came to our resort at 7:30 a.m. and picked up at other resorts. We stayed for the show and didn't get home until 9:30 p.m. Also the cost for the supper is $40 per person and it really wasn't that great. You can stay for the show without having the supper (they sell popcorn in the stands) and grab something at your resort when you get back.

Dolphins. It was on my life list to swim with the dolphins. This was the most amazing fun I have ever had. The staff made it so relaxing. Wow and beautiful are all I ever felt. Those animals are so very beautiful and human. Just look in their eyes and they feel as we do. God bless everything you do. Fun, joy, laugh and play. We could learn a lot. Xoxo

Amazing park. I spent a whole day in Xcaret a few weeks ago. It is an absolutely amazing park with a lot of things to do. It is worth arriving around opening time. Firstly, we did a walk around the park: Mayan ruins, turtle breeding, dolphin-area, beach, pumas, jaguars, Maya Cemetery, parrot house, butterfly-house, etc. After that we did snorkeling, it was good but we did not see so many fish. We had bought a passport which is valid to three parks: Xcaret, Xel-Ha and Xplor. Therefore, we got everywhere the "plus" things. Here: towel, one lunch with unlimited drinks, locker for free. I recommend you to buy either this passport (if you want to go to these three parks) or the plus ticket. There are different shows everywhere. Before entering, you get a map. The guide shows you the location of the shows and its time. Evening show is the BEST!!!! Do not miss it!!! It lasts more than two hours, it is amazing!!! Maya dance, cultural show, Mexican musicians and dancers!!! Wow!!! :))Do not worry about going to home. There were about 100 taxi cars which were ready to take you home!!! Or you can buy your ticket with trasportation!All in all, it was an amazing day!!!

An Experience for Every Bucket List. Swimming with dolphins really should say it all, however, it's probably not saying enough!Getting to swim and interact with dolphins was a phenomenal experience! Our guide was both friendly, attentive, and accommodating. One of the greatest highlights was that for those who were a little timid to swim in the cove, the guide made sure to include them in most of the interactions and had the dolphins swim up to the underwater deck to be petted and engaged with. Equally, 45 minutes in the water with the dolphins is definitely an ideal time for maximum engagement!The cove was clean, the dolphins looked healthy, and the trainers treated both the participants and the dolphins with utmost respect! I couldn't think of a better trip!

Great Day!!. Loved every aspect of this place. The underground river snorkel was the best and the whole family enjoyed it. Getting the snorkel equipment was pretty seamless and efficient .Loved the Turtle and butterfly area too. Great experience for the kids.
funday. We spent the entire day here - lots to see and do. The evening show they put on in the auditorium is well worth seeing
Beautiful park. It great place to spend a day. Kind of pricey but the park is well kept and animals appear to be well taken care of.

Beautiful & Relaxing. Took the ferry from Cozumel to Playa del Carmen and went to Xcaret Park This place is beautiful and lots to do. You can float down the underground river and wind up in the ocean. Butterfly sactuary is nice and there are numerous animals to view. You can grab a lounge chair and soak in the sun or shade, swim in the ocean, or even swim with the dolphins. There's also places to purchase food and gifts.

One day is not enough!. Our visit to Xcaret turned into 2 days - we had so much fun the first day, and didn't realize how much there is to see there, that we bought tickets for another day. The park is great for all ages. We went with our 6 and 2 year old kids, and both had a great time. There is something for everyone here: snorkeling in underground rivers, Mayan ruins, animal attractions, shows, food, swimming, and much more! The animals are spectacular - jaguars, various birds (macaws, toucans, flamingos, etc), beautiful aquariums with reef fish and jellies, sharks, sea turtles, dolphins, rays and a gigantic manatee. There are also wild iguanas roaming around - we were a little surprised and wary when we first w them, but soon realized they want nothing to do with us at all! My favorite animal exhibit was the butterflies. There is a huge enclosure in which the park breeds, hatches and maintains several varieties of butterflies. You walk through the enclosure - it's outside, just covered so they can't fly away - and feel as though you are deep in a jungle with beautiful flowers and butterflies everywhere. They fly free, occasionally landing on your shoulder or head! One caution: little kids may be a little scared as some of the butterflies are quite large. The other animal exhibits should not be missed - see them all!Another don't miss attraction is the snorkeling. You rent a life vest, snorkel, mask and fins (you get to keep the snorkel as a souvenir, which is also much more sanitary), and you can also rent a locker and towel. You are given a large duffel bag, as well. Then just change into your swimsuit in the changing area, drop off your towel and shoes with your bag, and it is whisked away across the park so you have everything waiting for you on the other side. There are 3 different rivers to choose from, all are accessible by anyone and no water skills are really required. My son can't swim well at all, and he had a blast snorkeling and swimming along, aided by his life vest. My 2 year old daughter came too - she can't swim, but was perfectly happy to just float along with Mom or Dad. We snorkeled 2 of the 3 rivers - both were wonderful in their own ways. One of them allowed views into some of the sea animal enclosures, and we got to see the biggest manatee ever. That thing was huge! Very exciting and fun!There are 2 different shows to see - one is a musical show featuring traditional Mexican songs and dances, and the other is a spectacular show encompassing Mexican history from the Mayans to the present. The whole show is just amazing - held in a giant outdoor auditorium. It begins with traditional Mayan games for the king, and ends with a modern song. It is all in Spanish, and even though I speak Spanish, I missed a lot of the narration. Which is ok - you can definitely follow it without understanding what is being said. My kids liked the Mayan games - a soccer-like game and "fireball hockey" as my son called it - best, while my husband and I liked all the songs and costumes. Do not miss this. There are also several equestrian shows with traditional charros performing intricate rope tricks and riding maneuvers. My daughter loved the charras in their "pretty pink dresses" :-). The food is all buffet, and it is ok. It's real Mexian food, not Tex-Mex, but steam table food. So, just ok. Huge gift shop as well, with just about anything you can imagine - the standard t-shirts and hats, as well as fine jewelry, food and Mexican handicrafts. Prices are pretty reasonable, too. If you find yourself in Playa del Carmen for nearby, you have to go to Xcaret. Do not miss it - it is wonderful!

Great day out. Xcaret is a fabulous day out for young and old with so much to do. We started the day by viewing all the different animals on view...from Pumas and Jaguars to Deer and a fabulous Butterfly house. There is an undeground swim through tunnels filled with stalactytes and this is a nice way to finish the day part of the trip as you complete the swim by the sea and you can recuperate and take some sun on a fabulous beach. There is also the opportunity to swim with Dolphins although having done so before we declined to take this up. Lunch which was included on our tour and was fantastic and so unlike the fast food you would recieve at an English attraction. We were offered 2 types of tour....the early finish tour where you can make it back to your hotel in time for evening meal or the later finish tour which we did where you get to see a Mayan/Mexican show in a massive arena and this was truly fantastic. You can book a meal for the show (book on entering Xcaret) and I would recommend this as the show is a couple of hours long and then of course you have the long drive back to the hotel. We booked the meal and were given front row seats with waiter service and the food was of excellent quality. There really is so much to do at Xcaret that this review would be a mile long if I listed everything, it's an all round great day out.....GO ON IT.
Dolphin Swim. Swimming with the dolphins was amazing! We chose to upgrade to have longer in the water with the dolphins! Great choice! Definately worth the money!
The Perfect Tour. The night show is fantastic, Watch the turtle feeding at 5PM. The cavern swim is a must
Too costly. Just the cost to swim with the Dolphins was high & if you wanted pictures or videos of your time with the Dolphins it was very costly.Otherwise it was fantastic

Dolphin Swimming. This was my first time swimming with dolphins. I swam with 8 other people. The dolphin had 2 babies. I was able to be in the water with her for 30-40 minutes. I danced with her and tickled her belly. She did her routine for us; splashing and jumping. I paid $89 for 30 minutes

A relaxing ECO Park. It was a great trip. Plan for a long day though but has a lot of areas to see so plan your day there. Recomend walking around and then do the river it takes some time and relaxes you way to much,

This is among the top attractions in the Cancun Area. This is kinda like the Disneyland of the Cancun area. It's about an hour south of the hotel zone but well worth going to visit for two days - yes two days. You could spend two days there in order to enjoy the entire park. There's water stuff to do as well as lots to see. If you do not go often to Mexico, this will give you a huge flavor of all of Mexico in one spot. Buy the plus package to spend the entire day there including the night show. the buffet that is included in the plus package will give you access to 5 restaurants, the food is fabulous. After eating the stuff in the hotel all-inclusive for 5 days, this food was a welcomed relief. I will say that if you go to Mexico and Cancun a lot, for several years, some of this will be "old hat" but then you get to enjoy the water activities.

Better than Disney World. !) Buy tickets at the Xcaret Park Office in Cancun Hotel Zone. It is the only location that includes free coach bus transportation to Xcaret Park with the cost of admission.2) Only Eco-friendly sunscreen is allowed. You must leave all other sunscreens at the gate.3) Xcaret Plus Ticket Package includes buffet lunch and access to Xcaret Plus facilities

Lots to do... There is alot of neat and fn things here for the kids to see and do, remember all inclusive doesnt mean all inclusive here, you only get one meal and one drink at one restaurant. The animals were great, the turtles were fantastic, the beach area was beautiful and the underground river is awesome for snorkling. We did go to the night show and paid the extra for the dinner and VIP seating well worth the $40 bucks seats were awesome and dinner was yummy! The show dragged on a bit but overall it was good. Long day if your hotel is close I suggest taking a cab 12-13 hours are a long day for adults little own kids. Try it out its worth the look.

this is an amazing excursion. Make sure to bring your own eco friendly sunscreen prior to arriving. Be prepared do do ALOT of walking. This is a must do excursion with so much to see. I've been twice and I still don't think I've seen everything there. The night show is fabulous and I recommend buying tickets to have dinner in theater for premium seats.Bring extra money with you for this excursion as there are many options for activities that are not included. We tried SNUBA but I really wouldn't recommend that one. Take your time and enjoy all the beautiful sights that Excaret has to offer.

Watch out for the photo charges -- take a wallet and lots of cash. We were happy with the trainers and amazed by the dolphins but as this was quite an expensive tour, the additional charges for the photographs and CD,etc. were outrageous.

Loved it!!. We were in a group of 4 and had a fantastic time. Our guide in the pool with the dolphin was good, a little hard to understand, but good! Snook was our dolphin and I loved her, they are amazing creatures and it was an amazing experience to share with my husband and 8 yr old son. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Great Experience. Smiles, smiles and more smiles! Worth every penny. Staff are very friendly

Trainer for a day. Didn't spend enough time in the water with the dolphins.Our trainer made us wait out of the water often.The food was disgusting.The photo packages are extremely over priced and the quality is poor. The photos were not worth the purchase.The trainers seem to really care about the dolphins.Beautiful grounds and holding pools.

Could easily have spent two days here.. Please note that you need to leave a deposit for snorkel equipment, towels, lifejackets and locker rentals. They are VERY efficient in collecting and returning deposits. They have a certain amount they take for a deposit, but we did not have that much, so they took a lesser amount. They roll it, mark your number on it, cross-reference to your wrist band, and return the exact same bills to you on return of equipment. Just make sure you take $$ with you. In the future, I would not bother with a snorkel for the underground rivers, just the flippers. You have a choice of all underground, all open air, or 1/2 and half. We did half and half, and it was beautiful!! The night show is worth staying for.

A very long day but a lot of fun. We went with two kids aged 7 and10. There was lots to do. The caves were great and the beach was very nice. The kids loved seeing the turtles at various ages. The show at night was excellent. I would however say it was a very very long day.
Great excursion for all, kids, parents and grandparents!. Show at night is spectacular! We still cannot believe the talent on stage that night!

Life time experience…!. I had already swum with dolphins in Acapulco. It was great but it was a small pool and was very short. This time I was looking swimming holding the dolphin fin (like in flipper TV show !). They have 2 rides: one is half an hour and the other is one hour but it happened to be that the 30 mins ride was the one including the swing I wanted. It was outstanding and exceeded my expectations…! The facilities were nice…the right size, nice clear salted water…cold but not too much…People is kind…the not so good: you cannot have a camera and the pictures are really expensive…one tip: you don’t need to enter Xcaret to get to Delphinus…! Enjoy…!
Swimming with Dolphins is an amazing experience!. Very well organised and friendly staff - make the most of it! Only downside was highly inflated cost of photos!

Family experience. We did the underground river snorkel, I was a bit disappointed to see all the roofs of the underground caverns had been scraped clean, there were no stalactites to see. The water was merky at the very end we saw a few fish. The lagoon beach was a nice place to hang out. They want to charge you to do everything there. We paid for the plus tix so food and lockers were included. But were charged for everything other than one included beer for drinks even water since they only serve bottles. Snorkeling in the lagoon was lame, they have little statues for something to see since there is nothing left in the lagoon. My son and I saw maybe 50 fish in the whole lagoon. it is more of a zoo type experience with a beach than anything. Some people we went with, went to xel-ha the day after and said it was a way better time. The food is all inclusive and they got to see tons of fish and stingrays while they were there. The show at the end of the day was really cool the first half is all about the Mayan culture and e Spanish takeover. The second half had a lot of dancing ha my wife loved it, but I found it dragged on a bit. I feel you need to stay for the show to get your monies worth. If you book with best day travel make sure you get at least 10% off. Make sure you plan for a long day if you have little ones! We left cancun at 7 am and didn't return until almost 10 pm. There is one early bus that leaves at 4:30 but it feels as though you are rushed to get on that one.

AMAZING. Second time visiting the place, first time almost 9 years ago, but the whole experience, was still amazing , the park beautifully preserved, the shows breathtaking... Great for adults and even greater for kids...

Great! But disappointed with all the walking...read why?. XCARET is a beautiful park with natural and cultural richness of Mexico.When you enter the park, you get a map of the site marked with numbers as it is huge. So, we said we will follow the numbers and not miss anything. Well... unfortuately there is no number signs anywhere so we ended up asking employees where to go and often going around and coming back to the same spot! I don't understand how come no one has thought of this? Even the employees did not know what to answer when I asked them how come there are no numbers on the site according to the map? If you intend to go snorkling in the river you won't see much except a few fish once in a while. It's kind of a man made river. If you want to admire the environment it's beautiful.As for the Mayan show at 6:00pm it's spectacular! The dance, music and travel through Mexican history.Also, if you can catch the daily intertainement's of the Mayan shows it's worth it!As for the restaurants, we went to the La Laguna just next to the jaguar island. It is a big international food buffet and the food was great! If you decide to go to XCARET, do not book any other excursions for that day as you will be exausted... but it's up to you! Have fun and enjoy!

Dolphin kisses!. I went there with a friend and picked the Primax package per our Delta rep's recommendation ($159). It was an awesome experience. You get to kiss and get kissed by the dolphin(s), do some tricks with them, and the best is the foot push where two dolphins push your feet from underwater and you get lifted up like a speedboat. The only downside is that the pictures/videos are really expensive. I got one picture and that was about $30. You can also bring a free companion per paid guest who can sit on the side to watch and take pictures.

Decent fun, but bring $$$. Brought the family from the very nearby Barcelo Maya resort to the Xcaret park and purchased a 2 day deluxe pass. The deluxe passes are to include 1 free meal at one of the on site buffet restaurants (approx $30usd value) that just about covers the cost of the upgraded pass on its own. It is advertised that it is supposed to give you a 10% discount on the premium attractions (ie. scuba /snuba, dolphin experience etc). Snorkle equipement and towels are also available for free (with deposit) with the premium pass) We were surprised that after purchasing our premium pass they tried to sell us our Dolphin experience at full price. After we pointed out the discounts we were supposed to have recieved our customer service agent had to get a manager to approve this "special" discount and acted like she was doing us a favor. Regardless...this place is VERY expensive. I recall it was over $900 for 2 adults and 2 children inlcuding only one premium attraction (1/2 hour dolphin swim...) for 3 guess only (I chose to sit out due to costs). And we didn't even book through our resort which would have cost more due to transport etc. (easy access by collectivo or taxi)The park is large and clean with a very basic zoo on site. A few horses, a starving brama bull etc. There is a large area with hundreds of parrots that you can walk through which was very neat. The highlight is definitley the aquariam area (sharks, turtles, stingrays etc) Snorkle equipment rental included for free with premium pass (includes towel and locker). Best snorkleing is actually right out in the ocean along the beaches right inside the park. Wide variety of colorful fish. Literally thousands of them right outside the small inlet by the beach bar. No need to pay for the "snuba" experience as long as you are a capable swimmer. We were able to swim right around and overtop of the paid snuba participants and enjoy the same sights for free. Even my 11 year old daughter had no trouble reaching all of the best spots. Note: Not all dolphin experiences are the same. My family got a very basic experience (watch the dolphins clap etc) vs one of the other "tanks" where the dolphins were jumping out of the water overtop of people etc. Not sure what it takes to get the fancier experience, but I suspect it was either the longer booking (45mins) or perhaps just the better swimmers (our group had a 5 year old in it). The family still enjoyed this greatly. They sell a video of your experience for approx $65us after your experience. This is likely worth it as photos are only possible from the "backside" of your family members so you can't see their smiles ;) I wouldn't say I "regret" anything we did at Xcaret, but at the same time there is not a lot of reason for us to return. My girls got a few of those "experience of a lifetime" moments which are hard to put a price on, but I did find the whole thing expensive even by a Disneyland standard.

Xcaret: A great family adventure. I took my family to Xcaret. We swam the underground river and went to the show at night. The swim was terrific. We also saw pumas, jaguars and panthers in the Xcaret Zoo. Wesaw ancient Mayan Ruins. They even had a Mexican style rodeo. My family feasted likekings at the Mexican food buffet. At night, we attended the show. It was educational aswell as entertaining. It was well worth the buck. Ramon
A wonderful experience. The trainers were wonderful, and the dolphins were beautiful. The photos were very pricy.

Trainer for a day-with the dolphins the only way to learn about them. This was one of the best well organized trip I have ever been on. Learning everything you ever wanted to know about dolphins , their behavior , health, evolution overall care. The whole day was quite busy and the amazing caring attendants who all love these beautiful intelligent mammals made me feel when I left the compound that the dolphins have a very good life , they are happy and well cared for.

A Day Well Spent. I have been to Xcaret twice and both times I had a blast! There is so much to see and do it really takes all day to do it. The snorkeling in the river/cave is a fun experience for sure! My hubby and I also enjoyed the aquarium as there really was so much to see. We booked this as a tour and opted to skip the night show. I had seen the night show on a previous visit and figured once was enough.We found our meal vouchers and drink vouchers to be useful as everything was a wee bit expensive. The gift shops are great and offer something for everyone. I bought my son a cute stuffed sting ray from the aquarium gift shop as they had tons of stuff for smaller children. I would definitely go back next time I'm in the area!

Good, but expensive........ I visited the attraction in December with my kids. They did enjoy the activities, but I felt some how it was far too expensive for the real time they spend with them. They had a talk about the animals, and after that did some tricks with them. The word Swimming is totally overrated !!!Be aware that the pictures they take are very very expensive. Try to negotiate with them and you will get a better price at the end.

Really nice place.. Be prepare to spend the entire day as there is many attractions and activities to see and do. It is quite expensive to eat and drink but - whatever, you are prepared for that beforehand. The 6:00 PM show is a must.

Amazing fun. All I can say is you have to go.Lots to do in the price of your ticket and the evening show is amazing.Some of the animal pens aren't great but they are doing a fairly good job with release programmes.
A once in a lifetime experience. Swam and interacted with 3 dolphins Gone from the resort for approximately 3 hours so you aren't away from the resort for the entire day.

Absolutely Beautiful and Breathtaking!!. I traveled to Xcaret with 7 other adult family members. The park is absolutely beautiful with every turn that you take. This is my 3rd visit to Xcaret. I have always bought the plus with buffet and snorkeling. I do have to say the snorkeling equipment being at the front of the park and then having to carry around or go all the way back to return was a disappointment and time consuming. It was much more convenient to pick up your equipment right where you were snorkeling and then return it there. This was the only disappointment though. The park has much to offer for all ages. The view is worth the trip. Having the different restaurants was nice this time. Loved our trip.

Dolphin swim should be experienced at least once, wherever you happen to do it. The staff at Delphinus were very good at educating us about the dolphins, and they spoke English quite well. There are probably better dolphin experiences out there, but it was something I've always wanted to do. The pictures they took were phenomenal - I have to give the photographer credit. The high-end video/picture package was expensive ($209), but made manageable by sharing the cost with my 3 companions.

Holy ripoff, Aquaman!!. I'll make this review short-and-sweet. At US$160/person to swim with dolphins, this was an expensive excursion. Admittedly the experience was AMAZING and something I'll never forget -- the dolphins seemed well-cared for and well-treated, and the trainers were good. The "foot push" trick (where the dolphins push you, floating face-down, through the water until you're going fast enough to stand up), was incredible.And that's when they get you. After the experience is over, you are ushered into a room with video monitors to relive the experience all over again. There you are getting kissed by a dolphin, petting a dolphin, or singing with a dolphin -- heart-strings are fully tugged. You can't have a camera or video camera in the water with you, however, so at that point your "guide" takes out a pricelist. How much does a memory cost? The cheapest option is US$29 for each 8x10 picture that the staff takes. Full CDs and DVDs of your experience run in the hundreds of US dollars, EACH, so you could easily drop over $500 if you're not careful.

Great, with some complications. The experience overall was great, except when we arrive we paid to go and swim with the dolphins which would be happening in a few hours from then. In the mean time our guide said that we would have time to snorkel in the underground river before the dolphins, when we were done and went to the dolphins we were late just barely and they told us we could be apart of it. We were informed that we couldnt get a refund under any circumstances because it was their policy. We asked to be put in another show, because insisted that we would make it time wise, but their were no spaces available. They told us that we cold upgrade to a show in which we could do more things with the dolphins, otherwise our money was lost. We paid alot, just to be taken for fools and our money. Its very sad because other than that the time we had there was really great.
Day trip to xcaret. Massive and not very well signposted, difficult to do in a day
Amazing!. Everything, especially the evening show. Do not miss this experience.

Beautiful, Park – Plenty to do for 1 day, Without High Priced Add Ons. Visited this park on Tuesday 1/17/11 after reviewing the web site and many positive reviews here on trip advisor. I wouldn’t call the park busy during this time period as we were able to do just about anything without a wait or crowd. This park has “plenty” to do for 1 day without paying for any of the high priced upgrades like swimming with sharks or dolphins. The only upgrade we did was the “plus” package. For like another $29 it offered a buffet with softdrinks and 1 beer, towels and snorkeling gear. There is also a “plus” area of the park for the people that pay for this service where you do the lockers, changing rooms, etc. Defiantly worth the extra. We booked the tour with our airport transportation provider Trafictours.Transportation – The transportation to the park is a lot longer than on the way home. We were picked up in the hotel zone at 7:20 AM and didn’t arrive at the park until probably 9:00 AM. They had our name on a list along with a wrist band that identified our package and name (this was used to scan into the park). It’s only about 35-40 miles to the park from the Hotel Zone, however once the charter bus (very nice and clean) picks you up you go to a depot area where you get on the bus for the Xcaret park. They pick up in the zones for many parks, meet at the depot and then put you on the bus that goes to your assigned park. They did offer you two times to leave…once around 5:00 PM and if you stayed for the night show the last bus left at 8:40 PM. (Night show ended at 8:05 PM). When you exit the guides ask you where your going (in our case hotel zone) then they put you in a line where you tell the next guide your hotel name and he tells you what bus number to get on. We where home in about 50 mins as we where the 2nd stop in the hotel zone. Travel times will vary obviously based on your pickup position. Very well organized.Park – Very beautiful park, very clean and well maintained. If you have been to an aquarium or zoo a lot of this will be review. We saw monkey, Jaguars, turtles (very small to very large), deer, flamingos, etc. The beaches are nice at the top of the park by the ocean, you can relax and have a beer and float in the tubes. The unique attraction to this park appears to be the underground river. That was pretty cool, takes about 45 mins to get to the end. They have a very nice system for this. At the beginning of the river they have a stand where you get a very large canvas duffle bag with a lock. You add all your belongings and they lock it give you the key and take it to the end of the river (river starts at the front of the park and ends at the top near the ocean). It’s there when you arrive. Good to add a few bucks in there as we had to walk back and get some money as we didn’t know who good this system would be. One caution note that they don’t warn you about when you enter. The bottom of the river is VERY VERY ROCKY! Be careful. We didn’t snorkel through the river (also glad we didn’t) so we didn’t have any foot protection.
