I didn’t see any snorkel value until you get to the snorkeling lagoons up near the ocean side of the park. Also, the pathways at this park are not smooth pavement, I could see where it would be difficult to maneuver with a stroller. Also, this park doesn’t have many rails, so watch your young kids very very close.Food – We ate up at one of the restaurants up by the water. Buffet had just about everything on it, along with many desserts. Some of the food we tried was great and some no t so great. I guess that’s the beauty of a buffet. Service was decent. We didn’t try any of the misc food stands around the park. Had we not had the plus package I think the buffet was $22.00 USDNight Show – Many people rave about the night show and that’s why we stayed as well. The theater was nice, the costumes are amazing, the talent at the show was top notch. The 1st ½ of the show is awesome, you witness a couple Mayan sporting events, once of which is played like hockey with a ball of FIRE!. I was so pumped after the 1st half to see the 2nd. And then the 2nd half starts. This is where you have to have an open mind to the culture. It was ALL music and dance. Like I said before the talent was great, the costumes are wonderful, but I personally absolutely hated the 2nd half. That’s just me.

Dolphins. Best experience ever never seen my wife n kids smile like that 1 hour with them as a family of 5 quite expensive but worth it you will only do it once in your life do it in there own environment best day ever topped by the majesty of the sea turles fab 1 off the bucket list

Dolphin trainer for a day fantastic!. Go for the best and be a dolphin trainer for a day - you spend hours with different dolphins not only getting great photos and video taken of you, but you also learn way more about dolphins than you'd ever expect. Delphinius definitely takes great care of the dolphins and it was such a pleasure to see them in action. Definitely a highlight of my trip!

two great days at Xcaret. We loved it so much that we took advantage of a discounted rate for a 2nd day valid within 6 business days. Couldnt experience the entire park in 8 hours. Our 4 year old daughter loved the butterfly conservatory. My wife and I loved swimming in the ocean pools and enjoyed the many shows and cultural activities and pyramids. We ate at two different buffets.... bothe excellent compared to our hotel.
Fun for everyone. All the events, paid or included in the park price are amazing, fun and well though out. Park is impeccably clean and food is fantastic. Beautiful!

Excellent Attraction. We stayed at the hotel next door and the park was within walking distance. Alot to see in one day. Our son did the inderground snorkeling and we did the river tour. Lots of very interesting history and excellent beach facilities. l
Swimming with dolphins. A dream come true for my daughter. Having an hour to spend with these friendly creatures was fabulous fun.

The Six Flags of exotic Zoos... but Sea Trek was worth it. Sea Trek was the culprit of our experience. 40ft (ish) under water in the Carribean Sea. I was scared (claustrophobia) but their introduction video prepared me to do it. I would do it again!If you buy an excursion, plan to go directly to the "must-see" attractions of your day. Xcaret is WAY TOO BIG to visit everything in 1 day.Great attraction for family, although it gets chaotic at times... Especially around the locker room area. Many languages, many cultures, kids, tight areas, everyone rushing around... Bring patience! :)I recommend you go to the Xcaret tour which oversees the Xplor park and Xcaret. Really nice! Also, if you have the time to stay for the show at night, (it is not an additional cost - at least for us it wasn't) I recommend it. The 1st part of the show takes you through the eras of Mexico (mayans and Spain empire taking over...) and it's a great overview of the country's culture. We did not stay for the whole show, as we wanted to skip the chaos at the bathrooms and souvenir stores before getting on the bus... Something to think about!

We had a great day here. We stayed next door at the Occidental Grand, so getting there was easy. We did the tower ride which is included in the entrance- not thrilling, but a nice view.We did not have time to see a lot in the park, because we had an appointment to swim with the dolphins.... We did the river snorkel which was cool, if you know a few things first!!If you take your own snorkeling gear, that is great- life jackets are provided. Bring your own towel, or make sure you get one before you get into the river to put with your stuff. We sis not do this and had to drip dry. Since the water is a little bit cooler, it was a bit cold to not have a towel when you get out!WE looked at many of the little exhibits, before we went to the beach area to have lunch. I thought the prices were reasonable, and you can't pay for the view! We did the Delphinus experience- expensive and not a part of Xcaret, to finish our day!

Good family park, overpriced though. Has an excellent beginner snorkeling lagoon and manmade underground river where you swim for a half mile. Has a nice mexican themed show at night. Meant for families for sure.If youre more adventurous go to xelha or somewhere else. The bore factor kicks into place in two or three hours.Other attractions are underwhelming like a petting zoo with mainly farmhouse cattle, chickens, and horses. Theres a parrot show and some two story mayan ruin site.Entry is $ 109 per adult with lunch and snorkel rental. Despite this, all the good activities like snuba, dolphin swimming, shark handling are extra (about $50 each activity per person). It adds up. My advice is to pay the basic entry price of 59, eat in playa del carmen (about fifteen min away), and bring your own snorkel gear (fins, mask, and snorkel will cost you $25 so it is still cheaper than the 109). Or get a discount through a time share presentation; I paid 70.....thank you enrique.

What an amazing experience. We went swimming with the dolphins at Delphinus in November 2011. You spend1 hour in the water in little groups of 4 and you go through several tricks including the famous foot push ond the dolphins jumping over your head from your back. You have to live it to understand it! WOW! I'm 51 and felt like 12 for an hour. It is a quite expensive attraction but it's a one in a life time thing to do. Obviously, you will not want togo back home without pictures...and they knot it. $110.00 for a CD of all the pictures theytook of you seems exagerate. We told them by the way during the survey they make at the exit. Nonetheless, they experience is well worth it.Daniel CJoliette, QC

the evening show....a "don't miss". the park is great, but all by itself, the evening show is a top "don't miss"...hundreds of people put on this extravaganza and a first class production. You can buy seperate ticket just for the evening show.
.. Good quality/clean water and good experience overall

Great Sea Park!!. Kind of Disney style park. Yo will be able to experience sea and under ground river walks. Great experience to relax. Show at the end pf the day its worth the visit. Go to the Yacateca food restaurant for a mexican food experience

A memory never to be forgotten!! <3. Dolphins are my pride and joy! & during my stay in riviera Maya me and my boyfriend booked a trip to Delphinus it cost around $320 and as far as money goes it was worth the cash!! It was not my first time with swimming with the dolphins as I have swam with them twice before however it was my boyfriend's first time. During his encounter with the dolphins I have never seen him look so amazed by the beautiful sea creatures. If you love experiences to remember you will love this trip. You will want to do it again and for longer. The dolphins are in a natural environment and seem very happy. They are also known for their breeding association which generally means family's are kept together. The dolphin we had experience with was called Alexa and the trainer was called Christine, both were fantastic and very relaxed. I highly recommend this experience as it's a memory to never been forgotten. X

Dolphin Swim, Good Family Park. U.S. dolphin swim programs I've seen, like SeaWorld, only let you sit on a platform. This place lets you actually swim with the dolphins and have them push you through the water! The park side is also casually enjoyable, but when they give you parrots to hold for a photo they annoyingly block your personal camera so the only photo you can get is with their camera. They have an underwater river and a cultural night show.
Check out. The history of Mexico, the animals, the birds, the sealife, the hammocks.
Fabulous. Swam with the dolphins best experience of my life want to work there beautiful animals would do it again in a heart beat

A great time!. If you want a fun dolphin experience with animals that are well taken care of and staff that really enjoy what they do, this is the place. They are well organized and run a great program!
chheaper than other parts. it was a nice experience for my doughthers and friends , there was a discount from hertz we use

Money making attraction!. I was reluctant to go to Xcaret but as we were travelling from Europe, we did want to experience some adventure parks and Xacaret "seemed" like the best option when travelling with a four year old...First the positive, the place is very well organized, is clean and most of the staff was friendly... the evening show was really entertaining, the food was good but not great.Negatives: fortunately our boy didnt pay an entrance fee because he didnt enjoy himself much... lots of walking, the river adventure didnt offer much aside from lazy swimming for 35 minutes...to the other end of the park... the ride is well organized, you leave all your stuff (they recommend you not to leave anything fragile inside) in a bag and they transport it to the river exit however, if you make the mistake of leaving something important & fragile (such as sunglasses or camera) in your locker, you will need to walk about 20 minutes to collect those items... My wife booked the very expensive 30 minute swim-with-the-dolphin-experience... i would rather call it, have-a-photo-with-the dolphin experience... there was little swimming and the MAIN objective of the staff was for you to have pictures taken so that they could sell you for a staggering 29 dollars a photo! My wife who was really looking forward to the experience was VERY DISAPPOINTED.
THE BEST DAY FOR YOUR MONEY. Beautiful experience lots to do and learn here see magnificent animals up very close and personal would go again in a heartbeat

Very Cool But a Long Day. My wife and I booked an excursion here with a travel company and we would not do that again. The place is awesome but the bus has to fill up before bringing everyone to the place and this means that you have to stop at every resort along the way. This would not have been a big deal but when we were tired and ready to go home we had to stop at every resort to drop everyone back off at their resort. If you are going to do this, do it with a taxi or some sort of per-arranged transportation. We started out our day at 10 am and we did not return until 11 pm. My wife was tired and not happy.... Give it a try but do not get stuck there....

Day trip to Xcaret. Long day but enjoyed what we saw. The river snorkelling was too crowded and really not alot to see. Don't do this when all the buses arrive at the same time. The river raft was enjoyable. Evening show was great, and not to be missed. The view from the tower was worth going up. Great organization and help if you need directions. Worth going to.
Excelent outdoor adventure!. Wow, what an amazing time you will have here. So many animals and sea life to see. Snokel in the beautiful water if you can.

Love, love, loved this!. We spent a whole day here with our kids, 7 and 9 yrs and loved every minute of it, we only wish we had more time to explore more. It is a big place and there is so much to see and do.  We got the plus package from our hotel which was pricey but worth it. For the extra $$ you get a locker, snorkeling equipment and one visit to one of the restaurants there. It was nice to just be able to lock all our bags up and walk around with just the essentials. The restaurant we ate at was the Mexican buffet which I have to say was one of the best I have been to and we got to watch an Equestrian show while we ate. As we were staying there the whole day we brought light lunch snacks with us from the hotel and just ate a big meal at around 5 as we wanted to make the the evening performance at 6.We walked around and saw all the animals first and then did the snorkeling down the river, which was recommended to us by the hotel. I only wish we had left a little more time to do the snorkeling as there are two waterways that you can do and we only had time to do one, which was the underground caverns one, so by 3pm it was getting cold. The trip down the river takes about 45 mins to an hour. Our kids really did enjoy it though. The setting is fantastic, like a zoo but better than any zoo I have been to. Our highlights were the butterfly farm, the turtles - from babies to huge giant ones, the Aviary was amazing - so many birds and some really funny chatty ones, the aquarium was also beautiful. The flying men were unbelievable and worth going to see if you have not seen them up close before. The Mayan village is also pretty interesting to walk through and has little stalls to buy stuff, we didn't and didn't feel the usual pressure to buy.We didn't spend much time at the beach area as we thought we can do that at our hotel but it was clean and looked gorgeous. Restaurant right there and inner tubes for playing at the beach.The night show was fantastic and I highly recommend it, our kids were especially entertained by the fireball hockey game which was played barefoot!!

Once in a lifetime experience. Swimming with Dolphins is something you have to do once in your life, a must in your bucket list. Delphinus got it right! There are 2 packages you can get. The 45 minute group of 8 or 10, and the 1 hour group of 4. Belive me when I tell you, even though its more expensive its worth the money. The cheaper package will cost you more if you think about it, you have to wait for 8 or 10 people to do an activity with the dolphin, so really you get only a few minutes of actual dolphin time. If yo just want to say yuo were in the water with a dolphin, this is the package for you. My wife and I got the more exclusive package, it was us 2 and a lady. the 3 of us and a dolphin for a whole hour!!! It was very hands on and it felt like it wasnt going to end. We got plenty of playtime with the dolphin and had a blast. I felt bad for the folks on the other pool standing there waiting and looking. Then we got the pictures and the video, and that was expensive too. But, its a once in a lifetime experience, you dont swim with dolphins everyday, and the memories last a lifetime, so if your going to do Delphinus, go all out and do it right. We spent almost $500 there and it was worth every penny.

Excelent attraction, a lot of things to do. You can swim with dolphins but all the things around in the park are so beatiful dolphins are not a must, but a part of visiting Xcaret. The price is not so high if you take in consideration all the things you have, attend the night show in Xcaret.

XCARET, Better than Sea World. We took our kids here when they were little and they loved it. They STILL loved it even though they are 17 and 19! Swam with the dolphins, amazing experience. STAY for the show, it is great. We rented a car and saved on transportation costs, a great alternative, easy to navigate.

An animal and nature lovers paradise.. This is the second time we have gone to Xcaret. Again, we loved visiting. The interaction with animals we never see in Canada, and close-up experiences make Xcaret so special. The trek through the park, going from one attraction to the next, is a beautiful experience in itself. The turtle sanctuary is cool as well as the display on their life span. In this area you can see sharks, dolphins, and an amazing aquarium. There are other areas to see dolphins as well closer to the beach. There are many more interesting animals to visit in this vast park. To the left of the entrance there are several buildings that are beautiful and tell the story of how Mexicans lived a hundred years ago. On the parameter of this attraction are stables where you can interact with horses and their ponies. One pony followed me around the pen to keep scratching his neck and clearly liked human contact. We decided to call him "Chomppy" because he like to nip at my shift.In addition to animal experiences, there are a lot of beautiful botanical displays on the grounds. There are plenty of places to eat - everything from snacks to a full course meal. The gift shops are terrific - but I have a thing for gift shops. Make sure you visit the mining caves in the main gift shop at the entrance. There is also a wine cellar that you get to by going through an under ground tunnel. More little gems like the underground mining track are sprinkled through the park. If you don't look around and just march through areas to get to a display, you are likely to miss most of the interesting aspects of Xcaret. Tips: 1) There are lockers that you can rent for cheap.2) You can rent snorkeling equipment for about $10. You can also rent towels. Be aware that these close at 5pm even though the park is open until 9pm.3) Make sure you catch the main show at 8pm. If you don't see this, it is said that you have not truly experienced Xcaret.4) Be sure to bring sunscreen and bug repellent.

Would not recommend...Overpriced and Underdelivered!. My husband and I were looking forward to the experience of swimming with the dolphins. We paid about $109 per person with a $20 rebate for each person. We took the 45 minute option; however, you can also choose the hour swim too which was about $159 per person. There is a shuttle that picks you up from the hotel. We arrived about two hours early. I felt the whole experience was rushed and the staff was not personable. We watched a 15 minute video of what not to do when swimming with the dolphins. Then, a staff member comes in after the video and explains the exact same information. When you're in the water, it feels like the experience is rushed. We had a total of seven people in our group (four of them were children). So naturally, the experience was geared more towards then (which I understand). The staff member will rush you to where you need to swim to next and when you need to pose for the next picture. Afterwards, someone will take you up to see the photos and video. We thought we could take a camera in to take our own picutres. That is not true. You will not be able to take a camera into the attraction. To purchase one photo, you'll pay $30 USD. We could have taken the package of all the photos and video (for two swimmers b/c you can also just buy the package for one swimmer). However, the package was $169! The gift shop was also underpar. I was looking forward to getting a gift for a friend there who loves dophins. What better place to buy a gift, right? No...there were some t-shirts for kids, stuffed animals, some necklaces and other small items in a corner of the store. I was really disappointed with the whole experience. We went with a family of four (husband, wife and two kids) who said they spent close to $1,000 on the whole experience including admission and photos. I was disappointed with the experience and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Absolutely Fabulous. We Booked the Primax which meant that we interacted with the dolphins on and off a platform, kiss, hug and also be propelled through the air by a foot push, the experience was worth every penny it was a wonderful hour and a half, We danced with dolphins, had a water fight it was an awesome experience.The only disapointing thing about this was the price of the photos afterwards, we were not allowed cameras into the area they had to be locked up in lockers. The photos are an astronomic price and spoiled it in a way as the trip itself cost over a hundred pounds.
Loved it. Was great swimming with the dolphins and interacting with them, the sad thing was we couldn't afford any photographs of our experience, it was so expensive!

Must do while in Playacar. We were fortunate enough to visit Xcaret during their "Dia de los Muertos" festivities. It was definitely worth it. We purchased the Xcaret plus. We ate at Dos Playas restaurant overseeing beach area and dolphin experience. Food here was surprisingly DELISH! Totally hit spot after our swin at "rio subterraneos." It also started raining a lot so we were able to sit their enjoy views and relax. We didn't get to see whole park. :-( But we got to see displays of dia de los muertos and the night show that is a must see. I would definitely visit Xcaret again when I return to Playa de Carmen.
Fun for the whole family.. We particularly enjoyed the subterraneous river and cave, and the beach. The place is clean, easy to navigate and interesting. Food is good too.

Amazing place. Xcaret is definately a place you should not miss. One day is not enough to see and do everything here.The park is easy to travel round and well laid out. There's lots to keep you occupied even if you are not a swimmer.If you are a swimmer, then the underwater experiences are amazing. There is an extra charge for some of the stuff - swimming with dolphins, walking on the sea bed etcI loved the wildlife photography opportunities and came away with hundreds of photos.The evening show is spectacular but there is a mad dash for the exit at the end of the evening.You can get a half price entry ticket for another day if you purchase it whilst you are there ( having paid full price for one ticket). It's well worth doing this as there is so much to see.The Peninsula restaurant is a fabulous place for lunch - self service buffet with the biggest selection of seafood dishes.

Once in a lifetime experience. It was a fabulous, once in a lifetime experience to be able to swim with the dolphins. We got to interact with them (dancing, shaking "hands," kissing, etc) and we got to "ride" on one as well. The only downfall is the price they try to charge you if you want any pictures of your experience! They won't let you bring a camera, and the prices are outrageous! Be prepared to pay a lot if you want any memories of this trip.

Very Nice ECO Park. Lots to see and do for couples and familes..undergound river and snorkeling were great as well as Jaguar and Mayan Village site. Buffet was excellent (included in the Xcaret plus package) rates vary. Chose not to stay for the show at night or the optional dinner (39 USD)...it would have been a very long 14 hour day if we had, but we understand both our great if you have the endurance. Young family would probably not last that long. But this should be part of your vacation plans, especially for young families

If there's one thing you do while in the area go to Xcaret!. We did not participate in the Dolphin attraction at Xcaret but we did enjoy the park. This was my second time at Xcaret, my mom and sister came to Mexico with me this trip... I knew there was one attraction I absolutely wanted them to see and it was Xcaret.The park is phenomenal, when we first arrived we swam the underground river. From there we started touring the park which has so many things to see and do. From the massive aquarium, bird sanctuary, cemetery, jaguar and puma exhibit, the many restaurants, turtle area, beaches, coves to snorkel in, natural pools to swim in and much more. The end of the day is a spectacular performance in their massive open-air theatre which showcases the history of Mexico and the many different traditional music and dances from the different states through out the country, amazing.If there's one thing you do while in the area, do yourself a favour and go to Xcaret.It's cheaper if you purchase your own tickets on the internet before you go, if you purchase them three days or before you will get 10% off admission. Then if you are in Cozumel you can take the ferry over to Playa del Carmen and get a taxi to Xcaret. The last ferry going back to Cozumel departs at 10:00 pm so make sure you're back at the ferry terminal by 9:30 pm. If you are in Playa del Carmen just get your own taxi, we paid $13 USD one way. There are many taxi's waiting outside of Xcaret at the end of the day, you need to pay the person at the taxi booth for a ticket back to Playa del Carmen.Make sure to visit Xcaret, you will thank yourself for doing so.

Great day!. I loved the river through the cave, the wildlife, and the beach. I especially liked the International buffet! The food was amazing. In addition. Make sure that you bring bug spray because the mosquitoes will kill you. My only complaint is waiting for my bus to pick me up.....The day was so long and you're stuck there until the bus comes.
dolphins brilliant. what can i say. dolphins brilliant, staff mostly ok.buying photos rip off. rip off $168 dollar for complete set. really a Mexican thing

Amazing. We were there with family and it was just the 4 of us with 2 dolphins and 1 trainer and it was awesome! Just to be in the water with them was amazing. There is a time when you just float and the dolphins swim by you and touch you and you touch them, AMAZING!

Nice Park. We didn't do any of the dolphin stuff but we did walk around and did all of the included activities. We swam through the underground river, snorkelled in the lagoon and just walked around. The food here was AMAZING!!!! For the first time on our trip I was happy with my food. Too bad we had chosen to go to X Caret the day before we left.

Great place to spend a day--or two!. Our family visits Xcaret on every trip to the area, and it remains one of our favorites. Recently we have been getting the second-day half price deal, as one can't really see everything in one day. Leave extra time for finding your way around, as the trails can be confusing at first to navigate. We have enjoyed the swimming with the dolphins, and the underground river is a treat we look forward to on a hot day. The evening show is something to experience, and be sure to find a program that explains everything. There are many fun opportunities to learn about the floral and fauna of the region, as well as how Xcaret handles the park ecologically. Highly recommended.

swimming with dolphins underground rivers. This place is amazing first time I've swam with dolphins and the service was the best I've ever had in the restaraunt the selection of food was huge and it was freshly cooked and served couldn't ask for a better place to go.

different but not as fun as expected. went here several weeks ago as part of our holiday to Cancun.Overall it was ok, there is a place called Xplore and Xel-Ha which are very similar to this place so I would recommend you do one but not all, we did Xel-Ha aswell as we went to Swim with Dolphins at the same venue, I believe Xcaret also do this trip. We booed a Xcaret plus trip which was advertised as use of lockers, snorkelling gear, buffet lunch and unlimited soft drinks. The locker and snorkelling gear is lcoated at the Xcaret plus area, quite easy to find. From here you get undressed for snorkelling in an underground area and put expensive items in the locker and keep the key with you. You also get a "bag" to put in towels, shoes etc that they take to the end of the underground snorkelling tour and its locked by you and you keep the key so nobody can get into it . We proceeded down to the underground start, its abit of a shambles and theres lots of people trying to get into a small "river" type area which you follow round and see loads of different things, theres several people taking pictures, please be warned part of the tour goes into REALLY dark caves, not good if, like me your are not great with the dark, me being about nervous in water also didnt help, butr you have several points inwhich you can get out if it gets to much. Once you get to the end you collect your bag and then can walk back to the start area of the other items in the locker, why they didnt just create the tour to start and end in the same place I did wonder but it was a nice thing to do, tiring though!After this we went and had lunch, went into the Mexican buffet, as we were told unlimited soft drinks I asked for a large lemonade, only to be told large couldnt be ordered and lemonade was not part of the deal!? I just had a small and I stress small coke, that was all we were allowed, no refills. Food was quite nice, go in early as it can get busy. after lunch we visited the beach and butterfly farm, we were given the option of staying for the evening show or go late afternoon, we decided to go early as we were tired and didnt want to pay for an evening meal to stay as the evening show did not end until 8pm time and being 2 hrs away we thought it was best to leave early.Overall its quite a nice place to go, was not happy at the "unlimited soft drinks" con, we had to buy drinks in the afternoon, we did the same all inclusive deal at Xel-ha and there they had a drinks area where you could help yourself, this is what Xcaret needed to really make it "all inclusive". Would I recommend you go-yes I think its worth a look, as mentioned above Xel-Ha is similar and Xplore which we did not do looks to offer the same kind of thing. I would recommend you go to one of them, I would prefer to go to Xel-Ha as its more catered for snorkelling however Xcaret does have a nice butterfly farm and has other things to see that doesnt involve getting wet whereas Xel-Ha is mainly being is water so its down to personal choice.

amazing!!!!!!!. beautiful place it is a nature conservatory that offers animals, underground rivers, scuba diving snorkelling, authentic markets and restaurants and a breathtakingly beautiful beach. Bring lots of sun screen a hat and a waterproof camera! Do not skip the light show it is awesome it depicts the history of mexico and is a once in a lifetime experience.

Amazing. Swam with Dolphins for 60 minutes and it was really amazing, the foot push was out of this world, danced/kissed/touched etc with these wonderful animals and got the DVD and pictures to keep for ever as well as the memories. Would highly recommend for you to do.

Wonderful Day Trip. We went to Xcaret and had so much fun. The park has so much to see we didn't get around to seeing it all. Snokeling in the underground river was a blast. The big show that night was beyond our expectations. We also had dinner at the show and the food was absolutely delicious. We ate the mexican buffet and could not believe all the food provided on the buffet and so so very good. It gave us a good choice of the local mexican food in the region. The transportation to and from the resort was on time and the guide on the bus was very informative to us about the park before we arrived. Don't miss going to this and be sure and buy the Xcaret Plus package - it provides so much more than paying for each individual thing.

Best Place to See While In Cancun. This place is awsome. I booked a trip to Xcaret from the travel agent at the hotel I was staying at and got a good deal with out any rippoffs for Xcaret and Xplor. In my oppinion this is a must do while in Cancun. The park was pretty cool so expect to be there the whole day. We rented a car so we didnt have to pay for the tour bus down there and we were able to go and leave on our own time. Plus its a cool drive down there. Well about the park. We first got there and it was a gorgious park. The scennery there was awsome. We went snorkling through the cenote in the clear cool water. It was very nice. I have to say the most exciting part of it was snorkling through natural waters through the cenote. I think I saw only one fish swimming by me and it wasnt tropical looking at all. I just wish there were more natural fish in the water to see. Other than swimming and snorkling through the Cenote it wasnt all that. The rest of the park had a lot of good shows to see. There was the horses show and a native american ritual on top of a todum pole. The park was more to introduce tourist with the Mexican and Indiginous peoples coultures. Also, Xcaret had a lot of things to see such as a church with a cemetary on top, some Mayan Ruins, a tower that rotated 360 degrees up hundreds of feet in the air over looking the carribian, the deep forest, and also the entire park. It was a great view. Also in the beach area of the park was awsome. It seemned like a resort in its own right, As soon as we got to that area we decided to hang out there for a while and ended up taking a nap in the shade along the beach. Awsome!! At night there was the main attraction which made evey thing worth it. Just the show alone was well worth the money and the trip there. This show was a timeline of over 500 years of Mexico's history. The show started out with an awsome ceremony by the Mayans and continued to display a brief show of their lifestyles. It showed two different Mayan tribes comming together then organizing the infamous Mayan ball game. They played the ball game amazing us by how they were able to make the ball in the hole using their hips. The Mayan's played hockey with balls of fire. An AWSOME show. They also showed the comming of the European Spaniards and how they spread catholosism to the indiginous peoples. They showed the war between the settlers and the Mayans. Moreover, the show continued with evolution of the Mexican culture, flokoriko, banda, Tejano culture, Marriachis, and also still some hints of Indiginous dances. It was a great peacefull natural park with a some great shows. Must see and do if you are in Cancun or Playa De Carmen!!

Good Park for family. We went to Xcaret for a full day. The park is beautiful and big. The underground tunnel is great, really cool water. If you buy all inclusive, you should go to the buffet at the seafood restaurant. The Mayan show at night is alright, a lot of singing.
great day out not to be missed. there is so much to do on this trip for everyone of all ages excellent value for money

Xcaret Plus is the best thing to do in Riviera Maya. Wow! Awesome operation throughout Xcaret and the Plus package with the evening show is terrific. Also, the Plus package includes an excellent buffet dinner at one of 4 theme restaurants.

An experience of a lifetime. One visit is just not long enough to see and do all that's available at Xcaret Mexico. I was on holiday with my sister, and lets say we are both ladies over 50 but loved every minute of our experience. Firstly we snorkeled for the first time in an underground river which was a challenge for my sister as she is not a strong swimmer but she felt safe as a life jacket and all the equipment is provided by Xcaret. Secondly we did a Sea Trek and for those who dont know what this is it's a walk along the sea bottom not with scuba gear but a very large helmet that is fitted for you with experienced divers guiding you every step of the way. Xcaret is an adventure park come zoo with a night show to boot! There are plenty of places to eat and drink with the full flavours of Mexico, take plenty of money as you will be tempted by all the shops that sell traditional Mexican arts, crafts food and drink. If you fancy it you can swim with the dolphins or just watch the show they put on, or just take it easy on the beach in a hammock. I could just go on and on about this p[lace but my advise is if you visit Cancun Mexico then book this as one of your trips it's worth every penny .

One of the koolest attractions in the Playa Del Carmen area. Xcaret is an all day attraction, come early and stay late night.It is a water attraction and living history park, so plan on getting wet.Bring a swim suit and clothes for later; they provide everything else.You must stay for the evening stage show, it is the best in the world!!!Make it a dinner theater by including supper.Not an inexpensive place to visit but the whole family can go home with memories for a lifetime!!!

Amazing adventures at Xcaret. We visited Xcaret in June 2011 with my 5 and 6 year old and my parents. My 5 year old loves the water and she loved Xel-Ha, but my 6 year old is not a water fan and absolutely loved Xcaret. The evening show with the natives re-enacting the Spanish conquest was phenomenal. We can't wait to go back. We did the all inclusive package because that is what worked for our family and it was very smooth, from transportation to all the food. For an all inclusive deal, the food wasn't bad.

Beautiful park but be extremely mindful of the costs and what it involves. Going to Xcaret can be a unique experience. All the attractions seem to be "out of this world". This place is awsome, but only if you haven't got a limited budget! It is outrageously expensive!It is expensive to get in (around US$99) with a discount from the hotel (more expensive at the door). Once you are in there are several attractions that are included which were all nice such as the underground river, that was fantastic! Unfortunately, We did not have sufficient time to see much more as we got to the park at 11.15am, swan with dolphins (extra), went for lunch, went to see some animals (turtles, tigers, black panther, deers, aquarium, etc), went on the underground river and by the time we finished we had to return the snorkling equipment and get ourselves dried and ready for the 7.30pm show. I wish we had had more time to see the butterflies, spend time in the water with inflatable rings, etc.If you are planning to go to Xcaret, it is worth paying a bit extra to get all the equipment (snorkling, flippers, life jacket, towel, locker, etc) and very important: lunch. The restaurants are all nice and the food was just LOVELY 10/10! Fantastic restaurants with a wide range of food!Now, I would like to take the time to tell you about the minuses so you can be very mindful before you make any decisions:1) Transport: you can have a coach to collect you from the hotel. The journey from the turist area where all the hotels are is 1 hr only. Unfortunately, we were the first one to be collected and we spent an additional 2 hrs collecting other visitors from their respective hotels. We were never warned about this. We were collected at 8am and we got to the park at 11.15am! The cost of the transport is around US$15 per person but some companies that sell the excursion don't charge for the transport.If you don't mind wasting 2 valuable hours inside the coach collecting people fine. If you do and there are a few of you it is worth paying a taxi (around US$50 each way) or hiring a car which may cost you US$35 for the day but bear in mind the car park in Xcaret costs around US$40 for the day! 2) Activities: when you decide to pay for an additional activity (ie swimming with dolphins), which in my opinion are very expensive, don't believe in everything they say. We wanted to swim with dolphins. We were told by the guys who sold our tickets to get into Xcaret that for every paying adult a child goes free to go swimming the dolphis. This was not true.Don't go by what it says in the leaflet either, some pieces of information are dated and they only tell you after you've paid! And refunds are not given very easily! Can you believe it? And that's the way it is. They would not get away with it being in the UK or USA!To go swimming with dolphins we had to pay an extra amount of US$99 each with "the" discount. The leaflet read "1 hr 5 mins". After we paid we were told it was half hour only because the leaflet needed updating and the US$99 ticket did not include what seemed to be the most attractive activities of this attraction: foot push, etc. And that if we wanted that we would have to pay an additional US$49 each. After we strongly complained they reduced this cost to US$30 per person. We so badly wanted to do it that we paid!The whole thing was FANTASTIC, AWESOME, UNIQUE but it only lasted 40 mins!3) Video/photos: If you have lots of money to spend on photos and video GO FOR IT! if not, DON'T even bother looking at them. Each photo cost US$25 (digital -not printed) and a "15 mins" video costs US$59.95. In my opinion simply a "rip off".We ended up buying the video to find out that when we got home it was only 9 mins long (with perhaps 1 min of promotional images) and that most of the lovely things we did in the water with the dolphins were not in there! I presume it's an strategy to make you buy some pictures as well!I made a very nasty complain to the Customer Relations Department as I got back to London and I have to say they were very good. They responded very quickly and admitted their errors and in compensation I'm getting part of the money back and to make up for the short duration of the video we are also getting all the pictures for free!Hope this information helps you when you go there!

Xcaret is beautiful BUT not for a full day. We have travelled to Cancun many times. When we travel, we very seldom visit this type of attraction. We prefer to do our own thing. After hearing from several guests at our hotel (Palace Resorts LeBlanc) that this was "not to be missed", we reluctantly decided we should try it. ALL the hotels have the "full day" package leaving at the crack of dawn and returning long after dark. Of course, their incentive is that you not miss a thing including the dinner show at night.We were primarily interested in the underground rivers and the beach. Anything else would be lagniappe. We knew we could accomplish this in a few hours and return to the hotel in the afternoon. Therefore, we agreed to use "bonus dollars" from the hotel to book a car to pick us up at 4:30, at considerable cost.After completing the underground river exploration, we were exhausted and headed to the beach. It's a beach but not on the ocean. They have created several lagoons for swimming, nothing over your head. We sat for a few minutes and left.We were ready to go back to the hotel at 1 pm., ended up canceling the car and taking a taxi.Now a caveat. It is a beautiful attraction, very well laid out and great for kids. The food was excellent. I wish I could remember the restaurant where we had lunch. It was beautiful, had a buffet chocked full of delectable treats.Keep in mind we were there in July....HOT, HOT, HOT! It is a lot of walking and even the underground rivers take a lot of energy. ABSOLUTELY take the fins even if you don't take the snorkel. My husband did not take fins; I ended up giving him one of mine. It can also be claustrophobic in the caves. Most of the caves do not go on for long distances but a couple do.All in all, it is well done. However, I cannot even imagine staying there for 10-12 hours, especially with children.

Clean, Friendly, extraordinary day excursion for the whole family, including an 80+ senior.. The tour company arrived and departed promptly on time - this was appreciated by all. Since one of our group needed wheelchair accessibility (which was everywhere!!++) we stopped near the entrance and used the very clear maps provided to chart our day and allow the younger folks to strike out on their own. The exhibits and and staff were all exceptional and capping off our full day of swimming/snorkeling and browsing we enjoyed the spectacular finale....we arrived back at our resort exhausted and very happy. Highly recommend this spot.

Awesome way to see all of Mexico. My 13 year old son and I visited Xcaret, we loved it we got the xcaret plus which was well worth it, Just the buffet alone is worth the price. We started with a tour of the property seeing all kinds of wonderfull things, Mexican ruins, Jaguar Island, the Mexican cemetry and House of Whispers which was so cool. We then did the river I did not think I would do it but it was so hot it was a great way to cool off, It does take a while about an hour but a good way to cool off. Look out half way through when you look up you will see this amazing stained glass full of butterflies.Then it was onto the buffet a great array of delights, kept going up for more :)We saw a great display of Mayan culture that was acted out that we kind of just stumbled upon It was in the Mayan village they also had some lovely crafts that you could purchase.We did some more touring of the property and before we knew it, it was show time well worth staying for we only did the first half only because we were so tired.We had seen packages for Xcaret all over town but we decided to do it on our own the taxi from Playa del Carmen was $15 and we got the package at the door this way we could go and leave when we wanted to.I would highly recomend going here even if you had to pick just one thing to do as it showed a little bit of every aspect of natural and cultural richness of Mexico :)

Wonderful Experience. There are 4 dolphin experience programs from this company, one in Cancun and the others in the Maya Riviera. This company appears to take good care of their animals. A very high percentage of their animals are now bred in captivity as they have been in business for 20 years. The trainers seem very dedicated. This company participates in a theraputic dolphin encounter program for disabled adults and children. As a dolphin encounter experience it is a great way to meet the animals. Participants are divided into small groups-some with only 4 people and spend 50 minutes in the water with the trainer and the dolphins. There is plenty of time having the dolphins swim around the participants just for petting and interaction and they do react differently to different people. This program feels very personal and is run very smoothly from the participants point of view. Those not participating can watch family members from a viewing platform. They try to put those with family spectators closest to the viewing platform so everyone feels a part of the experience. There are lockers and towels provided. At the end of the program, participants watch a video of themselves with the dolphins as well as have the opportunity to purchase photos. Personally, I thought the photos and video overpriced but many people did buy them. I would highly recommend this attraction for everyone including children over the age of 7.

Super Fun!. SEcond time for a visit to Xcaret- the floating trip is hard to describe and oh so fun! Our 10 and 12 years and our 60+ year olds loved it and laughed all the way! Stayed for the evening production- it is a fantastic production- although very long after a day in the water and sun. Price is high but worth it for a special event. Advise to go.

Awesome!. Do not buy tickets from someone you do not know. It is much safer to buy them on Xcaret's website or in person. I strongly recommend this online because the lines are very long. You should plan ahead and get an idea of what you want to do before you get there. The park is huge and it is not so easy to navigate around. To do the snorkeling tour, you have to get your gear first, which is not located at the entrance. Also, do not bring your camera unless it is waterproof. There are bags provided that will transport your belongings while snorkeling, however the park is not held responsible if your camera breaks, like ours did.I'm not trying to be negative, this place was great! You need at least one day to spend here. The staff are friendly and bilingual, of course. I don't remember where my husband and I ate, but the food was really good.
Just ok.. Dolphin experience was amazing, beautiful property, very dissappointing animal living space. Not the ecological park we thought it was but it had its moments.

A taste of Mexico. I loved xcaret!!! All surrounded by nature, culture.. that describes a whole country !!!I think that if you visit cancun and do not go to xcaret and chichen itza is like you do not know the aim of what that part of mexico offers!!!I went with a friend to both places for a very good price ..It was a combo deal That we saw on internet ....and when we visited Xcaret we also got a dolphin swim deal and had a wonderful time!!

A GREAT EXPERIENCE. Spent the entire day with my children and grandchildren, can't say enough good things about this attraction. Come visit ..you will talk about it for weeks to come. Hint the evening show will blow you away.

Nothing but a Photo op to sell photos. The staff hurries you and your group through different stations with your dolphin. There's swimming in place and petting the dolphin, (several opportunities), dolphin giving you a kiss on the cheek, dolphin putting her snout in your hand, dancing with the dolphin (5 secs), two dolphins propelling you along the pool with their snout on your soles, two dolphins jumping over your head, and some dolphin facts (fascinating). After 45 mins, "time's up, thank you for coming, please check out your pictures and videos at the center before you leave" (center is strategically located, impossible to avoid). Photos are ridiculously expensive!

expensive, felt ripped off by photos. Went to the Primax dolphin experience on my birthday. The experience was great if a liitle bit clinical. No cameras are allowed so you are reliant on the attractions photographers. Having paid nearly £300 for the experience to then be quoted £200 for the photos was a disgrace. There was no flexibility the girl said we could buy one photo for $25 so though we would do that. Chose a phto with all three of us in to be told we couldnt buy that one could only buy the photos of us individually in poses. It would have made no difference to them but they were trying to get us to buy the whole set. A rip off which ruined the trip

Day Park attractions - a tremendous resource. Both for history, fun, underwater rafting (we didn't do it), wildlife, and best of all, the evening entertainment. Came as part of a package in our hotel, so we only spent a day, but it was colourful, fascinating and tiring. Have been recommending to friends and relatives ever since!

very good quality. We really enjoyed Xcaret; its clean and neat. The animals look well tended for and the whole park is very esthetic. Loved the show at the end of the day. A couple of things could be improved: the life jackets for the underground river swim are nit comfortable and also it would be nice to not see any junk food sold at such a place.

A fun day in a safe place. Too many things to do in 1 day. Great restaurant choices. Take time to review the package for the entrance fee, bigger is not always better. Beware of ALL-included where you'll barely use 50%.Don't go to the cenote-river floating first thing in the morning: everybody does it and it is worse than the subway at peak hours. DO go at lunch time (3pm in Mexico) or after and enjoy a peaceful ride.We would go again.

Very memorable trip. We visited Delphinus on during our honeymoon and thoroughly enjoyed the experience of being so close to these amazing animals. We booked the Primax tour, if you are hemming and hawing over which tour to choose, the foot push was my favorite activity with the dolphins. Now for the negatives, the grouping should have been organized better. We were picked up with another couple at our hotel who we got to know on the ride over and when it came to making groups we were standing with them. The guide asked who spoke English and who spoke Spanish and split us up so both of our tour guides had to first speak in English, then Spanish. The only other complaint was the price of the pictures. The cost of the CD and photos was the more than an entrance ticket of course I got both, because I swam with dolphins on my honeymoon and that doesn't happen everyday.

THEY ARE A FACADE OF ANIMAL CRUELTY. Xcaret tricks the tourist inyo going under the facade of a wannabe disney attraction, overpriced, lacks organization and extremely doubtful caring for animals and people.the manatee swim in circles in 3 meter pools and not well cared. they have a glass table of birds hatching with everyone tapping on the glass, guacamayas for picture in apparent bad shape. The staff is far from nice, which only makes me wonder if mexicans are so nice and these are mean, and animals are uncared for, is it coincidence.PLEASE DON'T GO!!!!

Great place for any age. A nice place to visit with kids and friends. An attraction for all the ages. I'd recommend to swim with the dolphins, it's magical. During the day you can visiti all the water attractions and at night they have a play about the Mexican history and culture, it's nice.

A great way to spend a day or two. Having been to Xcaret before, I found several things to do that I had missed before! This is a great place to go & spend a day or two. Don't miss the nighttime show!Only suggestion is to add more places to sit along the many paths.

I think this was the best experience in my life!!. Did the Dophin swim with my mom (83 this year) and I plus the instructor and it was fantastic. I would recommend doing that and not in a large group. We both loved it and would go again and again!!There is only one thing we paid an $109.00 to get the cd with the pictures on it and to get it home and see it was all scratched up. When I took the cd in to get copies they were not sure the pictures would come out. They did and they turned out great. So if you do get a cd I would check it out before you leave to see how it looks.

Beautiful park, family loved it.. I have been to Xcaret several times over the years.. They continue to improve it and make it better all of the time. The underground river is pretty fun, although years ago it had more of a moving current. The food is very good. The park is spread out and this time of year, it wasn't crowded at all. It was a Wednesday. They now have snorkeling tours and deep diving tours. They probably did this because the coral reef at Xcaret has basically been destroyed from all of the tourists and it is oily looking from all of the suntan lotion users. Years ago, they forbid lotion. The shows are nice, the animals are nice. A fun day for families with small kids and bigger children, as well. Worth the 45 minute drive from Cancun. Absolutely beautiful gift shop/snack shop.

Most amazing experience of my life!. Spending an hour with a dolphin and her very kind and informative trainer was amazing. We did the $149 4 people to 1 dolphin ratio experience. AWESOME!!! The female trainer was perfect and spoke excellent English. (next time we go toMexico, we'll all be speaking Spanish. WHY did I take French in high school???)Fanny the dolphin swam near us, danced with us, gave a kiss on the cheek and jumped over us! She allowed us to touch her teeth and brushed up against us like a cat. When you look in a dolphin's eyes, you can see their intelligence. Their soul even perhaps? My only compaint is about the insanely high price of pictures. For one picture with a dolphin, it's $25. To buy the whole set of pics, it was $200, maybe even $250. Just too much! We ended up getting 2 pics for $50. I wish the price was more reasonable. Another snorkling excursion gave us a whole disk of over 50 pics for just $50. What a big difference.Xcaret would be amazing in good weather. We will definitely be returning to this park during our next visit to Mexico.Tips: wear water shoes, bring a camera. Get the Plus entrance s you have lockers, towels and snorkle equip available. Buffet restaurants were wonderful. If weather is iffy, bring rain ponchos or umbrellas!

Definitely not worth the money and they are militant about no cameras.. They picked us up at our hotel on time. We stopped for 4 other couples, took about an hour extra. Once we arrived we had to wait in line with about a million German tourists that all chain smoked cigarettes, no place to hide for non smokers with small children. It was at that point that I realized that I had gotten all of my kids stuff, but forgot my own suit. I asked the girl at the changing room if there was one I could borrow, she said no. I asked if there was one for purchase, she again said no. I asked if there was a lost and found one I could use. No no no.... so I went in my shorts. Whatever. We went through the people talking about what we should do and the such. We then were rushed out to the dolphin area, got into the water and went through a 31 minute presentation, which was fun but very rushed. Our guide (female, can't remember her name) rushed us through everything and was quite impatient with us when my kids were slightly afraid at the beginning. She was very short with my kids. After the presentation, we got dressed and went to see the pictures they took of us, which were fabulous. I hoped that they would have been, as they refused to let us anywhere near the dolphins with a camera of our own. We wanted to buy a few, and when we found out the price ($25.00 EACH) I was flabbergasted. I thought that maybe they would come in a little dolphin frame and be printed on nice paper, which made it easier to swallow. So I bit the bullet and got one picture of each of my kids. Yes, folks, $75.00 for three pictures. And guess what? No frame, no paper, nothing but a cd with pictures on it. I was pretty disgusted, and we left. I decided to forget about the whole experience as it was somewhat infuriating to me that we paid $500 for the tour and another $75 for 3 pictures on a cd. I was on vacation and I wasn't going to let it ruin my fun. Well yesterday I opened up my cd to send some pictures to my family. Guess what again? NO PICURES OF MY KIDS! Thats right the cd had lots of pictures of dolphins, and guides. But none of my family. I called the company as they have a toll free number. "Sorry" they said, no refunds. I told them I just want the pictures, but they delete them after a week. Here's my advice to you. Stay away from this tourist scam. The dolphins were great, but the people SUCK!
